reviews.review: Splendid Cape Splendour. Julie at Cape Splendour organised the transfers, hotels, and experiences for our three week holiday in South Africa.The transfers were always on time, the hotels were superb and the experiences will last us a lifetime.We had three fantastic days in Tsukudu Bush Lodge in the Pilansberg Park, a unique and exciting time. The Pretoria to CapeTown Rovos Rail train journey was like stepping back in time. The service and facilities were second to none, attention was paid to every detail.The Wine tram is worth a day out. Good fun and the vineyards are really interesting, the wines good too.Julie took us to Superb vineyards, penguin colonies and drove us through the most spectacular scenery, she even managed to find some whales for us. She has a great knowledge of South African history and makes every journey inform and entertain.Thank you Julie making our stay so much fun and so much more than a holiday.

If you're thinking of touring the Cape without Julie, think again!. Julie organised the majority of our 3 week holiday in South Africa for us and our friends.From a wonderful safari to the delights of the waterside in Capetown.From hidden boutique hotels to tastes of absolute luxury. Discovering new wines and the stunning scenery that the Cape has to offer, rugged mountain backdrops, white beaches and turquoise seas. Julie drove us to all of these and showed us more than we would ever have done without her. We set Julie quite a challenge in organising this holiday of a lifetime and she more than exceeded our expectations.If you want to see everything that the Cape has to offer, call Julie, you'll love it

Cape Splendour Day Tours with Julie. I personally could not have enjoyed more our time spent with Julie on the tours she arranged for our trip. You definitely say goodbye feeling you have been visiting and touring with a longtime friend. I will recommend Julie to others planning to visit Cape Town.

Julie will guide you through a great week in Cape Town!. From Table Mountain to wine tasting to lovely lunches, Julie knows just where to go with lots of charming details along the way. She is very knowledgable and a pleasure to spend time with.
Like family!. We loved the time we spent with Julie! She was a great guide. She made it feel more like driving around with old friends or family.

Wine country splendor. We booked Julie at Cape Splendour Tours for a tour of the wine country in Cape Town. It was a magnificent experience. Julie called us ahead of time to see what kind of wines we were interested in and tailored our trip around our wine tastes. We tasted chocolates and cheeses as well. She also drove by a few sights we had not been able to see while we were touring the previous days. She is delightful to spend time with. You can't go wrong!

Julie is amazing!. i'll get right to the point: book Julie for a fabulous time in Cape Town! Julie is an amazing human being who encompasses knowledge and caring and interest and humo(u)r and personal experience and stories into her trips. she made us feel like she was just a very good friend taking us around to see everything of note in her town. what a joy!we had the pleasure of having Julie guide us for three full days; one in town, one on the Cape, and one inland in the wine country. her knowledge is expansive; but what really sealed the deal for us was her personal connection to everything. i thought that it was wonderful to be able to talk to someone with decades of local knowledge and experience; someone who really made our trip to Cape Town 'personal.'also of note is her personal tailoring of each trip. she asked, we discussed, and conclusions were made based upon our needs and wants. she really listens!i would wholeheartedly recommend Julie, and in fact i look forward to returning to Cape Town and seeing / touring with her again!

Great day with Julie. Our family did a full day Cape Peninsula tour with Julie. We had a great time. Julie was on time. Very knowledgeable about the geography and history of the region. Very engaged with our children. It was a great start off to our vacation.We also booked a transfer to Aquila Game Preserve with Julie, however she was not able to do this herself. She arranged one of her colleagues Martin to fill in for her. We knew of this well in advance. He was also great with his willingness to share his love of the region with us. We were quite fortunate to have found Cape Splendour Tours and would happily recommend.

Wonderful day tour. Julie was so good at correspondence -- arranging a private tour for 6 people from a cruise ship a year before we actually arrive. She is professional, personable, and friendly -- we had a tour of the penguins at Boulders Beach before hitting wine farms of Stellenbosch. Her choices were excellent!!! I highly recommend her services.

A Day to Remember. My girlfriend and I had an amazing Cape Peninsular day trip with Julie. Julie is a great tour guide and provided an experience which we won't soon forget. Everything happened like clock work, she was knowledgeable and could answer any questions we had, most of all she was accommodating in changing the tour slightly because my girlfriend was feeling a little ill. Overall we had a great day and experienced an amazing part of Cape Town. We would recommend Julie's services without reservation - thanks Julie!

Great day in the wine country. Julie was a wonderful guide and driver. She was very responsive and we had several discussions about what wineries to hit and what would make for the best itinerary. She was flexible and willing to pick us up at Kirstenbosch gardens instead of at our hotel, and was on time and waiting for us for our scheduled departure. The vehicle was clean and had ample room for our group (3 adults and 2 children). All of the wineries were great, but the best winery of the day was one of her suggestions - great wine, great views, and a huge lawn area where the kids played soccer and croquet. Our only regret was that we did not have more than a day to spend there.

Fantastic tour guide. We did a day tour from Camps Bay Retreat to several vineyards around Stellensbosch / Franschoek in Oct 2015 with Julie as our guide (6 adults). After a helpful discussion with Julie we decided on an itinerary at the start of the day and off we went. We had prebooked lunch at Delaire Graf so Julie made sure our route got us there for the lunch just in time. At the end of the tour we all agreed that Julie had really added value to the experience - throughout the tour she was happy to chat to us not only about the vineyards but about life in South Africa in general. She was the perfect guide for the day, full of interesting stories and background info on the places we visited - we could have listened to her all day. No hesitation in recommending her for any tour and feel a bit guilty about leaving it so long before finally getting round to writing the review (sorry Julie !!).

Wonderful trip. Sorry its taken a while to write review but we travelled with Julie on the Garden Route in mid April and had a wonderful experience. Julie is an excellent guide, knowledgeable, gave us all the information we could need and was very good company. Her vehicle is very comfortable and she is an very safe and confident driver.Nothing was too much trouble, she reacted to any changes we wanted to make on route and gave brilliant recommendations for the itinerary both before we went in the planning stage and en route.Her day to day planning was excellent, a whale viewing was timed to perfection, she even managed to stop the few rain showers we had just as we wanted to get out of the car. The accommodation selected was very comfortable and in the case of the Elephant Hide spectacular in every respect especially the view.We enjoyed the tour so much we asked if Julie could extend it to take us on the Cape peninsular tour which she managed to accommodate by moving other things she had planned to do and picked the best day for weather.All in all a great trip which made our South African adventure a holiday we will treasure for ever made so by Julies expertise.If you are going to SA and want a guide you will do no better.
Amazing Service!. Julie is an amazing tour guide, fun to be around with a wealth of knowledge on the destination that she shares throughout the tours... Thank you for making our trip a memorable one!

Ely Fine. Friends from Perú, and me, took Cape Splendour with Julie Klarke to sightseeThe Western Cape.Most safest driver and very accomodatingExcellent knowledge of all the history and places we went to.Lovely choices of Restaurants to stop for lunch.Always friendly and cheerful.Will always come back to her.

The BEST way to travel the Cape with Splendour. I was 1 of 6 travel agents who were privileged to go on an educational / site visit to Cape Town and the surrounding areas. Julie (Owner) of Cape Splendour Day Tours was our transport for 5 days. I felt safe and relaxed when travelling with Julie as our driver. Julie went the extra mile by taking us "Jo'burg" travel agents to all the local areas for shopping, eating and stopping in places where we had great background photos. Julie takes pride in her own business. Julie is extremely knowledgeable about the different areas of the Cape, such as the History of the Cape, where to stay, where to eat and which vineyards are great for wine tasting lovers. Thank you Julie for making our Cape Town trip an amazing travel experience.

Bespoke brilliant. We has previously used Julie from Cape Splendour a couple of years ago for a very successful family holiday tour of the Cape Town and beautiful surrounding area but this was a solo visit with a business twist. I was looking for suppliers for a new business importing wine to Singapore. I contacted Julie to see if she could arrange a few meetings with prospective suppliers meeting my criterion. Julie was on the case and we exchanged emails finalising the details but I pretty much left things in her hands - and she came up trumps. She collected me from my hotel at the V&A and we headed off on a bespoke mini wine tour which included a spectacular 'boutique, estate in the Helderberg area. We took a break from the sourcing and tasting with a lovely Al fresco lunch in beautiful surroundings. Three of the four people we visited are now on my suppliers list and the other wasn't bad but just didn't quite offer what I was looking for. After a full and very successful day Julie dropped me back at my hotel, job well done. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommend Julie for any touring activities you are planning as there is no doubt that she well come as close as possible to putting together the perfect package for your visit. I will certainly use her again and am already planning my next visit for next year.

Touring around in splendour. Cape splendour offers phenomenal service, comfort and informative tours that cater for the discerning traveller. Julie is hands on with the personalised experience created for each of her clients catering to their varied requirements.

Home away from home. Being in a foreign country can be unsettling. Julie gave us the information we needed to enjoy, learn and feel safe all together. We truly enjoyed our 3 days together. Very accommodating, energetic and a very smart interesting woman. We will miss her!!!

Fabulous and entertaining day. We spent the day with Julie on a wine tour. She had great knowledge of SA and was interesting to talk to. I'd definitely recommend her as a guide and wish we'd have spent more than a day with her. We were a group of 6 adults and all of us throughly enjoyed the day.

Cape Splendour Tours, far more than just a local tour guide!. I booked return flights for a 2 week holiday in "Cape Town". Then panic set in as due to the Mining Indaba, Cricket and Rugby internationals all the hotels I tried were fully booked. A friend recommended Julie and she managed to book everything. Airport transfers, great hotels, game drives, car hire, day tours and even some amazing restaurants all in advance. Her wealth of local knowledge made our holiday to Cape Town & Garden Route one of the best experiences of my life. We also included 2 full day tours of the Cape Peninsula and the Winelands during our stay which were exceptional. It was really easy to coordinate with Julie from the UK via email and all of her recommendations were fabulous. I'm sure we'll be back soon

Great travels. I booked 4 days day tours and some transfer with Julie as I am going to Cape Town for pre-wedding photo-shooting and leisure.Julie answered my questions in details and timely manner. I am very rest assured with her by my side and I know I have nothing to worry about.The wineries she picked are exactly what we love and I am glad she asked our preference at first so it's tailored to our needs.She also booked some lovely restaurants so we had good food without worry about waiting in line.She also very knowledgeable about the history of cape town and the places you visit, definitely a plus when you want to know more.She mentioned she can also helped in arranging accommodations which I am very interested for my next day (staying in table bay for all my nights were rather costly).Thanks for everything, you made this trip magical and hassle free for us.

Cape Splendour cape tour. Julie is a great lady with lots of knowledge & enthusiasm about Cape Town, Cape & Garden Route areas, our day tour took in the port area, Hout Bay, Boulders/Penguins, Cape, Simonstown & Kirstenbosch, Peter < Dublin

Cape Town tours with Julie. My family of 4 have visited Cape Town for the first time. We have spent two wonderful days with Julie on Penisular and Winelands tours. Everything was perfectly organised - Julie recommended, planned and booked all stops and attractions (also for our kids), responded to all our requests, answered all our questions. We saw seals, penguins, ostriches, spent some time on secluded beach, climbed Cape of Good Hope hill, drove through outstanding Chaps, admired beauty of colorful butterflies, tasted delightful wines and cheeses, visited chocolate factory. Julie recomended us places for lunch that were really outstanding. We had so extensive itinerary that without Juile it would be imposible to do this on our own. We have traveled by her comfortable car in the pace convenient for us. She was punctual, reliable and all the time we felt that we are in good hands. We have very much appreciated her cheerfulness and positive attitude. Her services were strongly recommended to me by my friend and now I can fully confirm that Julie is really a superb guide! Thanks to Julie we have so wonderful memories from Cape Town that we would love to come here again!

An outstanding day. We booked the 1 day peninsular tour with Julie after checking through the numerous companies offering similar tours and it was the right choice. Julie arrived punctually to pick us up from our accommodation and explained the outline for the day, but with options depending upon our preferences.The entire day was well organized and ran smoothly, the sights are truly unforgettable and Julie contributed during the day with a good mix of relevant information, humor and anecdotes.We would not hesitate in recommending this tour.

Our South African Holiday. We were recommended to use Julie Clarke of Cape Splendour by friends. She organised and booked all our accommodation and our game drives on our fly drive trip to the Western and Eastern Cape and provided us with recommendations of things to do along the route. We also used her for her 1 day Cape Tour. Everything worked like clockwork and the accommodation she booked and the recommendations she made were excellent. As first timers in South Africa we were lucky to have had her guiding us with the dos and don'ts. A first Class trip.

Wonderful day out. We booked Julie for a day trip from Cape Town to Cape Point and back; various stops on the way and a winery on the way back. Julie was aware of road closures due to a marathon and so was ready to alter the route; this is an important benefit this days unfortunately with some wildfires closing roads. The vehicle is clean, smart and comfortable. Julie is punctual and very friendly and happy to talk about life in SA plus commentary on the sights. We had done this trip on our own a few years ago but Julie adds a lot of local knowledge. Two of our number were not able to walk far and Julie took this into account at various stops including Boulder Bay. Can recommend 100%.

Cape Delights. Our group, which varied between 4 and 6 people, used Julie's Cape Splendour guiding and transport services over 3 days. We also made use of her airport pick up and cruise ship terminal drop off service. We visited all the major attractions in Cape Town and the surrounding countryside with her..Julie attended to our needs exceptionally well to our interests and was always willing to adapt situations and activities to suit the varied members of our group.She judicially balanced interesting and insightful information with time for free exploration at different stops.Her sense of humour and relaxed conversational style made us feel she was more a travelling companion rather then just a guide providing rote information.Her excellent choices of lunch stops suited both our tastes and conservative budgets and all featured beautiful panoramic settings.She is also clearly well connected to the local tourist network of service providers.Julie was always punctual, keep to agreed timetables and destinations and provided an immaculate and comfortable vehicle.We are frequent travelers and without doubt we would use her outstanding services if we visited ASouth Africa again.

Excellent day tour . We did a full day tour down to cape point with Julie and had a very good time. It was a good mix of activities and several nice stops along the way together with excellent guiding.We were 2 adults and three kids doing this and we all enjoyed it very much and tough discussion about which part that was the best:-). Julie also managed to get us a swim in the ocean which the kids really liked :-). Thanks for a great day!

Fabulous Day Tour with Julie!. We booked a full day with Julie to tour the Cape Peninsula and feel we really hit the jackpot! Julie is delightful and fun to be with and she is so knowledgeable about the Peninsula! From flora and fauna to history, Julie knows it. Julie customized our tour around some existing lunch reservations and was very flexible. Her van was clean and very comfortable. If you want a private or small group tour..Julie can do it. We were very pleased.

Cape Town trip. We travelled to Cape Town in Nov and had Julie as our tour guide for 3 days. We chalked out the plan prior to travel through email chats and she was very prompt and informative.We did City tour,peninsular tour and vineyards tour and all the trips were fantastic.She is very conversant with all the details about the places we visited and also has relevant travel books handy if you wish to read more about flora and fauna. On all the days it was a heady combination of lovely drives, stunning locales,sunny weather and interesting conversations about the history and culture of the rainbow nation. Among other things, visit to Babylonstoren, strawberry picking, the cute penguins,chapman peaks drive and Julie's habit of saying' happy happy' while clicking photos stand out in particular.If you are looking for a guide who is punctual,friendly,responsible, knowledgeable and who can make your trip memorable then Julie of Cape Splendour tours is the right choice.

The best of Cape Town. We started our 10 day South African adventure with 5 nights in Cape Town. Due to unforseen circumstances, Julie was unable to meet us for our first day of Cape Town tourning to the Wine Lands. However, she called us upon our arrival to our hotel to apologize and assure us she was sending someone in her place as not to upset our planned day. After our first day which was a lovely day spent wine tasting, we were with Julie for the next 2 full days. She was easy to work with, and tailored our day to what we wanted to see and do while in Cape Town. She is knowledgable and energetic about sharing Cape Town and it's history. My husband was highly interested in seeing the whales in Hermanus and we had arranged for a whale watching trip. However, when Julie came to our hotel that morning, she informed us that because of the winds, the whale watching boats were not going out that day. But that we would still make our way to Hermanus where we could walk the cliffs and hopefully see the whales. Unfortunately, the whales that afternoon did not want to make themselves visiable, and after lunch we were going to start making our way back to Cape Town from Hermanus. Julie found a small beach/cliff watch and within mere seconds of being there, we were able to see a number of whales right off the coast line. My husband was THRILLED!!! We would highly recommend calling Julie to help make a memorable stay in Cape Town, and would definately call her again should our travels find us back in South Africa.

Look no further for a Tour Guide!. My sisters and I visited Cape Town for a second time and we knew from the outset that we would engage the services of Julie again. As last year, she provided two fantastic days out for us. She was very punctual and made our trips with her so memorable. She is very knowledgeable about Cape Town and we learned so much more than anyone could glean from a tour guide book. We especially appreciated Julie's research to find a needlework shop for us en route. She did not know of one off hand but did her homework well and came up with a fantastic shop which exceeded our expectations - thank you Julie.All in all, if you want punctuality, reliability, friendliness and professionalism I would urge you to book Julie, I know you won't be disappointed. She tailor-makes tours to suit your needs and nothing is too much trouble for her. Her car is exceptionally clean and comfortable and her driving impeccable. She was very sympathetic towards my sister's mobility problems, managing to park in places which were easily accessible to the places we were visiting.We felt that when touring with Julie we were driving around with a friend. We will return to beautiful Cape Town again and without doubt will be contacting Julie to arrange further tours for us.

Lovely Coastal Tour to Hermanus, Cape Agulhas, Arniston. We contacted Julie because we had heard she offered tours outside of Cape Town. She was easy to work with and provided several different options for itineraries. Very responsive! We enjoyed a lovely long weekend along the coast to Hermanus, where we did some whale watching and saw the penguins. She arranged our accomodations at the Auberge Burgundy and then at a fabulous seafood restaurant called The Fisherman's Cottage (reservations were required and Julie was able to secure on short notice). The drive and scenery at the Cape was incredible. Julie also arranged our beautiful accommodations in Arniston. She knew the area well and made several small town stops along the way including one with a shipwreck museum. Julie was flexible, knowledgeable, and enjoyable to be with!

Outstanding Guide. My wife and I found ourselves with an open day, called on a whim to see if by any possible chance Julie was available, and an hour later we were on the way to the Cape. She is extremely knowledgeable, articulate, and is an absolute delight. The van was very comfortable. A day that began with no plans ended being a day we will always remember. Apologies to Julie for the delay in posting the review.

Excellent Driver & Tour Guide!. We appreciate Julie's safe and skillful driving abilities while commentating on surrounding highlights. Her van was clean and very comfortable. She's prompt, professional, and flexible with last minute itinerary decisions. She is knowledgeable and speaks clearly with a refreshing enthusiasm for her community. We highly recommend!

14th August 2015 / Dinesh family London. 14th August 2015 / 5 days with Julie.Awesome Julie - our journey started way back in March/April 2015 with emails and suggestions etc and finally went with Julie. Very knowlegable, Prompt, Flexible and making the most of the day visit very managable and we seen more than we excepted. She’s very True to her commitment in the Tour industry. Overall the Best choice we have made and without doubt she will be our first choice in the future for cape town.Julie we did have a Great time and you were so humble, caring to us as Family. Had laughs, joke’s and your in-depth knowledge of the cape was very informative and learned more then just seeing the beautiful cape and made all 5 days very memorable.May you be Blessed with all the success, happiness and harmony.Love Di and family.

Love Julie's Professionalism!. Our great service started well before we arrived in Cape Town. My dad worked with Julie over 6 months prior to our arrival. Of all the potential tour guides he contacted, she was the most professional and organized. She was able to handle ALL the activities we wanted, and work it into a manageable schedule for our 5 days in Cape Town. She even added suggestions that we might want to incorporate. She then provided us with a detailed itinerary to review. Our family greatly enjoyed 3 of our 5 days in Cape Town with Julie. Our Cape tour was already booked with another company prior to contacting her, and we toured the Langa Township with a company who specializes in Township tours.Julie picked us up at the airport in her immaculate van and hurried us to our bed & breakfast to drop off our luggage for safety. Then we were off to Table Mountain. Visiting Table Mountain was high on our to-do list, but during the winter, getting up there can be a problem with the unpredictable weather. Julie had incorporated flexibility into our schedule to allow us to visit Table Mountain whenever the weather cooperated. But luckily enough, the weather allowed us to visit as soon as we arrived. She accompanied us to the top to point out many interesting facts along the way. Afterwards, she drove around town to find us an open restaurant (not easy on a Sunday!) where we could enjoy a nice meal before retiring for the night. Now that we had crossed Table Mountain off our list, Julie provided us with a revised itinerary for our 2 remaining days. It was nice that she kept everything up to date. Julie would arrive a bit early to pick us up. We never had to worry about her being on time. This day my brother was feeling a little uneasy, but decided to do the day tour with us. Julie was very good in dealing with him – bathroom stops, not driving fast on curves, etc.That day, we enjoyed an informative city tour and visit to Bo-Kaap. We visited 2 overlooks including Signal Hill, The Company’s Garden, a stroll downtown (National Library, Parliament, and St. George’s Cathedral) and had free time to roam around Greenmarket Square to shop for scarves. One highlight for me was our lunch at Jonkershuis Restaurant at Groot Constantia. Julie introduced us to delicious Cape Malay food! It was one of the best meals on our whole trip. It was nice that she was able to eat with us during our meals also. I do believe they have a policy in South Africa that tour guides meals’ free. That was a nice perk, but we would have been more than happy to pick up her meal too. In the afternoon, we visited lovely Kirstenbosch Gardens, and strolled through with Julie, to end our day just before the rains started.We spent our last day in Cape Town with Julie as well. We visited the Heart of Cape Town museum bright and early on our private tour. Julie arranged this because a school group had already booked the morning tour. It allowed us to see the museum before the crowds. Julie then took us to Stellenbosch to explore the quaint and gorgeous town. We visited some wineries and did some shopping. She suggested we go to her favorite winery, Annandale, which was great. My mom enjoyed the wine tasting and bought some to take home. We then went to a larger winery, Middelvlei. We were not there to wine taste but to enjoy their fantastic boerebraai (barbeque). Afterwards, it was time to head to the airport for our flight home.Julie was full of great insight and made each day special! You can count on her to show you the very best of Cape Town. Let her plan your next visit to Cape Town, and you won’t be disappointed.

First Class, 5 Stars Tour Guide. We spend 3 full days with Julie and she is truly one of the best tour guides I have ever met. She put a great itinerary together for us and made it also a lot of fun for our 14 year old son. Julie is extremely knowledgeable, pleasant, flexible and it is also a lot of fun to be around her. Because of Julie we had the best time ever exploring Cape Town and the area around it. Thank you Julie. we hope to be back one day and to see you again.

Cape Splendor and Julie gave us the best of Cape Town!. Julie was prompt, knowledgeable and thorough in our email pre-trip planning. Her insights into making the most of our 4 days in Cape Town and her fun, friendly commentary provided a window into the life, history and culture of this destination you shouldn't miss. She knew how to schedule the day so that we missed traffic and arrived at destinations ahead of the crowds. We also appreciated her flexibility when we wanted to alter the itinerary just a bit at those times when an unanticipated event peaked our interest. She is the best!!

Julie is first rate!. I agree with all the others---see Capetown with Julie and Cape Splendour Tours. Her experience and knowlege of the area is exceptional. Her calm and friendly manner is a pleasant counterpoint to the hectic traffic and bustle of Capetown. Our family just finished a four day tour with Julie and had a fantastic time. She personally picked us up at the airport and took us on a City tour and day trips to the Wine Country, the Cape Peninsula and Gansbaai for a shark dive. All excursions were wonderful and relaxing.Do yourself a favor and book with Julie. You will not regret it. We are experienced travelers who rarely take tours but Capetown can be challenging for first time visitors and touring with Cape Splendour Day Tours is highly recommended. You can't beat local knowledge...

Cape Splendour is the BEST!. I cannot imagine a better quality tour than we had with Julie. She is so pleasant and has a great deal of knowledge about the area. We also got a great history lesson. We had a fantastic wine and chocolate tasting tour, saw the Penguins at Boulders Beach and climbed up to the Light Tower at Cape Point. We had an incredible 9 hours and I cannot believe everything that we were able to see during that period of time. Book with Cape Splendour if you want the best tour of the Cape!

Great tours. We did 4 full days with Julie and they were great! We had a fantastic time, learned alot and saw many things! I would recommend her to anyone going to caoe for their tours ! We really enjoyed them and we would probably use their service again if we come back to this area !

THE best way to see Cape Town area is by letting Julie from Cape Splendour Day Tours be your guide.. My husband and I extended our Safari adventure with three days in Cape Town. Not wanting to drive on the left side of the road, we engaged Julie from Cape Splendour Day Tours to navigate us around. We could not have been luckier. Julie is very knowledgeable about the area. She makes suggestions where to go, but will go where you want to go and is the THE most flexible person. We initially asked for her services on a Tuesday and a Thursday. When the weather was not allowing the planned trip to Table Top Mountain on Tuesday, she was willing to add it to the agenda on Thursday. When the weather forecast was not favorable for Thursday but great for Wednesday, she gave up her own plans to switch days for us. Wednesday was a most fabulous and memorable day. We could never have done and seen what we saw on our own. Julie, thanks again. In our book you are #1.

Great Tour!. My wife and I booked Julie for two days in Cape Town in May 2015. The first day she picked us up from our hotel and we took a very scenic drive to the cape peninsula. We made a couple stops along the way to take in the views and then ate lunch/explored near the Cape of Good Hope before continuing on our journey back to Cape Town. The views were unbeatable. Day two was a trip to do some wine tasting. Julie picked out a number of vineyards based on the types of wine we told her we would like to try. They were all great, but our favorite by far was Annandale. Julie said this was one of her favorite vineyards, and I see why. It was fabulous wine in a fabulous setting. Julie really knows her stuff and she made our trip easy and enjoyable. I would highly recommend her to anyone looking for a knowledgeable driver while on your stay in Cape Town.

Cape Splendour lives up to the name!. Juli picked us up at hour hotel in new clean van, on time by the way, to begin our guided to of the Cape then Cape of Good Hope. Julie's knowledge of the area and the elements are fascinating. You can tell by the way she shares some of the most beautiful vistas, she truly loves this land. The scenery is absolutely surreal, you just can not believe the breathe taking views. Julie planned the day, the lunch and the ride back to the hotel with precision.I have already recommended this trip to friends planning a South African tour, no trip to this country would be complete without seeing the coastline of the Cape. Also, Julie's driving was very kind to a person who has trouble with motion sickness and I say this very in frequently. Thank you Julie!

5* Holiday Service. We have just returned from a fantastic 3weeks holiday all organised by Julie. We have been emailing back and forth for some weeks and nothing has been to much trouble for her, from airport pick ups, to arranging car hire, our route hotel/guest houses along the route, Safari at Inverdoorn and day tours. and making sure we all got back to the airport on time.We have had a memorable holiday in a fabulous country, with fabulous people.Julie has been a true professional and has make us feel that we have made a good friend.When Julie has not been available Prosper her assistant has been a great back up. Both of them have so much knowledge of the country and have taught us a great deal about Cape Town and South Africa.Thank you Julie, we couldn't of done it without you.

Capable Clarkie!!. Julie is just perfect for showing you all you want to see in and around Cape Town. We have just spent a memorable 5 star holiday with Julie where nothing is any trouble just ask and its done. Any problem she will sort it. If you re looking for a first class tour of the sites in and around South Africa contact this very capable lady. I can't praise her enough. If we visit again I shall without doubt be ringing Capespledour...

Cape Point and City Tour. Julie did an outstanding job of showing and guiding our pre-wedding party on a Cape Town City Tour and a Cape Point Tour! Lots of fun, we learnt and saw a lot. Julie was highly informative, fun to be with and flexible with all our requirements! Would highly recommend Cape Splendour Day Tours for your trip to Cape Town, we all had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed our time with Julie! :)

5 Star Service. As I began my research into Cape Town for an up coming 3 week holiday with my husband, I was faced with so many important decisions to make. What were the "must see " things? I didn't want to go so far, and then not get to see all the important attractions.I decided to stay in Cape Town for a week, then move on having rented a hire car. As I searched through the Internet, I came across Cape Splendour tours. Not really being one for organised tours, I noticed that they not only did tours but prepared itineraries for people who wanted to self drive. I checked TripAdvisor for Cape Splendour and its founder, Julie Clarke.I thought I would give them a try.Julie spent a lot of time preparing an itinerary based on what we liked and did not like. Cape Town Peninsula Tour - Amazing Tour!. The Peninsula tour we went on was absolutely fantastic and one of the highlights of our SA tour. Good day, great guide and driver, not a bad price. Depending where you are staying in Jo'Burg, pickup is anytime between 7 and 8.30 PM. Our driver Freddie was great (and completely mental) and the guide Mike also very good. You start by driving to the harbour and doing the optional seal island exertion for 80 rand to see the hundreds of seals. Basically everyone does this unless you get sea sick as otherwise you just sit in a coffee shop for 40 minutes. You get about 20 meters from the seals so it is a good view!A breakfast stop is included at some point here with juice, muffins and yogurts provided. Simons town and boulders was next with the Penguins. These are great and very cute!Leading to lunch you do a 5-6km bike ride. This was nice enough but a slightly forced addition as you basically get off the bus and then cycle along the same road. The views are nice but the same as you would have from the bus so I would probably rather just save the 30 minutes from the day. Lunch itself was nice with a good spread and lots of it! Mike is very good at keeping you topped up with food :-)You then visit a lighthouse and walk up there for amazing views and then visit the cape of good hope to get your photos taken. The drive back goes along the opposite (west) coast and takes in ostrich farms etc, arriving back into CT for 5.30-6.30 ish. All in all a great day and would recommend. Thanks Freddie and Mike.

Beautiful sites, great people, and a little exercise!. While in South Africa, if you would like to see the best of the Cape Peninsula, I recommend taking the Baz Bus “Cape Peninsula Day Tour”. The majority of our tour were backpackers from all around the world which made for interesting conversation. Although I was probably the oldest on the van, I had a ball nevertheless. Our tour began in Cape Town and after a beautiful drive along the Atlantic Ocean we stopped at Hout Bay Harbor and then on to Chapman's Peak for a breakfast break. We stopped at Boulders Beach to see the penguins and made our way to the Cape of Good Hope for that famous photo. We got plenty of exercise climbing our way to the lighthouse at the Cape Point and enjoyed a beautiful bike ride. Although the first portion of the ride was slightly uphill, it was worth because at the end was a picnic lunch. If you forgot your camera there was no worry because our guide Mike took several candid and group photos of the day’s adventures emailed them after about week or so. If you want to see the best of the Cape Peninsula and get a little exercise while you’re at it, I recommend taking this Baz Bus tour. Excellent 4 day Kruger Tour!!!. I am a 43 year old American male who was traveling alone in South Africa for work. I really wanted to see Kruger but was hesitant to go it alone. Having previously taken the BAZ BUS 1 day Cape Point tour and loved it, I decided to put my faith in BAZ BUS once again. Once again, I was not disappointed.To be sure, the BAZ BUS tour of Kruger is contracted out to a separate tour group - I forget the name - but don't let that stop you. Everything about the experience was amazing. Our group was small, consisting of me and three college-age females (2 from France traveling together, one from Germany traveling alone). By the end of the four days, we were all very friendly with one another despite language differences, and we've remained friends. This is one of my favorite features of BAZ BUS: small groups of international travellers make for a nice experience. The tour itself was perfect. Day 1: a six hour drive from Jo'Burg to Kruger with several stops along the way. Our campsite was just 15 minutes outside of Kruger, and the accommodations were perfect. Sturdy tents with two beds (actual beds) per tent. The campgrounds had 6 showers (3F/3M) and two toilets. There was a campfire area where we ate dinner. Day 2: twelve full hours on Safari in Kruger - beginning at sunrise when the gates open (6am) until sunset when the gates close at 6pm (18:00). Yes - we saw the complete Big 5 and so much more from our 4x4 open vehicle. Then dinner around our campfire back at the campsite. Day 3: another full 12 hour day at Kruger. As we hadn't seen any rhino or lion on our first day, a second day gave us the opportunity to explore other regions, which provided us with a variety of different animals to spot - including rhino and lion! Day 4: return to J'Burg, with a stop at Blyde River Canyon in the morning. The canyon is beautiful and a nice way to cap the trip. Overall an amazing experience. Great guide, great accommodations, great food (I'm vegan and they accommodated me!!!), great price, and now - great friends. While some might notice that the 4 day tour only includes two full days in Kruger, I do believe this is an appropriate amount of time for for the tour. While I could stay in Kruger forever, you will not be disappointed. If you are considering booking this tour, please know that I have zero complaints, and will be booking the 20 day Victoria Falls next July.

Awesome and affordable day tour of Cape Point. I had stayed at a BnB and they booked me this tour (without actually booking me), but Vaughn was kind enough to accept me even if I was not on the list. As such I did not know what to expect. We stopped off for a short boat ride to a seal colony which was optional. Didn't join this and took the time for coffee and meet some of my tour mates. Then it was off to Boulders/False Bay to check out South African penguins. That was cool. I think we had the breakfast (which was included) after...or was it before the penguins? Anyway a few of us really missed hot coffee, as it was the middle of winter in South Africa. Then off for a 5 km bike ride (this was a delightful surprise, and made me wish the mileage was longer). Then a hearty lunch. Still missed my coffee. Then off to the lighthouse which was a climb up, but really nothing to sweat about. The last part was at the Cape of Good Hope for a short visit and photoshoot. We saw a colony of baboons along the way back. I really enjoyed this tour. Vaughn was an excellent organiser, though you have to put up with his lame jokes. Freddie was the driver, but I believe he would earn more money in a comedy club. I highly recommend this tour to everyone wanting to visit the Cape of Good Hope.

Memorable outing 5/5 stars. On Sunday 26th June 2016, I decided that I would take a day journey/tour with Baz Bus.I was told that I should meet at the closest stop to where I reside in Green Point. Cape town. That Is The Sunflower Travelers Stop. At exactly the time said the bus arrived. 8.30am we were off to see the Cape peninsular. I was introduced to the other trippers by a very well spoken tour guide called Vaughn. Straight away he made me feel comfortable and at ease with his joking and familiar demeanor.We went along the coast line, past Camps bay and after 20min. arrived at Hout Bay harbor, where we were given the option to take a boat trip to Seal island to view a colony of seals or we could for the next 50 min. walk around the Harbor at the various gift shops, the wharf or the beautiful beach next to the harbor. I chose to take the boat ride as I have never been on any vessel on the open sea. I was been adventurous. After getting a ticket, we were off. I was nervous at first but the sea was calm and I never once felt sea sick. The boat was filled with tourists from all over the world, snapping away at everything with cameras and cell phones. One of the guys that was on our bus asked me if I could take a pic. of him with seal Island in the background. He had a monster camera with a huge lens that he had brought from India. After taking a few pics. With different backgrounds, we struck up a dialogue about his home town and how I would love to go to India. Seal Island was full of seals and luckily the wind was on our side. Apparently it really stinks. We were lucky…. Nothing after bobbing around in the water for 15min. the boat turned round and we were coming back past Sentinel Hill which I told Natean that it resembled one of the huge temples I would love to see in India.After disembarking we all met at the Baz Buss and were off again next destination the spectacular Chapmans Peak Drive. Once again our very articulate and amusing tour guide Vaughn was on a roll telling us about the leopard sculpture on the rock and how it came to be there. The van stopped at the top of Chapmans peak. Group photo session followed by breakfast muffins and a cordial juice mix, I wished then that there was some coffee as it was rather cold.Musical chairs was the order of the day…. Every stop we had to make sure we sat next to someone new. This encouraged us to really get to know the other travelers. Next stop was Boulders Beach. This where Penguins come to see humans with cameras. The penguins enjoy this past time, that they have made this an official breeding colony where the Jackass Penguin have finally started recovering from becoming extinct. A wooden walk way has been erected as to keep the tourists and penguins separate. After viewing this spectacle… I decided to wait at the penguin café with a warm cup of coffee for the bus load to collect.The bus driver was also a well liked funny character who spoke in jokingly poems. His name was Eddie. With the combination of Eddie and Vaughn we were having a marvelous time. After the bus was loaded, we were on our way to the Cape Point nature reserve to ride bikes. All along the way Vaughn played great South African music in between keeping us informed about the Cape surroundings. We entered the Cape Point Nature Reserve and Vaughn after detailing about safety on the bikes and about it being compulsory to wearing helmets. Those who chose to bicycle it to Buffels conservation center, all said that they were confident that 5km was going to be fine. I suffer from Asthma and took a chance, because I had my pump and after signing an indemnity form thought well it’s on me if anything happens. I am responsible and would take it easy. One the way we encountered Zebra. We all stopped and once again the phones and cameras were out and clicking away. The bus took off to go prepare lunch and we would meet at the given point. I took the lead and sped off on a mostly downhill tarred road. Passing a building on my left but viewing an old building on my right with cannons in front of it. I missed the turning but Eddie saw me and yelled “Hey, This way”. I turned round. Luckily I heard him as I would of cycled all the way to the Point Parking lot.Lunch was ready and a few of the group were arriving on to the scene with a disheartening story. Natean, The Indian guy I met on the boat, who asked me to take his picture with his large camera, had fallen while riding his bike and at the same time, trying to take some snapshots of the beautiful cape scenery. Vaughn ran off to go and attend to Nataen instantly. An ambulance was called. Vaughn and Eddie nursed Natean until the ambulance arrived. These guys were amazing. They helped patch up as best as possible, before the pros got in. I was very impressed. They missed lunch. Luckily everyone on the tour was very helpful and the food was help yourself kinda food. Perfect for a picnic outing. After all had eaten. Me and a few others helped to clean up with Vaughn just checking in now and then. We were all packed up and ready to go. The ambulance had arrived and Natean was whisked away.The afternoon went on as planned. We stopped at point. It was very windy. I decided not to go up the path to view Cape Point. In the past, I have done this a few times already. So I casually waited at the restaurant sipping on another hot coffee hoping to catch a glimpse of baboons that menace the patrons, but had no luck. Finally at the Cape of Hope sign, a few baboons and ostriches came to show off. After lots of camera action, we were on our way home.Thank you Vaughn. You really made the day. Your forte as a tour guide is Awe inspiring and to Eddie thanks for driving us safely. I will recommend this excursion and was grateful to find out through Vaughn that Baz bus has a hop on hop off plan operating with stop over’s. On the garden route right up to JHB. Thank you guys for a memorable outing. 5/5 Stars. Guy WalterOwner of Clay addicts School Of Ceramics021 4397686

Luggage stolen directly out of Baz Bus. This year April, I traveled with a friend from Durban to the Northern Drakensberge with the Baz Bus. We have been in South Africa since February and did not encounter any problems till then. The Baz Bus was by far the most expensive transportation, but it also claimed to be the safest and therefore we decided to invest the money. However 10 minutes in the Baz Bus and we regreted that decision dearly. We were still in Durban; in Pinetown to be precise. Not in the best nor safest environment and NOT on the regular route, which the bus should have taken. The bus driver claimed, he simply wanted to drop something from his own personal car off at his mechanic. Unfortunately, the bus driver did NOT lock the trailer with the therefore existing locks (which were with him in the front of the bus by the way). So while we were shortly stuck in traffic, three items of luggage got stolen directly out of the Baz Bus. Not only all clothes, but also IDs, driver's licenses, passports, bankcards etc. were lost. We, the passengers, were then left completely alone stuck in the middle of the more than unsafe surrounding with people observing us and informing us that it is not wise to stay there. After maybe 15 minutes our bus driver finally came back and we drove not first to the police station but instead firstly to his mechanic. This happend in the beginning of April and since then I have been in contact with the Baz Bus, requesting a compensation for all of my stolen goods. As the bus was not on the regular route and the trailer was not locked (as it is supposed to be) the fault lays undeniably with the Baz Bus company. However I have been put off and after handing in an official claim and till now I have gotten nowhere. So my advise would be: not to leave your luggage in the trailer or check if it really is locked. Because receiving any compensation from the insurance is more than difficult. I had nothing but trouble so far, trying to manage everything while being in South Africa - I can tell you: No fun. Not at all. I have lost quite some valuable goods, and am not willing to look it over. So as you can imagine, I am not going to be a fan of the Baz Bus and would not recommend it to my friends. Personally.

The tour took you in a relaxed manner past some highlights of the Cape (e.g. seal colony (not included, but well worth the money), pinguins at Simon's beach, a short mountainbike ride and of course to Cape the Good Hope. The mountainbikes seemed brand new. Lunch was also included, which was really extensive and healthy. All in all, it was a fun, relaxed day with good value for money! Would definitely recommend this tour!

Fun & Interesting. My adult son and I did the full-day Cape Peninsula Tour in early February 2016. We were picked up promptly at our hostel at 8:30 am. By the time we had picked up all the other tourists it was about 9:30 am before we left the city limits. We took the optional boat trip at Hout Bay to see the seals, which was worth it. The penguins at Simon's Town were difficult to see with the fencing and hoards of other tourists. We had a much better view of them later in our trip at Betty's Bay. We drove around to Chapman's Peak and here they had us cycle for 5 km. The chains fells off several people's bikes, but everyone coped and seemed to have fun with this. It was nice to get some exercise, even in the heat. The Cape of Good Hope is just beautiful, the views amazing. A wild ostrich ran alongside our van for awhile, and later at an ostrich farm, we saw a band of baboons stealing ostrich feed. Our driver Freddie and guide Mark were both great, having a wonderful sense of humour. They shared lots of information about the area, and really encouraged everyone on the trip to get to know each other and have fun.

Easiest and best way to visit outskirts of Cape Town . Spent a day which was totally worthwhile and saw so much. Everything was well taken care by Mike and Freddie. They were always warm and made us very comfortable. We visited lots of places during the day, they always were at hand to explain all the places and the food was really good too. Recommended for all

Full-Day Cape Peninsula Tour. First off, let me start by saying I have never had a full-day guided tour before, but you can be assured this trip will be hard to beat for overall value and quality! Our tour was led by our guide, Mike and his "pilot", Freddie. Mike was really knowledgeable about the history, flora, and animal species encountered during our Cape Peninsula Tour. We spotted a few animals ranging from baboons, seals, penguins, ostriches among others during our trip. The trip included a light breakfast, consisting of muffins and juice and a banquet (slight exaggeration) served up by Mike, which included Greek salad, lunch meat sandwiches, chips, drinks and fruits. The highlights of the trip were the penguin colony in Simon's Town, the scenic Chapman's Peak route, 5k bike ride just before lunch en route to Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope. I would recommend this tour to anyone, whether solo, with family or friends! At R$690 an unforgettable experience that was well worth the price of admission.

Cape Peninsula Tour. One word" wow" yesterday the 29 of February my friend and I went on a tour with the Bazbus, It was wonderful. Freddy the bus driver and Vaughan the Tour guide made the trip memorable THANX GUYS KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!!

My tip: if it is a sunny day, bring A LOT of sunblocker!!!Our guides Mike and Freddy were really nice, helping us with the picninc and the bikes, and also Katie at the office made an effort to make us feel good.Highly recommended, and I hope to be back soon!

Peninsula trip by baz bus. The day I opened my eyes to the beauty that is cape town.. What an experience! Baz bus made this trip both exciting and entertaining. There was no moment of bordm or disinterest. "Value for money!". I must recommend your staff for yesterday great job guys! A Full day with lost of fun,Nice Picnic lunch, Made new friends from all over the world,alot was covered in one day excellent Cape peninsula Tour i would do it again............A real Value for money

Day well spent!. Cape peninsula tour. Really amazing tour, had such a great time. Seeing the best of Cape Town with Baz bus is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. Thank you Freddie and Roger for making the experience unforgettable.

Fabulous. Amazing cape peninsula tour, we visited planty of places in one day! I would say is the best cape peninsula tour compared to the price... Moreover Mario the guide and Freddy the driver are the best!

Thanks Vaughan. The Cape Point and Cape Penisula tour was very good. Vaughan the tour guide was very informative, helpful and friendly. Excellent work.. These guys made backpacking in South Africa a hell of a lot easier.If bus rides, especially long ones, aren't your thing maybe stay clear.But this was part of the adventure for me

Excellent tour and even better guides!. Myself and two others took the BazBus tour on January 19th, 2015 and this was our first adventure during a week in Cape Town. Great day full of fun and adventure!. We spent a fantastic day traveling among Cape Penisula with this company. Me and my two sons enjoyed a lot. Fantastic service from this transport company. I use Bazbus to transport my 3 kids up and down the coast from East London to Port Elizabeth. Cape Peninsula Day Tour. This indeed the best day tour i had ever had!! Thanks to Baz Bus and the credit goes to the Best and most fun-loving guides, Togeda & Freddie!! Love ya!

Loads of FUN !!!. Ohh, I had the best day and picked the best guide Mark and driver Freddie to share it with!! We had tons of fun together, straight from the start we were laughing and singing. Saw loads of interersting things on the way to Cape point and had a lovely lunch. Extremely good value for money, definately recommendable. Love the song Welcome to Cape Town... Love from Finland

Excellent day. I really enjoyed the Cape Peninsula tour! Our guides were great and the tour covered a lot in the space of a day - Hout Bay, Simon's Town, Boulder's Beach, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point! Would definitely recommend this trip if you are pushed for time.

Dream team Mark & Freddie. I had an amazing tour with Mark & Freddie. They kept us entertained with their happy personalities and excellent service. Great day trip if you're pushed for time. Really enjoyed this tour of the Cape Peninsula - the day squeezed a lot in which was great for us as we were on a limited time schedule. Day well spent!. This tour packs in a lot for the time and value. Definitely put aside one of your days in Cape Town to have the peninsula experience and this is a great way to do it! Friendly, knowledgable service and lots of great activities!

Amazing. I really had a good time during a tour to Cape of Good Hope. It exceeded my expectation.Id like to thank Mario and Freddie, guide and drive, for their professionalizm and for being polite and fun.

Incredible, fun and informative. Thanks for an amazing tour! Fantastic funny and entertaining driver(Freddie)Knowledgable, amazing your guide with a fantastic sense of humour! (Roger) Really a great way to see and experience Cape Town! Thank you

Great way to see the cape!. They take great care of you all day and it's an awesome affordable way to tour the cape! Enjoyed the fun facts, biking and hiking aspects. Picnic lunch was nice too and you meet cool people.

Awesome day. It was such a great Tour, with nice and lovely people, an awesome busdriver (Fredy) and a great Tourguide (Roger). Pick up at your hostel, a lot of historical backround of the area, seeing seals and penguins, cycle through the cape national park and seeing cape point and cape of good hope and that all on one day for a really good price!

My most amazing PROUDLY SOUTH AFRICAN EXPERIENCE!!!!!!. I(Theresa)was born in Cape town many many years ago. Through study and work opportunities I travelled to various countries. I returned to Cape town from South America on New year's day 2015 after being away for almost eight months. Before coming home I realized that I'd seen many countries and yet had not seen much of my country of birth. Eventually I decided to google bus tours to Cape Point. This is how I discovered Bazbus and decided to take a chance. I called their office and was assisted by Faith who patiently shared detailed information regarding the tour, pick up points and surprising me by adding that lunch would be provided. Wooooow, she made the trip sound very exciting and I confirmed my booking immediately. It was hot and cloudless the morning of the tour as I hopped on the train from the Northern suburbs and travelled to Cape town feeling like a tourist. I then took a 10 minute walk from the station to the Bazbus office in Burg street. At the office we were met by our very competent and knowledgeable tour guide Mario and the tour bus driver Freddie. The day ahead was filled with professional commentary about the historical significance of places we passed and stopped at and also great scenery. It was great to learn soooo much about my birth city. I was the only South African amongst tourists from about 10 different countries. It was a great opportunity to make new friends from different parts of the world. Mario and Freddie made sure we all had fun, lots of laughs and lots of pictures as well. The value for money for the tour is incredible. I paid R650 which included all entry fees (for Cape point as ) lunch, a bicycle ride, the pictures sent to all of us after the tour and much much more.A huuuuuge thank you to Mario, Freddie and the rest of the Bazbus team for making this fun trip happen. May God bless all of you.This is by far my proudest South African experience ever!!!!

excellent... full value for money.... we did Bazbus Cape point tour(full day) on 13 dec 14. they came to pick up at our hotel and the charges were much less than other tour operators. the driver freddie and the guide mario were very helpful and entertaining. our group comprised of we 2 Indians, 2 spaniards, 1 norvegian, 1 canadian, 1 belgian, 2 libyans and 4 south africans. we all enjoyed the tour a lot. we visited all the places like houts bay, seal island, chapman's peak drive, noordehoek, boulders beach n penguins, cape point and cape of good hope etc etc. to top it up, we also did mountain biking in the national park... we got to see babboons, ostriches and penguins. and a very nice lunch prepared by our guide Mario... what else can anyone ask for... we just loved it...

A Must Do in Cape Town!!. This was such a unique experience. You get to see so many parts of the Cape and meet new people along the way as well. Vaughn was our guide and he did a great job of telling us the history of the sites and answering our questions. Freddie was a tremendous driver and a good resource himself. This is a day full of adventure. Hiking, biking, boating (you have to go to seal island?), and a good look at the wildlife. Treat yourself and go!
Spectacular Rager and Freddie. Amazing tour. Roger explained every single thing on the tour and Freddie kept popping jokes. It was too nice. I would recommend it to my friends.

Baz Bus Cape Point Tour. What a great day! The scenery is absolutely amazing and the tour is great value for money. Both the guide Vaughn and the driver Samuel were great. Very informative with lots of information,but not too much so that you feel like you are attending a lecture. Nice lunch and even the hike (which I was not looking forward to) was fun I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who visits Cape Town.

Enjoyable day tour. What a great time we had was with this tour ,there was loads we saw in one day and is was quite jam packed though ,it definitely is worth the money spent ,there was no rip off anywhere .The places we went where beautiful and guide Roger was knowledgeable about areas and history .Roger and Freddie were so helpful towards us,it was wonderful to see this assistance .It is quite a active tour (biking and hiking etc ) but if you not so active or so young I would still recommend going on this tour .A definite must do tour for any Cape town traveler ,had quite fun our duiker island(seal island ) trip so go on it if you haven't been

Baz Bus - Cape Peninsular Tour. Roger was our guide and he knew a hell of a lot about Cape Town, the surrounding area and South African history as a whole.The trip was really well organised, the stop locations were interesting and it was excellent value for money considering it was a whole day's tour.As a fairly seasoned traveler, I've seen rip-off tourist dross before and this isn't it. Would highly recommend without hesitation - book now!

Great day out. My family and I took the Cape Peninsula tour with Roger as our guide and Freddie as our driver. It was a great trip. It lasted from about 8:45 to about 18:00. It took a long time to go and pick up everyone from many hotels and guesthouses, but once we left Cape Town the rest of the tour was excellent. Part of the delay was caused by Roger, our guide making sure that there was a bike suitable for my 10 year old son. We were very grateful that they went to so much trouble to make sure we were happy. Roger gave a very interesting and informative commentary throughout the trip. We were given a snack after Hout Bay. Taking the optional ferry to see the seals was definitely worthwhile and one of the highlights of the trip. After seeing the penguins on Boulder Beach and riding bikes for about 30 minutes we were given a simple but tasty lunch. Walking around Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope was a nice end to the trip. The views were amazing. I would highly recommend Baz bus.

Great tour. We were very pleased with the cape peninsula tour and we highly recommend it to everyone. Freddy did a good job driving and Roger was a brilliant guide, very informative and an also tells funny stories in between. The bike tour was great but could be even better if the bikes were in a better shape.

It was a lovely day, where I've seen lots of nice sights and the guides were absolutely great!. It is nice that they take you to these different sights on one day. The guides were excellent, funny, informative and I met some nice people on the bus. I've enjoyed my day!

Relaxed and action packed at the same time!. The Baz Bus is great experience for people wanting to see the wildlife and scenery of Cape Town. It was both really relaxing during the drive from Cape Town to Cape Point but also action packed with bike rides, small hikes and exciting encounters with baboons. The bike rides and hikes are all optional which is great but everyone in my group was so enthusiastic that we all took on the extras and had a great time! The guides are really outgoing and knowledgeable and will make you feel comfortable. A lot of the sites we saw would have really difficult to visit without a tour bus or someone knowledgable about the area, parks and entry fees etc.The Baz Bus is definitely the best option for seeing the sights around Cape PointGreat for young & old travellers! I definitely recommend it!
Excellent. I loved the cape peninsula tour! Lots of activities to do with amazing scenery. Was very informative and our guide was great!

Very nice tour. This is a really nice tour you can do if you have not you're own car and really want to see Cape point and Cape the Good Hope. Also the driver Freddy and the Guide Mario makes the tour completed. I had a really nice day.

The best way to see the peninsula. I had a brilliant day on the Day Tour with Baz Bus. Very satisfied customer. My agent arranged this tour for me and I must say I am highly impressed. The tour was so versatile and the group of people I spent the day with was very nice and interesting. The guide Mark had interesting facts about the stops and Freddy the driver is the funniest man. He took us safely around the peninsula in his dragon. The tour is well put together and the snacks was tasty. I would recommend it to everyone can't wait to start my trip up to Kruger with Baz Bus

Lots in one day. We had a great time with Baz bus. I'm in my forties and was a bit worried I'd feel out of place on a backpacker tour but Roger and Freddy were great and made us all feel at home. The commentary was really interesting and we never felt rushed though we did a lot on the one day cape tour. Friendly, great value, wouldn't hesitate to recommend. I thought a really nice touch was when Roger e-mailed us a couple of days later with pictures from the trip

Excellent tour!. It was a great experience. The coast is amazing, and then a walk to the Cape point and from there to the Good Hope was just stunning with such amazing views. Will return one day definitely. Thank you for everything.

Fantastic customer service!. Best Cape Point tour. I would recommend this tour to anyone...Young, old, couples or even solo travellers. Roger is the best guide one can get. I am proud to be a South African :)
Great fully packed day. It was a great day even though they tried to fit in too many things. I still enjoyed it a lot. Fun group and guides.

Baz Bus and staff are amazing. Thank you Mark for the craziest day!!! We visited so many places in one day and every minute was fun and interesting. Excellent Tour. 16/11/2014 was doing a tour with baz bus a tour was amazing!!! I was schooled about cape town in many way I mean the tour guide was so amazing an well informed even though it his job. I did bicycle ride, waking tour, penguins visit list go's on and on but cape point was my fav :).
