Baz Bus keep up the good work you the best

The highlight of our trip to South Africa. My wife and I only got a week in South Africa, and only a weekend in Cape Town. Though we knew it would take up an entire day, we decided to do the Baz Bus Cape Peninsula tour, and we are glad we did; by far, it was the highlight of our entire week. It is a great value for what you get--- a full day of transportation, lunch, entry into a few locations, etc--- and it is done extremely well. If Roger is your tour guide, you are in luck. This man is a wealth of knowledge... no matter what the bus is passing, he knows something about it, even to the level of knowing the scientific name of a random flower in the field. This knowledge-base, on the nature and history of Cape Town, not only made the ride enjoyable, but gave us so much to think about. Plus, he had visual aids that he passed along; we appreciated the intentionality in everything he did.Even more, Roger cares about his crew. After doing things on our own the previous week, we were ready to sit back and let someone else guide us; my only hesitation was it feeling too touristy. Roger makes it feel more like he's taking a group of friends out to see his favorite places. He would look out for us, telling us the best vantage points for to see the seals, as well as if we needed anything (we changed our plans for drop off and he helped us to work it out.)If you don't get Roger, it's still an amazing tour. In one day, we experienced so much... seals, penguins, breathtaking landscapes, ostriches, biking... and left feeling like, if that had been all we had done in Cape Town, it would've been enough.If you have a day free in Cape Town, and if you want to really experience the Cape, do this tour. Look at the previous reviews... I'm just seeing them on the side now, and am not surprised to find they had the same amazing experience (especially with Roger!)

Thank you Roger and Freddie. We only had a weekend in Cape Town and wanted to see as much as possible, on a budget if possible so we chose Baz Bus- Day tours.....and we made a very good choice.The tour was extremely well organised and friendly. Roger was full of information about the localities and history and we had a fantastic day. We did a boat trip to see the seals, we went to Boulders Beach to see the penguins, we cycled towards Cape Point (nothing too strenuous and also optional, so don't worry) enjoying a picnic lunch on the way. We walked between Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope and viewed some Ostrich's and their babies from the van on the way back. After we got back we were tired but not too tired to take advantage of a clear evening over Table Mountain so we took the Cable car to the top and watched the sunset. Altogether one of the best days of my life....thank you Roger and Freddie Baz bus tours.Roger also sent photos of the group via internet, completely free of charge (and that is a first for me) Thanks you Roger.

Very intensive Cape Peninsula Day tour. The tour gives good overview of Cape Peninsula. I liked short walk to Cape Point and a little longer walk to the Cape of Good Hope. We visited seals (1hr boat tour as an option) and penguins beach. Take your camera with you and you will have amazing pictures after the trip. Roger and Freddy were very helpful and provided a lot of interesting information.

Peninisula Day Tour with BazBus (Cape-Town). There could be no any words to express my satisfaction from the wonderful trip I had with Mark (the Guide) and Freddie (the Driver) to the Peninsula.It was fun all the way, joyful and the sights were amazing and the lunch prepared by Mark was very tasty, the Guidance was spectacular and Freddie took us safely from one place to the other.The Bike ride was fine and pleasurable.The group also was good and I made many new friends.Thank you so much for the this memorable moments.Samuel Payne.

Cape Tour, Baz Bus. Roger did an excellent job in guiding this tour. It was most interesting and informative, covering a great spectrum of sights and activities. Nice morning snack and picnic lunch. We highly recommend this all-day tour.

Cape Peninsula Day Tour- Roger & Freddy. This was one of my favorite excursions while in South Africa. This tour is a MUST MUST do if you like the following:1-A very jam packed day of activities and beautiful sights for a very cheap price2- you like being active as two of the walks are not you average stroll in the park 3- you want to experience the beauty of SA from a new perspective- via bicycle!! (this seriously is amazing!! we saw a wild zebra just hanging out while we biked!) and they also give you time to walk the Cape of Good Hope trail which is AMAZING and BEAUTIFUL! (I wild baboon walked next to us during this walk) 4- to meet a bunch of cool young travelers 5- a hilarious driver and very fun and informative guide (ROGER IS THE BEST!) You really want to book this day excursion because I don't think there is a better way to see the Cape! Roger and Freddy are amazing guides and really make the tour even more enjoyable! Roger gives you the perfect amount of info while throwing in jokes that kept the entire bus laughing and wanting more. The lunch they provide is good, but make sure you eat fast or you get a lot of food during your first go, because once the food is gone, it's gone! :) Freddy stops by a market at the beginning of the trip so make sure to pick up some water from the store or extra snacks... You'll want it while you bike, since the hills are actually harder than they look! Most people were sleeping in the van on the way back... demonstrating how amazing and fun the day was since the entire day was jam packed with fun, laughter, and beautiful scenery overload!

Excellent tour. A great tour thats well worth doing. Despite some dodgy weather it was a really interesting and we'll organised day out with great walks, scenery and up close views of the wildlife! Thanks a million to roger for the informative commentary throughout. Highly recommended!

Cape Peninsula Day Tour - 8.11.2014. All in one word - Awesome. Thanks to guide Roger and Freddy for wonderful time and tour. Had a great day, an unforgettable one. I surely would like to recommend this tour to those who would want to visit cape peninsula, in a day. This tour has covered almost all the places , a well organized one.

Great trip Well done Baz Bus. had awesome time with guide and driver - would definitely recommend. magnificent places and things we saw and experienced. from the bikes to the boats and animals we saw - it was insightful and humbling. thanx to BAZBUS Team from ladies in the office (the evening we booked) From the minute we walked into your doors until the last minute we left we felt welcomed and at home! Thank you

Wonderful Day with Mark & Freddie. It was an awesome day down at the Cape. Mark did an excellent job of telling entertaining stories about the history of the Cape and Freddie was also never shy of a funny comment. This tour is a must-go for everyone who wants to experience the Cape with some laughters and people from all around the world. Would definitely do it again!

The best in the business. Had an unforgettable time on the day tour with Mario and Freddy they are so funny and the information was interesting. Nice stops included and I got some great pictures I will keep forever. Really enjoyed the day and the bike ride excited to do my trip up the garden route with you guys and I will tell everyone about the cape tour

Crazy for cape town. I only had 4 days in cape Town and in one day I saw so many things with baz bus. I especially enjoyed the penguins and the walk to cape of good hope with a beautiful view of the ocean.most relaxing day for a good price.my guide Mark kept us laughing and was kind thank you.

Superb!. I did the one day Cape Peninsula tour. I have to say, I was sceptical. The low price and backpacker-style did make me wonder whether it would be a lower quality tour. But I was very wrong. Genuinely one of the best tours I've been on. The tour guide (Mark) and the driver (Freddy) were fantastic. The group was mixed in background and age which was really nice too. We were taken to Hout Bay to see the seals, Simon's Town to see the penguins, went on a bike ride in Cape Peninsula National Park, then went to the lighthouse and Cape of Good Hope. Nothing felt rushed and I really like that, with the exception of the seal trip, all entry fees were included in the price (which would have added about R150 if paid on top). Highly recommended.

Hop on Hop off - Cape town to Jo burg. An amazing trip made easy with the Baz Bus, drivers all friendly and helpful! Johnny especially, he made our travel time so entertaining that it didn't matter that you were on a bus all day! We also had the safari package which cant fault from food, transport & tour guide. Would do it all again in a heart beat. Thank you Baz Bus
excellent tour. this tour is perfect...it has a lot of things to do in only 1 day :) !!! I loved it !!! the staff are nice and funny. I had a good time... the penguins..so cute :)

Good time. My very first time in Cape Town and what a great experience it was. Baz Bus tour included all the main attractions i hoped to see and at such a good price. Good lunch nice bike ride with awesome views. Guide Mark and driver very entertaining and kind. Thank you for all the information i really had a nice day.

One of the best ways to spend a day in Cape Town. As a local CapeTonian I was thoroughly impressed with the Peninsula Tour. You start the day bright and early leaving from town and head to Hout Bay where you can take a boat to seal island and see all the seals dancing through the sea. After that you get rewarded with a yummy breakfast snack and head through Chapman's Peak on your way to the penguins at Bolders beach. But the real bonus is Cape Point Nature reserve where you get to cycle, enjoy a delicious lunch and two short hikes. Here you can really soak in the absolutely magnificent Cape Scenery.In general I found this tour really well organised and the tour guide was super friendly and funny. When the tour ended I felt like I had seen so much and had a super fantastic time. I would genuinely recommend this tour to anyone wanting see the beauty of the Cape Peninsula this Summer season!

Baz Bus - Day Tour. My friend and I wanted to learn more about the coast of South Africa and opted to experience Baz Bus. Mark our tour guide was absolutely fantastic - he was funny, yet was able to provide very informing facts about the Cape. If you enjoy landscapes and beaches - this is definitely the thing for you to do.

Cape Peninsula day tour - 11th September 2014. My friend and I had a really fun day on the Baz Bus Cape Peninsula tour. Freddy (our driver) and Mario (our guide) kept us all thoroughly entertained with their jokes and were so friendly and welcoming. Mario also provided an informative commentary on the areas we were driving through, as well as pointing out all the different animals we passed. The views along Chapman's Peak Drive and at Cape Point are beautiful and are not to be missed if you are visiting Cape Town. The whole trip was very well organised with just the right amount of time stopping in each place and a lovely picnic lunch. It was great to have the opportunity to stretch our legs with some cycling and walking. The bikes were not in the best condition, but this does not really matter as you aren't on them for too long and the ride is along a tarmac road. When comparing to all the other tours on offer, this really is the best value for money and doesn't disappoint. I would absolutely recommend Baz Bus to all my friends.

Great for the young, and the young at heart!. My husband and I took the Cape Town Peninsular tour and it didn't start off well. The bus was half an hour late. No air conditioning. Smelly. Not sure what I expected at that price... And then.... although the bicycles were very old and one of ours just broke totally and we had to walk, we landed up having a GREAT day!All in all, we understood that with this tour, we experienced Cape Town in ways we would not have on our own, in our own car. It was truly special. A note of warning to the not so young - the bicycle route is uphill in the beginning. Not easy for people not in shape. But you can walk it and then cruise down after the rise. The Flora and fauna are spectacular.The driver was very cautious and took no chances. And the guide did his best to accommodate and bind a rather diverse group. To his credit, he managed in the end! So, Kudos to the guide, the driver and the arrangement.

A safe, convenient and friendly way to travel around South Africa!. I have done a few trips with the Baz Bus, and will keep using them again and again! First of all - it's safe: you are picked up at 'your' door, and the driver will not drop you off if a place is closed or there is no one to meet you (in the case that you are getting another lift). Secondly - it's convenient: you don't have to worry about driving long distances, and on some pretty challenging terrain, and you are picked up with your bags right where you are leaving. Thirdly - it's friendly: the drivers are all nice and really informative along the way, and then there are also the other passengers, many of whom you will end up befriending and even traveling further with! It's not just a way of traveling - it's a lifestyle choice, because the journey to your destination also becomes significant and might change the course of your trip entirely! Thanks for a great service Baz Bus!

Great day and excellent experience.. If your are backpacking in South Africa or just want to discover the Cape Peninsula in a different way, this is your tour. The Baz bus offers the opportunity to explore the beautiful peninsula, a generally rocky peninsula that juts out into the Atlantic Ocean at the south-western extremity of the African continent. Tickets can be easily bought on internet. After picking you up from your accommodation, the tour continues along the Atlantic Seaboard to Hout Bay harbour, where we took a boat cruise to visit the Cape Fur Seal colony on Duiker Island. Then comes a visit to the endangered (and very entertaining) penguins at Boulders Beach in Simons Town. After a picnic we enjoyed a leisurely stroll to the South-Western most point of Africa. This tour is just the best value for money for independent travelers. The day we took the tour, our welcoming guide, Roger, turned it into a great experience. From the beginning he took the lead of the group in a very professional way. He was very knowledgeable of the region and shared a lot of information and interesting tips. The tour allows you to ride a bike for about 5 km, visiting the Peninsula in a different way . It’s true that bikes are not in the best shape. But as far as you are, the experience will make up for it. I would highly recommend to take this tour when visiting Cape Town.The icing on the cake is that Roger has just sent me a few pictures of the tour, which are an unforgettable memory of the experience.

Should have hired a car instead. The bus has an odd design - there is a strip across the window at eye height which meant it was difficult to see out the window. Cape Peninsula Tour. We booked the Cape Peninsula Tour with Baz Bus after reading all the great reviews here. Though Baz Bus typically caters to the backpacking community, they were happy to allow us to book with them. Because we weren't staying at or near a hostel, we had to make arrangements to be picked up at the closest location from our hotel. We prefer smaller tours (versus the large buses that carry 60+ passengers), so this was just right for us.As many others mentioned, stops included Hout Bay (optional boat ride to see the Cape Fur Seals), Boulders Beach to see the African penguins, Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. There's a lot to see on this tour, so of course, time is a little short in some places. But given the distance we traveled and how much we were able to see in one day, I felt it was good enough to see the highlights and move on to the next place.On the way to Cape Point, we stopped to go on an optional bike ride (if you choose not to ride a bike, you can ride along in the van). People's opinions have varied here on the difficulty of the ride. It's not very long (we were told 5K, but it didn't feel like it. Some thought it was half that distance), and there are a couple uphill climbs. In my opinion, while it's not a difficult ride, you should be in at least very basic physical condition to pedal small uphill climbs. The majority of the bikes seemed to be in good condition, but there were a couple that would not change gears, making the ride a little more difficult for some. Helmets were provided and required.Our guide, Mark, and driver, Freddie, were both very nice, funny and informative. The food included with the tour was also very delicious (muffins and juice after visiting Hout Bay and sandwiches, salad, chips/crisps, fruit, juice and water for lunch after the bike ride). For the price of the tour, I'd say it was a great deal and well worth it.I will say, though, that it's been a month since we took the tour, and I have yet to see the photos Mark took on the Baz Bus Facebook page. Mark took photos of the group along the tour and took photos of us on the bike ride. I'm a little disappointed that the photos have not been posted (I'm not sure if they were lost or posted on another page I'm not aware of), but I'm glad we took our own photos.I recommend this tour to anyone, not just backpackers, and not just the young but the young at heart. It's a great way to see some of the wonderful sights outside of Cape Town in one day, and all for a very economical price.

The Baddest & Best Baz Bus Experience. To start with, I should say that I had a number of Baz Bus experiences prior to taking the Cape Peninsula Tour. Like many other travelers, I purchased a 7 day ticket to go explore the Garden Route, which is for all intensive purposes an incredibly convenient way to navigate your way up the coast. You're able to go hostel to hostel on a predetermined schedule, and it helps nail down your travel plans a little. However, I also found the Baz Bus to not be as warm and welcoming as I had expected. People were somewhat quiet and reserved, and many opt for their headphones instead of conversation.However, the Baz Bus Cape Peninsula Tour was one of the friendliest, most welcoming tours I have ever taken. I was immediately greeted by a bunch of friendly faces and our tour guide Mark Fortuin, did a great job at melting the ice and ensuring that people got to know each other. He was also one of the most knowledgeable human beings I've ever encountered, consistently providing information about South African culture, geography and history, all packaged with a humorous twist. The tour itself covers a ton of ground, and really catches all of the highlights you'd want to see. You can see the seals, hang out with penguins, bike through the Cape Point National Park, do some short hikes, and watch ostriches cross the road. Perhaps at times it's a little rushed when you're moving around from place to place, but overall, I thought Mark and Freddie killed it when giving the tour. It was one of the most fun experiences I had in South Africa. So just know that this isn't necessarily the Baz Bus as you may know it from going up and down the Garden Route. This is the day trip to Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope that is way more social and crazy. Definitely hit it up, and be sure to photo bomb people at the Cape of Good Hope--it's just too easy and fun not to!

Baz Buz trip to Cape Point 23 December 2013. I thought that the Baz Bus trip to Cape Point and later the walk across to Cape Hope was fantastic. I'm an Australian and It was a real pleasure for me to walk up to the lighthouse at Cape Point and look out to the Atlantic Ocean where my Scottish ancestors from the Isle of Skye would would have passed 168 years ago. Roger Airley (sic) was a great commentator and I learned a lot of historical information that he pointed out along the route. Freddie, too, was an extremely competent driver. Although i have rated this trip as excellent I would mention an improvement to management. I can't see the point in towing the bikes on a trailer over the fairly large distance travelled so that the tour group can ride bikes over six kilometres. There would be a considerbale cost saving in fuel if that part of the activity was deleted. Further, there is the risk that a rider might miss the pick-up point, and like me, end up cycling the whole way to Cape Point. That wasn't a problem for me but according to Freddie it's not the first time that a rider hasn't turned up and required an extensive search before being found.

wonderful day trip!. It was the perfect way to see the area! I found it extremely informative and really enjoyed everything about the tour!

Great Peninsula Tour with Roger and Freddy!. We had a wonderful day on the Baz Bus with our guide Roger and driver Freddy. Great day out !. Affordable and fun day tour to enjoy the best of the Cape.Roger our tour guide provided excellent information and did a great job as a photographer! A Day Well Spent!. The Baz Bus Cape Point tour certainly lived up to expectations. We had bad weather for parts of it, but tour guide Mark's sunny disposition made up for the clowds! A word of advice to those who like me, will be riding a bike for the first time in their adult lives... Get someone on the tour to help you figure out the gears on your bike. The first half of the ride is uphill, and if you're in the wrong gear, you'll be super exhausted! The most fun part of the tour for me was the optional boat ride to see the seals. It was not the seals that were exciting, as much as the ride! Travelling out in to the bay on a little boat in choppy waters made us all realise just how courageous early travellers must have been... And it was just plain fun to be on nature's rollercoaster. Even the members of our group who normally suffer from sea sickness had a great time. I reccomend wearing layers and carrying a small rain jacket (it's cold at Cape Point, warm in the bus, and it will probably rain at some point on your journey)We saw wild seals, penguins, ostriches, baboons and buck. No zebra or whales, but who's complaining?!Frankie the bus driver and Mark the tour guide were helpful and jolly and made even the dull bits fun. All in all, I reccomend you do this early in your trip as it will give you a flavour of the region.

Great trip!. This was an awesome trip at a great value. Had a blast seeing the penguins, saw some baboons, elands and red heartabeast at the Cape of Good Hope Reserve. Fantastic Day at the Cape. Baz Bus was the perfect way for my friend and I to see the Cape. Roger also took pictures throughout the day and sent them out after the tour, which was a great way to get a few more shots from the day.

Excellent value for money and great tour guide!. My friend and I booked to do this tour as we only had three full days in Cape Town and wanted to see as much as possible. It picked us up from our hostel in the morning, (a little late due to some other passengers getting on the wrong bus!) and from the start Roger the tour guide was a font of local knowledge! We stopped in many lovely places; Hout Bay where there was the option of a boat ride to get closer to a seal colony, Boulders Bay to see the African Penguin colony, a bike ride through a national park before a simple but tasty lunch, and a trip to Cape Point followed by a short walk/hike to the Cape of Good Hope. We even drove through a small town called Scarborough on the way back to Cape Town, which was exciting for me as that is the name of my home town in England. It was a very enjoyable day, and considering it only cost us 490R each (we received a 50R discount as we purchased Baz Bus tickets from Port Elizabeth to Cape Town) it was excellent value for money. Roger and Freddie the driver were both friendly and pleasant people, and as previously mentioned Roger was full of interesting facts and information throughout the entire day.In reply to previous reviews, the bikes did not seem dangerous, the brakes were not as responsive as the ones on my bike at home but they certainly worked well enough for me!

He also emails photos he takes during the trip...just because he's THAT NICE. You see and do a lot for your Rand! I suggest the seal-viewing option...amazing how close the boat gets to them and the water is such a clear, turquoise blue. Lunch was great: simple but filling (make your own sandwiches)...my favorite part was hiking the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point. STUNNING, GORGEOUS views...the color of the ocean breath-taking! Too bad there was not more time riding the bicycles. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this tour and would do it again.

APPRECIATION OF THE CAPE PENININSULA TOUR. First, let me thank you Roger for taking your time emailing me back on the adventurous dayi realy appreciate and its unbelievable and amazing experience.,it was one of my first impression when i just got on the awesome BAZ BUSi realy enjoyed the tour and moved me to a great knowledge about Cape point and Cape of Good hope which i previously learned at school as history,despite being few,the people were realy wonderful all from Korea,Australia and Germany.i was so much impressed by the chapman's peak drive after you guided us that its one of the most scenic peak drive in South AfricaPass my gratitude to driver Aubrey,he was an easy going person,cheerful and could stop at places with unexpected stoppages for the sake of us,once again,warm regards till we meet again at HOLIDAY BACKPACKERS,thanks for the photos also

Fantastic tour of cape point/cape of good hope with brilliant guide roger airey who was a mine of information.. Great value for money and roger airey was a great guide, would definitely recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the cape of good hope :)

Great tour. We did this tour a week ago (21 March) it was the best tour we did so far. Great day out. Really a fab day out. Roger, our guide, was very knowledgable and interesting. We saw lots and with cyling and walking also did lots. Great way to see the peninsula if you don't have your own car. And even then, you'd miss out on the info and the good company. Really enjoyed it and do recommend it.

A wonderful day trip. Thank you to Togeda and Mark for a wonderful tour of the Peninsula. A well organised and thought out day trip- I would recommend this trip to anyone who has a free day in Cape Town. One thing, however, please get some better quality bikes!

The Best Way to see South Africa!!. Travelling around South Africa alone could be a nervy experience but with Baz Bus I have been travelling from Pretoria and am on the way to Cape Town. There are different ticket types and I have chosen a 2 week hop on-hop off ticket (unfortunately time constraints mean I cannot take more time to do this trip). Basically you can choose from well over 100 hostels and work your way down the stunning coast via the breath-taking Drakensberg Mountains. With so many fellow travellers, finding friends is easy. The vehicles are kept in good condition and the drivers are informative. This is a brilliant way to see South Africa, giving you the freedom to build your own trip and I would highly recommend it.see http://journals.worldnomads.com/butterfly-freed/ for more info on my trip
Thanks for getting me to the Adventures. This is a great way to discover South Africa. The concept and service really made for an incredible introduction to a fabulous Country and it's people, Thanks
Great tour, very fun!. Interesting and fun tour. Met some great people. Really enjoyed it. Tour guide Roger Airey is very good at his job and an excellent tour guide.

Very good Baz Bus - Day Tour. Worth doing.. This a great tour for a one day snapshot of life and scenery around the Cape Peninsula. Cape Point trip. Yumna was pleasant and very informative. All seemed to enjoy the trip. Will recommend this trip to any visitor to CT.

Great day trip!. I went with friends from my hostel. I think everything was included that we want to see like penguins and cape point.We had some bike riding and a really great guide and lunch.I will recommend this tour.

Not as good as the reviews suggest. Having read all the good reviews, we decided to do the tour. Unfortunately the forget to pick us up. To be fair, it happens very rarely as far as I'm aware. Amazing sites to see and great history and love the animals. It was a great tour of cape town and I would do it again. Even better than I expected -- Cape Peninsula Tour. What a great tour! So much packed into one day, and our guide Mark Fortuin was knowledgeable, friendly and fun. Peninsula Day Tour - perfect!. Having a beautiful surround and amazing weather is one thing. In order to make any tour exceptional, the staff need to be enthusiastic knowledgable and patient! Great Tour -Penisnula day Tour. Great one day tour to see the Cape Peninsula, the sights are magnificent and Mark was very helpful in explaining everything we saw during the day. There is a wonderful bicycle ride and some walking up a small mountain..get your cameras ready because you will want to capture everything.

Peninsula Day Tour. Really enjoyed the tour. The Cape Peninsula is a beautiful place and this was a great way to see the main attractions in a single day. Tour guide Mark was great, really knew his stuff and gave us a lot of extra information and knowledge about the area and its history. Met a lot of nice people too, so all in all would definitely recommend

Amazing tour. This was my second time on the Peninsula tour with Bazbus in a year, first with my fellow students Jan 12, second with my boyfriend Jan 13. The tour was absolutely amazing both times. Looking back on my first visit to CT this was my favorite tour. Our guide Roger on both 1st and 2nd trip, was very helpfull and knows just about everything there is to know about anything. It's the cheapest Peninsula Tour and great value for my money. For further improvement I would suggest adding a bathroom break on the way back to CT, it's an absolute must when you've been walking for hours in the sun, and using the second entrance to the penguins on Boulders beach on weekdays, it costs the same and you can actually go down to the penguins there. We tried making it over there from the first entrance but there wasn't enough time. It would make the trip even better as a lot of people think they are going to go down on the beach with the penguins and might find themselves disappointed. Otherwise this trip has everything: bicycling, hiking, stunning nature, wild baboons, penguins, lunch included. Highly recommended.

Fab tour!. I had the chance to take part to the Baz Bus Day Tour to Cape Point last week, and it was really one of the best excursions of my life. And Roger (Airey) our tour guide, was perfect in describing everything about the place we were visiting and about South Africa.I would definitely recommend this tour to anybody (we were people from all over the world from 20 to 65 years old).Luisa (Italy)

Peninsula Day Tour. A very nice day tour and defiantly a tour you have to do when you are in Cape Town. All the people on the group were very nice and the tour guide, Roger Airey was able to give loads of extra information on Cape Town. Baz bus peninsula tour. This was an excellent tour! The day was very well spent with a variety of activities. A tourguide often makes or brakes any tour or safari you make. Our guide was Roger Airey. Great Peninsula!. The tour guide Mark was amazing very friendly and personable with quirky extra insides and useful info! AMAZING!!. This is an amazing tour, defiantly value for money. Boulders beach was my favourite :) It made it extra special as the staff were very friendly, Roger and Joseph! They are very informative and will answer any questions you may have. Thank you

5 for the Guide. Baz Bus Peninsula Tour. This tour is a great way to see the highlights of the peninsula and an awesome day out with a mixture of sightseeing, cycling and hiking (if you choose). A must for those visiting Cape Town. I had an excellent tour with guide Roger and driver Joseph. We covered so many things in one short day, yet without shortchanging any one attraction. Cape Point Tour. An amazing trip, awesome ways to see the best views of Cape town. Am happy this time i managed to ride the bike and do every thing the trip had to offer.Thank you to Melanie for getting me on this trip and i will come back and do it again.

Peninsula Tour. A great day out with Roger at the helm giving pearls of wisdom and interesting insights.His sense of humour kept us all going. Very Good. I was assisted by Yumna Isaacs and I must say that she was very professional. She not only helped me with all bus connections for my 21 day tour, she helped me call each hostel and I am now completely set up for my trip. I would highly recommend Yumna for any travel requirements.

BAZ Bus Nov 12 Peninsula tour. Thanks to Roger for a great day! Good mix of activities, not too much time in the bus. Excellent views of Fur Seals and the Penguins. Good lunch in a great location. Made my trip to Cape Town, on a tight budget.

Very exiting Baz Bus Peninsula daytour with thanks to tourguide Mark Fortuin. We had a wonderful day with our tourguide Mark Fortuin who told us a lot of interesting things about the aria. His enthousiasm and friendly character made that we had a great day on the Cape.

Great day tour. I have really enjoyed the tour. Our guide Grant was excellent. Fun tour around the peninsula. nice tour to the cape point including biking and a bit of hiking. a really nice tour to the peninsula including various stops like boulders beach, where you can see the penguins, cape point, the cape of good hope as well as a breakfast and lunch stop. there is also the possibility of biking a few kilometres down the cape and a scenic hike down from cape point to the cape of good hope.

Fantastic day. A bunch of friends and I did the tour on the 24th of sept. Had an absolutely fantastic day, good sights, good food and Roger the tour guide was awesome, knew so much stuff about the areas and made the whole day fun.Highly recommended :)Anthony

Great day out - Cape Peninsula Tour. We found that our tour to the Cape Peninsula was very professional and fun. Our guide was very energetic and had a great character, our driver was very smooth and unnerving. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly and found that our stops at Haut Bay, and Simons Town were timed just right to avoid crowds and so that we didn't spend time waiting around. The boat trip from Haut Bay to the seal colony was quite nice, and we saw plenty of seals in very clear waters. The bicycles could have been in better condition with a bit of TLC or upgrades needed. E.G. my bike had no brakes and couldn't change gears. The ride is not very challenging, riding only approx 5kms, slightly uphill but with rewarding views. The walks from Cape Point and then onto Cape of Good Hope were mostly on boardwalks with more steep downhill than up.There was plenty of food to go around for lunch which was fresh and tasty. We would recommend this trip to anyone who would like to get out of the city and see some of the country side.

Outstanding Day Trip to Cape Peninsula. I took the BazBus day trip to the Cape Peninsula with my 2 girls, aged 9 and 13 years old. The trip was very well organised and the guide Roger Airey was excellent - he was knowledgable and presented facts in an interesting and humorous manner. The trip took us to the fishing harbour of Hout Bay where we took an amazing boat trip (extra) to Seal Island. We saw hundreds of seals in their natural environment and the boat ride itself was an exciting 'roller coaster' ride over 3 meter waves. We drove along narrow Champan's peak with stunning views of the Atlantic,rocky mountains and white beautiful sandy beaches. The well thought-out-route took us through the fishing villages of Fish Hoek and Simon's Town to Boulders Beach where we stopped to see the famous Cape Penguins in their natural environment (entrance fee included in the Day Tour). From there we drove to Cape Point (entrance fee included in the Day Tour) and were lucky enough to see several baboons along the way! In the beautiful nature reserve, Edyn, my eldest daughter, did the bicycle ride to our picnic spot a few kilometers away. She loved the ride and said it was a unique experience to be on a bicycle with the blue sky overhead, the fynbos around her and the cool breeze in her face (highlight of her trip). Lunch (included in the price of the day trip) was very good and included fresh rolls (choice of white and whole wheat), fresh salad, pastrami and cheese, an apple and fresh fruit juice. After lunch we walked up to the light house to see the point where the 2 oceans (Atlantic and Indian) meet. Stunningly beautiful views. Then we took a lovely hike (about 45 minutes) down to the Cape of Good Hope - where we met up with the bus. The walk was exhilirating and the views breathtakingly beautiful. This was the highlight of the trip for me. From Cape Point we drove along scenic roads back to town. My girls and I absolutely loved the trip - from start to finish. Sharon, Edy and Noa - Israel.

Cape Peninsula Tour. It's a fun way to see the magnificent cape peninsula landscape and shores. I'd definetely recommend it to others.

Outstanding family day trip from Cape Town to Cape Point. On a beautiful winter day, we (1 adult and 1 child ( 8) joined the BAZ-BUS day trip from Cape town to cape point. The guide, Roger, was knowledgeable and interesting. the trip was very well organized and planned. The selected routes were beautiful. we drove along Chapman's Peak , a unique and winding road overlooking the Atlantic. the tour included a boat ride (extra and very cheap ride 65Rands adult 25Rands child) to the Seal Island Colony (hundreds of seals). we saw Penguins at Boulder beach in their natural environment. Roger accompanied us to all the sights and informed us on facts and details in a humorous and interesting way. the final attraction was Cape Point where Roger took us on a stunning 45 min. track down to the Cape of Good hope, where the Baz Bus was waiting for us at the end. The trip also included a bicycle ride through the nature reserve to our picnic point where we all enjoyed a good and healthy lunch (part of the trip fee)The trip is highly recommended for families ( 7yr old and up) and backpackers of all ages.One of the best day trips we have ever doneYoram and Etai from Israel

bazbus team are great!!. sitting in Australia and trying to organise our adventure was driving me nuts, then the wonderful team at bazbus kindly and with good humour answered my emails. I know these guys will be there to steer us in the right direction and perhaps sigh with relief when we finally get it right. anyone tettering on the edge of middle age - be like us and just do it - knowing the bazbus team is there. Perfect way to see the highlights of Cape Town. Great day, great guide (Roger), great views and a great lunch! Cape Town tour. Roger Airey baz bus tour rocks!. The Cape Point tour with Roger was wonderful -- he is very knowledgable and charismatic, and we had a wonderful day! Fit in a full schedule of activites while maintaining a laid back, not rushed vibe. The baz bus is great.

Great day tour. My friend and I did the Cape Peninsula tour with Baz Bus on the 31st May, it was a brilliant day out, especially getting to see the penguins!! Awesome views and great guide. The day trip to Cape Peninsula is awesome. Just choose a sunny day and you'll envoy a lot. Wonderful day with Baz Bus!. Just amazing, perfect and very friendly! Baz Bus took us around cape town and down to cape point. Best day in South Africa. We had such a perfect tour of the whole peninsula. It was affordable, inclusive, fun, and a perfect and easy way to see tons of spots between Cape Town and Cape Point. Our guide was awesome, knowledgeable, and flexible. We had a great lunch too! I HIGHLY recommend it!!!!

Awesome day tour. Excellent value for money on this tour. My hostel booked this for me and I had such a great day. I learnt so much about Cape Town and the area. The whole area is really beautiful and impressive.

Fantastic tour. Had a lot of fun on my cape peninsula tour. Very well organized, goes through all the main sights/sites, doesn't feel rushed or anything, I was very happy with my experience. Great Tour with Great People. Tour locations were pretty good, relatively good way to get around to all these spots, meet some fun people, and have everything taken care of for you. A must!. The Cape Peninsular tour was such an informative and enjoyable day trip that I strongly recommend it to all. Especially as Roger was such a good guide and so knowledgable. His local historical knowledge is very impressive! Brilliant day! Thank-you Roger and Baz bus.

A brilliant day that even the occasional rain couldn't spoil for us!. This was an unbelievable day tour with roger from Baz Bus. I can only recommend everyone to take that tour. excellent guide, fun group, great value. Couldn't have asked for more. Roger our guide was excellent. Good mix of outdoors, stories, and activities - very enjoyable tour!!. FANTASTIC. Just wanted to write and say THANK YOU for an incredible experience with you guys. Best choice imaginable for a Cape Tour. I got the hint to go to see the Peninsular by BazBus by a friend and though admittedly never skeptical, the Tour itself was exceeding every hope. amaizing day out. on the 19 of december last year me and my friends had the most amaizing day out on the baz bus. the guide, grant was hospitable, fun and very informative. i have done alot of day trips world wide , but this one had everything thrown in. both a scenic experience( we drove from sea point all the way to cape point),and an energetic one. we did a 5km cycle in the cape point nature reserve( optional) and when we arrived at our destination we were surprised by a most delicious picnic lunch , compliments of the baz bus. followed by a short hike. on the hout bay leg we experienced a boat trip to seal island.other attractions included boulders beach and the beautiful view on chapmans peak.it was a most enjoyableday. we did not have to worry about getting back and was dropped off right where we were staying.the day trip was excellent value , everything was thought about and it was an easy way to see the cape peninsula.thanks everyone at the baz bus for a great day out. highly recommended!!!!!

Wonderful day trip!!!. I took the Peninsula tour and was great. I really recommend that. Our tour guide was Roger Airey. He was very nice as the same about the driver. Thank you all for the lovely day!!!

Terrible Service, Overpriced and Unsafe. I took a day tour down to the Cape of Good Hope with Baz Bus in January 2012. As far as activities in Cape Town go it's definitely one of the most expensive choices but I went for it anyway because it made so many stops, offered lunch and a variety of experiences including site seeing, hiking and bicycling. In hindsight I wish I had partnered with people in my hostel to rent a car and left Baz Bus off of my itinerary. Downsides of my trip:-Aside from the driver's area the buses do not have A/C. In a 40C day this turns the rest of the bus into a miserably hot oven. You spend 8+ tortuous hours in this bus, it's miserable.-There are really only two interesting stops, the penguins (Boulder Beach) and the Cape of Good Hope. The rest of the trip is wasted time and/or costs extra (seal island is an additional fee).-The talking part of the tour is minimal, the guide shares only snippets of info, very little quality education about what you're seeing and its history. He spends the time making jokes about guests' countries of origin instead of providing info about the tour.-Bicycles are provided for a brief ride through the park but they're absolutely crap. The first bike they gave me was broken but I realized it right away and swapped for a second. The second bike they gave me broke during the ride but being that they do not have a sweeper following the group I was left to hitch hike out of the park!! I sent a message to to the trip leader with another bike that my bike had broken but I didnt know how far it would be, or how long it would take to get there. They give you a map but the tour guide told us he wouldnt come back looking for stragglers until 3pm, and it was 12:45pm when my bike broke down. He later said he was joking about the time but I of course I didn't know that and thought I was looking at 2+ hours in the blazing sun, which is what led me to hitchhike instead of just sit down on the side of the road and wait. When I finally made it to the meet up point the tour guide was shoving a sandwich in his face, didn't apologize even once for the broken bike/anxiety/scare and then said, "oh sorry, we went bezerk on lunch". They hadn't even saved me food! He later said, "well, things happen, OK?" I said "No, it's no OK. Your bikes are garbage, totally not maintained and you put people out on the road on them without safety precautions to guard against incidents. It's anything but OK." He still never apologized or even acknolwedged that the incident was incredibly stressful for me.-The hike isnt 'easy' but it's well worth it. Bring water and keep buying refills at the stops as they never give you any along the way. Sunscreen and a hat are essential at the Cape of Good Hope, it can be blazing hot.-If you aren't fit then go with a buddy. As mentioned above, they don't use a standard sweeper method so if you break your leg or have problems on the hike they wont know about, they're waiting down in the A/C bus. Without a buddy you wouldn't be able to get a message to them.All together I think the Baz Bus day tour is way overpriced and very poorly run. This kind of operation wouldn't last a season in the states for safety reasons alone but owing to the very serious quality shortcomings too. If it was $30 or therabouts then maybe it's tolerable but at $70 (R550) it's a total rip off.I wish I had never done this tour and would absolutely recommend against it to travelers who can find an alternative way to get to the southern end of the Cape.

Great Comprehensive, Friendly Tour. This was a great, friendly, efficient way to see so much of Cape Town and its environs. Our tour leader Roger was very kind and informative, even providing us afterwards with pictures of us as we were participating in the short (optional) biking portion of the program. There was just the right balance between meeting new people and being in a group and being able to take off on your own and do your own thing. Plus, there were options at each juncture for people of all fitness levels and desires. I highly recommend this tour.

Great value for money tour of Cape Point. We really wanted to see the sights of Cape Point and the Baz Bus tour was a fantastic way to do so.Our guide - Roger Airey - was helpful and knowledgeable about the area. There was never a dull moment in the bus with his commentary.We were collected from our hostel at 8am and the went to Hout Bay where there was an opportunity to see the seals. Next on to the dramatic Chapman's Peak drive which was spectacular. We then saw the penguins where - personally - I would have liked to tarry a little longer. Then down further towards Cape Point where we rode bikes for 5k or so which was brilliant fun.We stopped for a basic but filling lunch of cold meats and salad following the cycle ride. Juice was available. I would suggest Baz Bus consider giving people who wish to the opportunity to purchase a cold beer at this point.Finally, it was on to Cape Point itself and then a short hike down to the Cape of Good Hope before back to our Hostel around 5pm.Overall, a really enjoyable day which managed to take in all the sights while still offering you the opportunity to get out of the bus and stretch your legs. Our guide Roger was really good, even taking the trouble to email us some pictures he'd taken on the day which I thought was a lovely touch. Finally, compared to the other tour operators the price is very competetive making this a great value-for-money day out.

What a great day!. I only had a couple of days in Cape Town and really wanted to see Cape point and the cape of good hope. The Baz Bus day trip gave me that and more. What a Joke!!!. The drivers for BazBus were very helpful but what a joke this company is! They advertise as a "stop-on stop-off" anywhere on your route but the reality is that you have to stop where the mandatory stops are... this was a problem because one of the mandatory overnights was in Durban during a huge worldwide conference - making it impossible to get a place to stay overnight, therefore making it impossible to continue on our route. If you don't make it to the mandatory stops you don't proceed. The woman who booked our tickets at the African Center would not help us book a hostel in Durban - she told us we would be fine or we could give her R30 to make a phone call. What a Joke!!! Then they almost didn't let us on because we didn't have a hostel booked - all we had was our ticket. They don't stop for sights - only at gas stations for food - and its super uncomfortable. The seats don't recline and most of the people on our bus smelled really bad - showers anyone? The drive from Durban to Port Elizabeth turned into a 17 hour nightmare - stopping at 930pm for dinner at a gas station that had no food left - we had popcorn and water for dinner - then arrived in PE at 130am... Horrible. We scrapped the remainder of our ticket and rented a car - the best thing we ever did - to complete the garden route - too many missed picture opportunities while on the bus! - my advice - splurge on a car and find some friends if you don't have the money. SA is too beautiful to miss because you are on a stinky, crappy bus!

Best one-day tour. The tour guide, Grant, met us with a smile and got the trip started on a relaxed, friendly mode. He made the entire trip fun and interesting, but not only giving us facts, but by adding some humour to the trip.My 9-year old had the best time, as she had an opportunity to feed a seal at Hout Bay.Grant & even Talieb were super patient with her and I appreciate that greatly.I'd recommend this tour with the Baz Bus guys (especially Grant & Talieb) to anyone, anyday!It really was great!
Red Red wine !!!!. The bus was awesome and took free pictures for you too (lot of fun!!)

Perfect Ending to Cape Town and South Africa. My friend and I took the full day tour through the Cape Peninsula. The day is absolutely jammed packed full of wonderful activities. Our tour guide, Grant, was stunning at his job. He's been leading tours for four years, he does everything very smoothly and has great comedic timing. Grant is very knowledgeable about South Africa, and is interesting to talk to because he can speak frankly about the history of South Africa--very helpful for a tourist to get a real run-down.He guides you through a really wonderful day, and he's very friendly and approachable--so if you're doing this tour alone, don't worry, he makes it very comfortable. The day is very planned out but not regimented.My favorite part is that he's very accommodating to his tour groups by snapping any pictures of them they want!Baz Bus is the perfect choice because you meet adventurous people, vs. stodgy tour groups (and they are everywhere!), it's an affordable way to do it, the fees are included and they provide lunch. Also, the Baz Bus will never leave you behind, they are accountable for you and so they will wait if people are running late--which is just so helpful!!!I love Baz Bus and cannot recommend this enough!

Bazbus is such a great company !. I'll be visiting SA next week, I bought a ticket from PE to CT and the Peninsula tour at once. I was surprised at the beginning because I felt that I missed this offer for less than 24 hours. Perfect tour to see all the great spots in CT. My sister and I have done the Cape Peninsula tour with Baz Bus and both of us loved it! It is a great way to see the stunning landscape around Cape Town, especially when you don't have your own wheels. Besides that the Baz Bus team is really awesome and gives a lot of interesting facts combined with a lot of fun! The tour started with a scenic route through Cape Town (Clifton, Camps Bay) to the lovely harbour of Hout Bay where we had the opportunity to take a boat to a seal island. We also tasted some seafood - the calamary there is the bomb! Than the tour took us along Chapmans Peak, the most beautiful coast drive. We even saw whales on our way to Simons Town! There we visited the African Penguin colony - a very unique experience to see those kind of animals chilling on the beach between palme trees :)! Next stop was National Park where we did a nice, little cycling tour to Cape Point with a delicious picnic stop with sandwiches, olives, fruites, juice etc. My favorite part of the tour was the following hike from Cape Point to Cape of Good Hope. The path is very good and the landscape is just overwhelming! If you have time hike down to Diaz Beach!To sum it up: we had a stunning day packed with a lot of great experiences. It had the right mixture between information, sight seeing and action. I would suggest Baz Bus especially because of its great guides and the fun atmosphere. Thanks a lot!

A great way to see Cape Point. We hadn't planned on doing any real activities while in Cape Town. We heard someone did this tour to Cape Point and really enjoyed it. So, we signed up. They were having a special so it was cheaper than normal. We had a personable guide. We went to the harbor to take a boat to see the Seals, then to the Penguin Reserve, bike riding through the national park, hiking up around the tip of the Point and then back to our hotel. I would recommend it because it was a great way to see the areas that are difficult to get to without a car. It's a big pricy for what it is, but everything is Africa is overpriced.

A great day at the Peninsula. The Cape Peninsula tour was great. We got to see the seals at Hout Bay and the penguins at Boulders Beach before going to the Peninsla National Park, where we had a short bicycle time (no cycling expertise required) and a nice lunch before getting to the amazing vies at Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point.

Great day out to Cape Point!. This was an amazing trip! Great scenery, lots of stops and great staff. The cycle through the national park is fairly easy, this way you can really enjoy the surroundings, stop for photo's and maybe spot some wildlife. Lunch after the cycle was really good! Would definitely recommend this trip to anyone that wants to go to the Cape Peninsula.

Great Trip to Remember!. The Cape Peninsula was one of best day tours i did in Cape Town. The guide was really brilliant, lovely and fun. The activity is worth the money charged. Its very organized and informative tour with beautiful places and animals to see. I would recommend it to anyone be it for groups or single travelers you will not be bored. If you are looking for a trip so comfortable and enjoyable this is the one.Bring a Camera fully charged and lots of film. Shoes for cycling. This is a whole day trip to full of fun and you get to meet other travelers.Thumbs up to Melanie and the whole crew!

Cape Point Day Trip. A great way to visit the coastal areas and attractions of Cape Town.I really enjoyed the mix of cycling (only 5kms), hiking (<2 hrs) as well as the tour's flexibility to stroll along the beach at Hout Bay, as well as 'must stop photo stops' near Chapman's Peak Drive.Both the guide and driver were helpful and enthusiastic - providing historical and quirky information on each area.A very enjoyable day out!

Fantastic day out with great guide. Lots to see in such a beautiful part of the world. Mel who works for BAZ BUS is brilliant, a fun and energetic person with a great character. I travelled on the BAZ BUS from Cape Town to Durban and would recommend it to anybody wanting an easy, comfortable and enjoyable way to see South Africa's highlights.

Good Tour, Good Guide, Good Food, Good fun.. Great day out and would highly recommend it.

Brilliant Day Out. The guide and driver were really enthusiastic and knew so much about the area, history and random facts that kept us entertained.The trip itself covers lots of places, with variety of animals and landscapes; be prepared to take lots of photos!You get to meet other like minded travellers and the cycle ride is a great way to see more of nature. Definitely reccomended and would love to go again!

Great trip, definitely recommend. I did the tour last year and it was a great way to see Cape Town. The tour guide and driver were very friendly, knowledgeable of every aspects of Cape Town, and entertaining. The price was right as was the schedule of different spots to visit. Overall, it was a awesome experience and I would recommend this to all visiting Cape Town.

Great experience. Me and my friend used the Baz Bus last saturday to do the Cape peninsula tour.It was a great, well organized tour. The bus stopped on the most beautiful places, and we even got picked up and brought back home! I had a really pleasant experience on the Baz Bus and the driver and gide where so friendly.Next time I will defiantly use Baz Bus again! Thank you for the great trip!

Excursion to Cape of Good Hope- Friends of Dorothy. Excellent for for a one-day excursion in Cape Town, Friends of Dorothy and Tim are totally recommendable: reliability, good organization and good choice of best scenic spots, witty and intelligent travel guide.

cape town. Tim did an amazing job--very knowledgeable, efficient, great sense of humor, feel like we really got a wonderful taste of the area--he is a wealth of knowledge regarding not only the sights, but also the politics, the culture, the history and nuances

Cape Peninsula. We had an informative, light-hearted, full-day with Tim Freeman circumnavigating the Cape Peninsula in his all-comfort land barge. He picked up on special "wishes" and made them happen save for that Band of Zebra we thought he might pull out of his magic bag. Next time.
