exclusive tour to Cape of Good Hope, Boulder to see the Penquins, Lunch at Cape Point etc. Just need people to know Tim Freeman is one of the best tour guides I have had the experience of knowing. He is quite friendly, very knowlegeable, and a great historian !We spent a full day driving to the end of the cape, down to Cape of Good Hope, Boulder to visit the natural penquin colony there. Lunch at Cape Point Restaurant was excellent. Drove to Chapman Peak, saw the wonderful beaches of Cape Town, where the great white sharks breed. Cape Good Hope, the lighthouse, center of the earth, the line of oceans meeting Atlantic and Indian oceans etc. What a day. Excellent tour. Just contact Friends of Dorothy for your experience

Perfect Day. Tim did a great job and highly recommend. My friends and I had 1 free day in Cape Town. He was a referral and he was perfect. We don't drink much so didn't want to do a full day going to wineries but wanted to see the scenery of the area. He personalized the day and suggested a visit to the Dylan Lewis sculpture garden. This was the highlight of the day. Tim's knowledge and sense of humor made the rainy day a highlight of our entire trip to South Africa.

CAPETOWN tours with TIM FREEMAN. Let me begin by saying that Tim is a wonderful God, he is very knowledgeable on all of the sites and everything there is to see in Cape Town and beyond. We toured the city of Cape Town, the Y Winelands, The peninsula, the Township of longa. I found Tim to be a walking encyclopedia with Humor added. I would certainly recommend ham highly to any new Cape Town visitors.

Fantastic Tour Guide and Service. Tim is an incredible guide! Best way to see the Cape Peninsula in a day. His robust knowledge of the history, animals, plant life and "must see's" made for an interesting and meaningful tour. I highly recommend this company.

The Cape in a day.. From the initial contact with Tim, via recommendation, he was attentive and keen to deliver exactly what we wanted. In our case an intense 1 day private tour of the Cape.He delivered, we had a great day, it was informative and humorous, Tim's knowledge of all things RSA, but also many other topics, is truly impressive.So we would recommend him without hesitation.
Top moment!. What a great guide to visit Cape Town area!...lot of knowledge and very nice person! Pro-active to offer out of the box tours, so you don't feel you are with the mass of tourists.

Tim's customized tour made our South African visit perfect!. My husband, cousin, and I were visiting South Africa last October. We were confirmed on a ten-day bicycle trip leaving from Cape Town followed by two safaris. We were arriving in Cape Town five days before our tours were to begin. Tim and I corresponded via email numerous times. Tim reviewed our trips and put together two days of touring that did NOT overlap with anything we would be doing. His expertise and willingness to work with us rounded out our vacation perfectly. The three of us would highly recommend any tours (especially self arranged) by Friends of Dorothy, especially Tim Freeman.

Another Perfect Day !. This was a very good day of exploring sights and scenic views that I've never seen before. Tim organized my trip by reviewing things and areas I had visited last year. Tim proposed a tour route and then executed it perfectly. I really enjoyed the day and Tim made me feel comfortable all the many many miles we traveled. Tim went out of the way ( overtime) to get everything accomplished ( visited). A very good way to see the Cape , highly recommend!

great day out in the winelands. great day out visiting wineries for tastings - including the beautiful stark conde winery and the winery at maison.Interesting visit to Franschoek centre. Tim is informative as a guide and lots of interesting anecdotes

onederful. had two trips out with Tim on this visit to cape town - some beautiful wineries and a visit to an interesting farm garden which grew every kind of produce in a most wonderful location - second visit to a sculpture garden - an oasis of calm and beauty- Tim is a knowledgeable guide and good company - a must when in cape town!

Amusing and Educational. We visited a few select vineyards and were treated especially well as Tim appears to have such a good relationship with them. He guided us smoothly through the wine tastings, and the region, with great knowledge, both of the wines, and the locale. We stopped for a relaxed lunch at one of the vineyards but went with the a la carte rather than the tasting menu so as to give us time to fit in more vineyards in the afternoon. The minibus was very comfortable for the six of us, with plenty of space for our purchases en route. We thoroughly enjoyed our day and count it among the highlights of our time in Capetown
Great Experience. We absolutely loved touring the wine lands with Tim during our honeymoon. He took us to some exclusive places and was very knowledgeable about the region and the culture.

Cape Wineries (Stellenbosch and Franschhoek). This was an excellent tour, conducted with panache by Tim. We visited the following wineries (with their highlights):1) Meerlust: Rubicon (Bordeax-style) blend, mostly Bordeaux red grapes (Merlot/Cab) but also a Pinot Noir2) Simonsig: the Tiara (Bordeaux-style) blend, Mr. Borio's Shiraz, and the two Chenin Blancs that Ellis hated3) Hartenberg: the Mackenzie (Bordeaux-style) blend and the full range of reds4) Moreson: Pinotage and sparkling winesWe received a warm reception at each of the wineries, as well as a good selection of excellent wines. I would give the edge to Simonsig because their excellent Shiraz offerings. Note that the selection of wineries may change with each tour on account of availability and scheduling. You really can't go wrong with the South African wineries, however, either on account of the wines offered or the bucolic settings.At Franschhoek, we had an excellent lunch at the French Connection restaurant. The menu was extensive and highly affordable, and we were allowed to uncork our two bottles of "Mackenzie" wines just purchased at Hartenberg. Several of us ordered the sliced kudu (large antelope) steak, which was juicy and delicious, a perfect match for our wines!Cape Town is a wonderful city to visit, but it's not easy to visit either the Cape of Good Hope or the Cape wineries if you don't have a car. Tim is a knowledgeable and charismatic guide who showed us all of these places and greatly enhanced our visit. And he was very patient with our sometimes chaotic seven-person group. Finally, while this probably goes without saying given the company's name, Tim was the perfect match for our group with 5 of 7 members being openly gay men. We learned a lot! :-)

Excellent Day Tour of Cape Town. I arrived with a large group from the USA and decided to book a day tour of Cape Town with Tim. I couldn't be more pleased with the experience. Tim was friendly and knowledgeable, and a true professional. The best part of the experience is that he was able to offer several suggestions, and then tailored the tour around our individual choices. I highly recommend him for your stay in Cape Town.

Knowledgable and diligent tour guide. Tim was wonderful to work with. We (my husband, 20 yo daughter and I) corresponded and talked on the phone with him before our trip, and he helped us to scope out what we would do in Capetown on our own, and what we would do with him: one day to the Peninsula and one day to the Wine Country. Tim made a real effort to discern what did and didn't interest us -- he adjusted restaurants for the second day with him based on our reactions to the first. Also, having noticed our interest in nature, he took us to the beautiful Babylonstoren farm.

Detailed and well planned out 3 day trip. We were a group of us traveling from Washington D.C and Tim came highly recommended to us. He lived up to everything we had been told!. Our day trips, meals and travel arrangements were all well thought out and carefully planned. Tim is also well informed about local stuff and is able to answer most trivia questions and historical tidbits, which we did bombard him with.He should be your first choice for any Cape Town and surround travel plans!.

Inspiring guided tour in Cape Town. Tim Freman planed after our preferences, organized and led us (family of 5, age 12 to 55 years) through a wonderful day in Cape Town. He was knowledgeable, amusing and inspiring. Highly recommended!

What a Treat!. From the moment we met up with Tim to the time of drop off we had an amazing time throughout. The wealth of knowledge that Tim has of Cape Town coupled with a warm and engaging manner kept us entertained throughout the tour of the magnificent Cape Town peninsula. Tim tailored the tour to what we wanted and delivered all the way knowing when to stop for photos and when and where to avoid the crowds. John, the girls and I had a blast. Many thanks!!

a decade of TIM and I will book again when I come back to Cape Town. Dear Tim,Thank you again for the wonderful stories, explanations and your "Yes I Can" attitude. Once would nearly think you work for Radisson Blu.Since all these years you underline the thruth....wine and people are getting better with age -:)Patrick & this time Gigi too!

Fantastic Experience with Tim. We spent two wonderful days with Tim touring the Stellenbosch and Franschhoek region the first day and Hermanus area day 2. The great experience started long before we arrived in Cape Town. Tim suggested places to stay, restaurants and what to see on our own in Cape Town. On tour, Tim is extremely knowledgeable about wine, food, wildlife, local politics and tourism. I can't imagine a better guide. Thanks Tim!

Beautiful day in the winelands . We had a great day visiting the Western Cape winelands areas. Tim is well informed and shared his knowledge and kept us entertained along the journey. We visited Jordan's & Rustenberg in Stellenbosch, had a wonderful lunch in Franschoek and then finished the day at Spice Route in Paarl. A lovely day, beautiful scenery, great vineyards & great company from Tim.

Winelands tour was amazing. Seven of us enjoyed an excellent day with Tim. From the moment he picked us up at our hotel, it was clear we were going to have an amazing day. We visited 3 wineries, Jordan's, Rustenberg and Spice Route - we could have included more but we were well looked after at all venues. We also enjoyed a delicious and leisurely lunch at La Petite Ferme. Tim is very knowledgable and kept us entertained throughout the day which made the time in the van as much part of the experience as enjoying the wine.

Two fantastic days with Tim. What a wonderful guide!. We (A group of four/2 couples) engaged Tim for 2 days. The first day he took us on the "Wine land Tour" and the second day on the Cape Peninsula Tour. After finding it very difficult to find a Tour Guide, Tim proved to be a fantastic choice. He is extremely knowledgeable, funny, punctual,engaging and flexible. He was great and we all agreed that he was the best Tour Guide we ever had. Would definitely go back and utilise him again.

Wonderful day with a pleasant, friendly guide. We utilized Tim to take us to Hermanos (whales), drive aong the coast. and visit a penguin ,etc. Tim was great, one of the best guides we had. It was our last day in Capetown, and at the conclusion of the tour he dropped us off at the airport. we enjoyed Tim's company and learned from him. Highly recommend !!

Wonderful day and a half tour of Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula. Tim Freeman was my gracious, knowledgeable, entertaining tour guide for a day and a half in Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula. Tim is that wonderful combination of professional and friendly. Tim has a depth of knowledge about Cape Town and the environs, he is flexible, accommodating, and worked hard to make my trip enjoyable, relaxing, personalized, and interesting. Highlights of the tours: penguins, the beach at Muizenberg, the Cape of Good Hope, the bird who stole my lunch (I was finished) at the delicious Two Oceans restaurant, the South African Jewish Museum and District Six. Thank you Tim for a great time!

A Wonderful Guide. We engaged Tim for just a half day tour of Cape Town. Tim proved to be a terrific choice. Friendly, erudite and very witty, we thoroughly enjoyed our brief but thorough and informative tour. Great guy and a top quality guide.

Touring with Tim. Tim contributed a five star touring day to our perfect 8 days in Cape Town. Tim took my family of 11 on a very personal Cape Peninsula full day tour which was both educational, physical and fun! We range in age from 9 to 75.

Very Knowledgeable Guide. We hired Tim so that we made the most of the days we had in Cape Town and were able to relax and enjoy the days we had with Tim.We did the Cape Point tour and stopped at beaches and the Botsnical Gardens to learn about the Flowers of the area enroute.We also visited the Penguins at Boulder beach and the National Lark as well as a fishing area.Tim made the day very interesting and we learnt a lot about South Africa as this was our first visit.We went to the Cape of Good Hope and claimed to the top to look out over the oceans.We then had lunch at a really nice resturant called the Two Oceons.Tim has a nice vehicle and we felt very safe with him at all times.He was prompt when collecting us from the Hotel and know the History of SA as well as other interesting factsThe second day Tim took us to Cale Town itself and gave us a lot of good information and sights which we would never have known on our own.We then went on to District 6 and he told us about the history of this area very interesting and then we went to the Maly area and had lucch with a local lady in her house which was great with amazing food and company.After lunch we went to Langa Township which was a very moving experience not to be missed when in CT if you want to see the other side of life in South Africa.We felt very safe in the Township and enjoyed interacting with the locals and seeing their way of life.Our guide at the township was great full of interesting information about life in a township which we did not know about.We saw local pottery projects and went to a local beer house and shared beer with the locals, and saw in a ladies house and it was a very interesting afternoon.I would recommend Tim if you want to make the most of you time in Cape Town area and to learn about local life.

Amazing Cape Town Tour!. My friends and I were in Cape Town for a total of 4 days. On two of those days, we booked tours with Tim. One was a wine tasting day in Stellenboch and the other was a Peninsula tour. Both were absolutely fantastic! Tim was able to accommodate everything we were looking for... My two friends were interested in doing some port tasting, so he managed to squeeze a place in for them - even on a Sunday! The wineries he chose were all wonderful.On our second tour, we went to the peninsula and saw penguins at the reserve and seals along the way. We also stopped in multiple bays along the way and ate at a fantastic restaurant for lunch. We made it to the Cape of Good Hope and Tim let us stop at several scenic areas to take photos and point out wildlife. He was extremely knowledgable about the history of South Africa and we learned a great deal from our time with him.I would highly recommend Friends of Dorothy tours to anyone who is in Cape Town. They are absolutely worth the price!!!

Great Experience - Personalized Tours. I have been meaning to write this review for a long time -- Tim was absolutely great! The tour lasted all day and we certainly learned a lot about the history of Cape Town. We also had an amazing meal -- way better than The Flagship if you ever consider going there. :) Thank you, Tim!

Great way to learn about the culture and drink wine. We just finished a tour of Cape Town with Tim Freeman. Originally we asked to do a peninsula tour but we did say - if the weather is going to bad - please just think of something else for us to do.When we met him - he informed us that the weather was miserable and that he recommended that we do the wine tour. Being wine drinkers - we were 100% fine with that suggestion.On our way to do the wine tasting - we learned about the history of Cape Town and little other tid bits of information. The information that he shared, along with his personal stories helped paint a picture of what life is in South Africa and Cape Town.Being someone that loves to learn about the culture and identity of an area - this was perfect.The wineries that he picked were great - along with the lunch location. Now this might not seem like a big deal - but I called him on a Sunday (on Sundays 85% of wineries are closed) at 9:30 am for a 10:30 am start. So yes - he pulled off a Superman like moved and rescued the day.

Best way to enjoy the winelands and Peninsula!. We were a company of five going for two daytrips. The first was the winelands of Stellenbosch and surroundings ("Yellow Brick Road") and the second was Cape Peninsula with False bay, penguins, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point Nature reserve ("The Ruby Slipper").On the Winelands tour we stopped at some really beautiful wineries, but also got to see Stellenbosch, Franschoek and the beautiful surroundings. Our guide Tim helped us pick out wineries, but was also very flexible to the changing wishes of the group. While driving Tim told us a lot of fascinating stories about Cape Town, wine making, different grapes etc. All in all it was a marvellous day, filled with wine, good food and beautiful sights.The next day we went on the Peninsula tour. We went through Simon´s town (where we were introduced to Just Nuisance), via the penguin colony to Cape of Good Hope. Here we had a walk through the Cape point nature reserve and then went for a great seafood lunch at restaurant Two Oceans. We saw a lot of different animals, but were also amazed by the flowers. Unlikely at it seems the group agreed that this day was perhaps even better than the first one! The sights along the coastline are absolutely unforgettable. Whoever books a trip with Tim is in for a real treat. He is incredibly knowledgeable, and has a deep understanding of so many subjects (Cape Town history and politics, wine and winemaking, architecture, birds, plants...) paired with a gift of delivering anecdotes. I learned (and laughed) so much during the two days! Tim is also the perfect host, engaging everyone in the party and making sure all are having a good time.In short: when in Cape Town, day touring with Tim Freeman of Friends of Dorothy is something not to be missed!

Wine tour in Stellenbosch etc. Tim knew all about wine and took us to beautiful places with very good wine in Stelenbosch and Franschok. We also learned lots about South Africa and the scenery we passed. Highly recommended! His van was comfortable.

Tour to Hermanus. What a great day! Tim was prompt (early actually) to pick us up at our hotel. We had scheduled a tour to go to Hermanus for a day to look for Right Whales and also to tour the area. We had a lovely tour through Cape Town, then through the Elgin Orchard area. We stopped just short of Hermanus at the top of a peak to look down at the amazing coast and view from above, but also to try to spot where the whales may be. We then made our way to Hermanus. Such a beautiful quaint little town and the coast line was spectacular! Crashing wave over a rocky coast. There was a cliff trail that you could walk along or sit and watch. We spotted several whales, from a distance, but still was so cool to see!Then we went to lunch on the waterfront with Tim and had great food, sat outside, and even saw several whales breach during lunch!We then drove to Betty's Bay where they have the African penguin colony. This place was great! Less touristy than Simon's Town, Boulder's Beach (so we hear), and we were able to get closer to the penguins, there were 100's!Our drive back was the coastal route/scenic route along Chapman's Peak Drive. The sun was setting and the view was phenomenal! We even saw baboons walking along the wall on the side of the road! Tim is an amazing tour guide! He is fun, easy to get a long with, and very knowledgable about the area and the history of Cape Town, and enjoys telling you about it!I highly recommend booking a private tour with Tim. Thanks Tim!

Cape Town Peninsula Tour. We did the Peninsula Tour with Tim today. He was at our hotel at 9 AM to whisk us down the Cape. We spent a few minutes at the Botanic Garden before heading to the Boulders to see the Penguin Colony, followed by the dramatic ride to the Cape of Good Hope. We all climbed to the top of the Cape peak and followed that with a delicious lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant. We then drove up the Atlantic coast and had a quick wine tasting at a nearby vineyard. We headed back to Cape Town and saw the 12 Apostles rock formation.We passed through Clifton & Camps Bay before we headed back into the city. Tim is a fun, interesting guy who shares his cultural, historical and geographic knowledge of South Africa & Cape Town throughout the tour. I highly recommend using Tim on your next visit to Cape Town. You will not be disappointed!

Two Full, Fantastic Days of Wine Tours. This review is a bit overdue, but after a few weeks I am still thinking about my two days on the wine trails, how much I learned about he area, and how much fun we had. The first day, Tim collected me and two friends from the Hotel in Cape Town. Driving out to the wine country, he pointed out important landmarks, interesting historical attractions, and fun facts about the area you're sure not likely to get on other tours. We started day one in Franschoek as Tim fulfilled our request to focus on some of South Africa's best sparkling wines. We toured three wineries, had a fantastic lunch at Delaire Graff, and purchased more wine than we knew what to do with. For anyone looking for a gay friendly tour operator, Friend's of Dorothy is it (as one might assume). Day two of the wine excursions included myself and 4 gay friends from London that I'd recently met at a wedding. While always professional, Tim made this day even more fun. The humor and jokes flowed as freely as the wine and rain that day. We toured several spectacular estates, purchased even more wine, had a Delicious lunch and one of South Africa's best, Overture. I was looking for a gay friendly wine tour, and was connected to Tim through Out in Africa tours. I'm so glad to have made the connection.

Fantastic time in Cape Town, thank you Tim. We had one day in Cape Town stopover while on QM2, I had organised with Tim to take us to Table Mountain, Stellenbosch Botanical Gardens and a winery. Our cruise ship was late arriving due to high winds but Tim was waiting for us in his nice, clean people mover. He had advised us to buy tickets for the cable car for table mountains online before we arrived. This saved us a lot of time as the queues to buy tickets let alone getting on the cable car was very long. We got there long before 4 bus loads from our ship had arrived and had 45 minute wait to get to the top. Tim pointed out quite a lot of interesting information. We then went to botanical gardens where we tried different South African foods in the cafe and then Tim took us for a walking tour of the gardens and once again was very knowledgeable and pointed out many interesting plants. He also managed to take us to a very nice winery called Klein Constantia for wine tasting. We had a great time and saw so much in a day.We definitely recommend booking Tim.

Four Day Tour of Cape Town. My wife and I had a terrific time in Cape Town and the surrounding area with Tim Freeman of Friends of Dorothy Day Tours as our guide. We are in our 70s and are still fairly agile, but without Tim's guidance and help we would not have accomplished half of what we did with him. After hearing the things we wanted to do and see, he managed everything. He did the driving, arranged reservations, chose places for lunch, etc. He made excellent additional suggestions.We toured Cape Town itself both walking and driving where we saw District 6, the Castle, the Company's Gardens, Signal Hill and more. Since our four days with Tim were on alternate days spread out over a week, Tim showed us many places we could return to on our own (including Table Mountain, the Slave Lodge, the Anglican Cathedral, and others). Outside the city, we went to the superb Hartenberg winery estate, the beautiful Kirstenboch Gardens, and the fruit and vegetable gardens in Babylonstoren. Along the way we stopped at places to sample artisan chocolates, craft beer, and olives. We went to Simon's Town and Betty's Bay to see the penguins and stood on the Cape of Good Hope. The drives to and from these places were beautiful. The mountains and beaches are fantastic sights.Tim also arranged for a tour of Langa Township with a guide from the community itself. It was a sobering and enlightening experience. I helped us contextualize our trip in the context of South African history, culture, and current affairs. We were a bit apprehensive but there was no need to have been. The people of Langa Township welcomed us. We recommend this visit stronglyNever did we feel rushed. Although we went many places in a few days, we had ample time at each of our destinations. With Tim doing the driving, it eliminated all of the extra time required to schedule a tour on one's own and to figure out how to get to places!It was more than worth the money. We visited Amsterdam on our own before flying to Cape Town. We did quite well there but Cape Town with a tour guide--especially Tim--was much more successful.Tim possesses a broad and deep knowledge of Cape Town and South Africa which he eagerly shares with his clients. He is very articulate and speaks clearly. We had no problem hearing him in the back seat of his comfortable SUV. He also thrives on his clients' suggestions, questions, and opinions. At times he had to remind us that we should be looking out the window!Tim is an affable, cheerful traveling companion. We felt that we had made a friend. Our advice is to seize the opportunity to engage Tim as a tour guide. You won't regret it for a minute. Our visit to Cape Town and environs was the trip of a life time and Tim Freeman was instrumental in making it so!

Tim is fantastic!. I have been to Cape Town a few times, but I learned more on this trip than any before--all thanks to Tim! His knowledge is beyond any tour guide I have ever met and he is a true pleasure to be around. We did the Cape Peninsula tour and went to the Winelands, and even asked Tim to take us to Kirstenbosch on our last day there because we enjoyed having him as our guide so much. One of the highlights of being with Tim was the first day when he picked us up--he had seen whales not far from our hotel, and he was so excited to show them to us! His enthusiasm was contagious and was a great introduction to our time in Cape Town!Tim is an amazing guide and we would highly recommend him to anyone who wants to see Cape Town and learn a lot along the way!

Great tour of Cape Town. We took a walking tour of Cape Town with Tim and it was a really great way to learn about the city. Highly Informative: Tale Of Two Cities Tour. We are a family of five on an 11-month Round-The-World trip, road-schooling our teens along the way. In Cape Town, one major educational goal was to learn about the different populations of South Africa. Tim delivered in spades. We started our day with an overview of the European history, focused on Central Cape Town. Highlights for us were the Company Gardens, the flower market, District Six, and Groote Kirk. We then headed up to Signal Hill for the noon gun. It was an exciting ride up the hillside and we got there just in time.Next was the Cape Malay district where we admired the cheerfully painted homes, saw the prettiest mosque in Cape Town, and visited a spice shop. We had a curried-chicken lunch in a cook's home, and learned to make samosas. The food was delicious, and the conversation very informative. This was the first time my husband had been in a Muslim home, so he was very interested in the art work and the family's day-to-day life. Finally, we ended our day at Langa Township. This was simply amazing. We learned so much about the township system, how/when/why people moved to Cape Town after the fall of apartheid, and the community itself. We were happy to see people's pride in their community and the projects in place to help people learn a trade or craft. To be honest, it was a little uncomfortable to be visiting a community in such an intimate way, peering in to their homes and picking our way through the narrow paths. Visiting Langa, however, was vital to our understanding of South Africa, Cape Town, and Apartheid. (After all, traveling is all about experiencing new and different things, and if you're really trying to do that, you're going to be a little uncomfortable once in a while.) Note, however, that we were warmly welcomed by the Langa guide, the Langa children, and the people we met along the way.Tim's knowledge about the city was vast. He was able to answer all of our questions in great detail. His fellow "teachers", our cook in the Cape Malay district, and our local Langa guide, were friendly and welcomed our questions. They all had clear pride in their cultures, businesses, and communities. One downside of the tour for us was that the morning and lunch portion of the tour was very quickly-paced. We felt as if we were rushing through several elements. If I were to do this again, I'd want to take it more leisurely and break it in to two days.

Wealth of Knowledge. We spent 2 days with Tim doing the Cape Peninsular and Cape Winelands tours. Informative, professional and a great day out. You will be hard pressed to beat a day out with Tim. He knows the area very well. Has plenty of stories to tell and goes out of his way to meet your needs. I had a friend over from the UK who did a couple of tours with him - one to the winelands and the other around the peninsula. Both were professionally run - with a clean comfortable vehicle. Tim arrives on time and keeps the day running smoothly without you feeling pressed. You will come away having had fun, seen a lot and increased your knowledge of Cape Town and its delights. Don't miss out.

Great day out with Tim. Just spent an amazing day with Tim, on an all day tour of the highlights of the Cape. We visited a great winery for a tasting and then Tim took us all around the peninsular. Tim is great fun to be with, and really knowledgable about the Cape. We also had a fantastic lunch at Two Oceans Restaurant. Thanks Tim for a great day.

Great day of touring. We made arrangements via email with Tim Freeman for a peninsula tour. It was fantastic. We started with some quick highlights of Cape Town. Tim's knowledge showed through in an easy conversational style. He pulled over several times to allow us to take photos and he was quick to granted camera so both my wife and I could be in the shot. His knowledge of plant and animal life on the cape added immeasurably to the experience. It was well worth doing the private tour and so much more enjoyable than being part of a bigger group. Thanks Tim for a great day!

Outstanding customized tours to suit your individual interests and schedule. We couldn't be more pleased with the all-day tour of the Cape winelands that Tim Freeman helped to coordinate. We wrote to Tim in advance of our trip to South Africa and shared with him a list of wineries we were interested in visiting around Stellenbosch, Paarl and Somerset West. Tim was very helpful in asking us what our personal interests were (serious wine tasting, sight-seeing, architecture, etc.). He made some suggestions for wineries he thought we might enjoy and politely suggested that some of the wineries we thought of visiting were either very remote or might be limited in their wine selections. Tim picked us up from our hotel in his roomy and comfortable van, showed us the cooler he had packed with water and refreshments to enjoy during our tour, and confirmed our time schedule. We were very impressed with how knowledgeable and witty Tim is. He not only made personal introductions to the staff at each of the five wineries (and our lunch-time restaurant as well), he made sure that all tasting and entrance fees were taken care of so that we didn't need to worry about extra expenses. He pointed out interesting plants, birds and animals along our journey, picking up on the fact that we had just come from a safari in Botswana and Zambia. Tim is very personable, professional and well-prepared. We were thrilled that we were able to visit five wineries on a gentle and comfortable pace without having to worry about directions or details. We enjoyed Cape Town so much we are sure we will be returning to South Africa again soon. We will be sure to book another tour with Tim and Friends of Dorothy Tours! Enjoy!

Great day with Tim!. Had a great one day highlights of the Cape tour with Tim. I can't say enough. Arrangements were easy. Tim was flexible and knowldedgable. He really tried to tailor the tour to meet our interests. Most impressive was his knowledge of the geography, geology, politics and history. I don't think I asked a question that he couldn't answer, , , and I ask a lot. Can't say enough good things!

Ticked all the boxes - great day out. On a one day Cape Peninsular tour, I saw whales frolicking close inshore, had a very close encounter with a fur seal, enjoyed the penguins, walked from the Cape of Good Hope to Cape Point and was treated to amazing sea and land views. Added to the excellent lunch overlooking the sea near Cape Point it was exactly what I had wanted from the tour. When you can see big coaches disgorging 70 or 80 people who just want a photo at the Cape signpost, it's clear how worthwhile a good guide is. Tim threw in a Cape Town tour on the way out of town, stopped frequently and flexibly and has a great deal of humorously delivered knowledge to share.

Tour with Tim. Tim was an excellent tour guide. He has a brilliant memory and can educate you on more than most people can retain. He showed us all the must see sights and steered us through a beautiful tour around the peninsula and wine tours. If you are interested in seeing wineries, hire Tim. He is more knowledgable than the winery employees so he can add a lot of additional info and great suggestions. He was very courteous and has a great personality for keeping people entertained. Highly recommend him.

Cape Town with Tim. My family hired Tim for two days of touring around Cape Town. He was experienced and knowledgeable. He took us to the wine country and to the Cape of Good Hope. We had an amazing experience with fantastic food, great conversation, and spectacular views of the coast. Tim was the epitome of a what we wanted in a tour guide - he brought us to places that were unique and interesting while having the education and knowledge to explain the history and background of the areas we visited. He also provided suggestions of places to visit in our free time based on our interests - he helped us buy tickets for a rugby game, suggested trails for hiking up Table Mountain, and found an amazing store/museum for us to look at Tanzanite jewelry. I would highly recommend hiring Tim as a tour guide.

Highly recommend. We had a fabulous day touring the Cape Town peninsula with Tim. We booked via email and from the first contact to saying good bye we had an excellent service. Tim has a natural friendly style and is very well informed about the area. His clean and comfortable vehicle (VW T5 minibus) had supplies such as water and snacks - plus some umbrellas (which were needed for this Cape Town winter weather). We were picked up from our hotel as planned at 9am and we followed his route around the cape which took advantage of the (little) sun and meant we avoided most buses/coaches. There were four of us and we feel this tour was good value for money. It is worth investing more in a personal tour and having a guide meant we learnt a lot more about the area and its history. We had a really good day and we are sure you will too! Many thanks to Tim.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We have just returned from a very wet and windy Cape Town. However all was not lost as we had booked a Peninsula Tour with Tim at Friends of Dorothy and we were in for a real treat. The weather was not perfect at all times throughout our day but Tim made the day a wonderful experience. He was knowledgeable on all aspects of our drive, from the flora and fauna to the history and the more up to date events in the area. We learnt a great deal and enjoyed this day out immensely, I would recommend his company and the drive. Thanks Tim.

Lovely Day. We recently visited Cape Town to see our daughter who is studying at University of Cape Town. I contacted Tim prior to arriving and described what we were interested in doing - a tour of the wine country, preferably including some wineries that were a little more off the beaten path. Tim picked us up at our hotel around 9:00 am and we headed towards the Stellenbosch area. We toured three wineries over the course of the day including a lovely one with a Japanese style tea garden. Tim was knowledgeable and entertaining; frequently quoting poetry to illustrate a point. Over the course of the day, we chatted about wine, history, the areas we were visiting and a wide range of subjects. He made changes to our itinerary as we went based on comments we made. For example, after I talked about how much I loved to cook, he added in a stop at an olive farm where we sampled different olive oils made on site. Tim sent me a list of restaurant recommendations and I had selected three that I thought we would enjoy. We had a wonderful lunch at La Petite Ferme which was one of the three on my list. All in all the day fit perfectly with what I had envisioned and I would highly recommend Tim for anyone interested in doing a tour.

Great guide with an endless amount of knowledge!. My partner and I strongly recommend the tour with Friends of Dorothy. We chose the Cape Town city tour but were left feeling that if we had more time that we should have signed up for more tours, since the level of knowledge that was provided was so strong. There is no way we could have gotten as much out of Cape Town if we did not take this tour. We got to see so much more of the city, learned so much about the history, as well as the food and culture. He was very organized, communicated well prior to the tour to make sure we were well taken care of relative to what we wanted to see, and also answered all of our questions (and we had a lot of them). I'm sure the other tours are great too, but I would definitely recommend that you put on your walking shoes and pick the friends of Dorothy city tour to lean about Cape Town!

Cape peninsula tour. Excellent. It was nice to have an English man as our guide. As an ex-lawyer Tim had very good socio-pplitocal knowledge. He was very courteous and made sure that children were comfortable thru out. A bit expensive but worth it's money....

Tour with Tim Freeman. My colleague and I spend three days with Tim Freeman last week touring Cape Town. Tim was terrific in gathering information about our interests and then delivering a wonderful itinerary. We toured the city, visited Table Mountain, Cape Point, and Steelenbosch. He was informative and a pleasure to spend time with and would recommded him without reservation. Tim Cohan

Tim's Ruby Slipper Tour was fantastic. Had the opportunity to take this tour, and it was fabulous, Tim was friendly, knowledgeable and fun. The tour covered everything we wanted to see with stops in all the places we wanted to stop, he routed the tour to avoid the big bus tours, and filled us in on historical aspects related to what we were seeing. We had a wonderful day, and will definitely contact Tim for another tour on our next visit to Cape Town. Thank you Tim !!

beautiful day with Tim. An absolutely wonderful day with Tim.He was extremely knowledgeable and informative and very entertaining.His puns left me speechless. I would recommend this Cape Peninsula tour to anyonewho wants a hassle free day to explore what the Cape has to offer.When I return I will definitely book Tim for a different tour of the areaJohn ( from Canada)

The best and friendliest in Town. Al our trips to Cape Town we did trips with Tim. Hè is so knowledgeable of the aria and the wines. Great Cape of Good Hope Tour. beautiful cape town and environs. regular tripper with friends of dorothy tours on our annual visit to cape townalways tim finds us something new to see and experienceinformative knowledgable and witty tim is the perfect guidestunning locations wineries in idyllic countryside always somewhere different to lunch

Tim's Tour was a Tonic. Lovely Rainy Day. Friends of Dorothy knew just what we wanted! Tim is a great guy who knows this region well and tailors your trip to fit your desires. City and Cape of Good Hope Tours. Owner Tim, collected us as arranged and managed our 2 full day tours of Cape Town and local attractions. We will certainly recommend Tim and will use him again when next in the area.

A tailored tour. We contacted Friends of Dorothy Day Tours to arrange a wine land tour. We specifically wanted to visited wine farms that also were known for their gardens. We were not disappointed. scenic cape town. wonderful trip into the countryside around cape townwe have done several tours with friends of dorothy tours over the years of visiting cape town and always enjoy the daystunning scenery prime locations interesting wine farms superb restaurantsvisited the awesome waterskloof estate on last occasion with its views towards the cape peninsulaa laidback hour tasting the wines in the grounds of jordans wine estatethe modern architecture and interesting wines of dornier estatememorable timesinformative and witty commentary from tim the friendly ownercan't wait to return and see other places of interest

Brilliantly Entertaining Day. Three of us decided to take a day tour of the Winelands and having been so impressed with Tim from 'Friends of Dorothy Tours' on a previous visit to Cape Town we booked again. It was a fantastic day! Tim really goes the extra mile to personalise the experience so that you feel this is not just another tourist day tour. Later Tim could see we were looking for something different and suggested chocolate tasting - another great idea.More than anything the tour is memorable for the informed and entertaining style Tim maintains for the whole day and for the comfort of the spacious tour van. Best Photo Coach!. This was our first time in Cape Town and we didn't really know where to go or what to do. We booked an EARLY morning tour with Peter so that we could be on the beach when the sun came up and see the penguins before the big tour crowds came. My husband had agreed to this (along with our two kids), but wasn't enthusiastic as he isn't much into photography. That's just the thing, though. Most importantly, while he made suggestions on angles or settings, he was never cross or pushy. He let me make mistakes and then made suggestions. This is how it should be done.

Amazing Photo Tour. Had a one-to-one coaching session with Peter as a birthday present from my wife. Peter was very responsive in the lead up to the session as we planned out a day. I gave him a very varied shopping list of things I wanted to work on which covered composition, tips for safari, landscape, portrait and macro photography, etc. To my amazement, he managed to put together a full day (>12 hours) which covered all of them, and more! It was, by far, the best photography coaching session I have ever had - thank you so much.Peter has a very friendly, but professional attitude. He explained concepts very clearly, gave plenty of practical advice but also maximised our time taking photos. I couldn't have asked for more.

Super Tour / Super Instruction. My wife and I did two tours with Peter, the full day (and by full day, I mean 12+ hours) Cape Peninsula tour, and a half-day customized city tour. Peter is at once a knowledgeable guide, a skilled photographer, and an enthusiastic teacher. My wife was not a photographer when we came to South Africa, but by the time Peter was finished, well, looks like I'll be buying another camera kit. :)

Great tour. Our tour guide was Cliff and he was fantastic. It was great to have a personalized tour of one of the most beautiful place in the world. Cliff was very knowledgable and had a good understanding of the area and provided us with a very unique experience. I would definitely suggest Cape Photographic Company to anyone who is interested in photography plus touring.

Wonderful Teacher and Guide. When I saw this company on TripAdvisor, I was excited. I love to travel and I love to take pictures. Unfortunately, I don't know much about shooting on manual. I took a few classes, but I forgot most of the concepts. Peter was patient with me and reviewed the important photography concepts with me. Afterwards, we went to the wine lands and checked out a shipwreck in the afternoon. Overall, it was a wonderful day since I got to travel and take better pictures! Thank you, Peter for the wonderful sites and photography instructions.

A Fantastic Day!. I was traveling in Cape Town and booked a photography day with Peter. I really didn't know what to expect, but in the end my only regret was that I didn't have enough time to book another day! From the moment Peter picked me up he was busy assessing my skills level so he could truly help me as much as possible with what my goals were for the day. He was very friendly, laid back, and definitely had a great sense of humor. Our pace for the day seemed easy going and yet we covered a tremendous amount of ground! Peter gave me great direction on some camera settings and composition. We got some great sunrise shots, covered the penguins, and the best was shooting the children of the Langa Township. This was such a special experience and I can truly say that I shot some of the best portraits ever! The children are beautiful and Peter has an amazing relationship with the people of the township. It is very apparent that he has worked hard to build a trust with them and due to that trust he can bring people there to experience something that would otherwise be impossible. I loved the children! The were simply wonderful and so photogenic! I cannot say enough about the great day I had! The penguins were also very cool! I would recommend this experience to anyone...even beginners as Peter is so patient and informative about shooting. He was truly awesome and I will definitely be booking again when I get back to Cape Town for another visit. Thanks Peter! You are the best!!! Nora :)

Wonderful Experience!. Peter's infectious enthusiasm did not wane for the entire day, from pre-dawn till well after sunset! The whole family was immediately comfortable with him, and enjoyed every minute of the day. Peter is an excellent teacher. It was evident that he did his homework on each of our cameras, and was able to teach each of us at our own level. He mixed a lot of history and information about Cape Town into the day as well. Each member of the family ended the day with a sense of pride at having improved our photography skills and learned a lot about his beautiful home, Cape Town. I highly recommend an excursion with Peter to anyone at any level of photography skill.

Highly Personalized Experience. We had such an amazing experience with Peter! What made it so great is that he was able to help each of the four of us according to our levels of experience with photography. Moreover, he was able to help us plan ahead to the kinds of shots we were going to take while on safari once we moved on from Cape Town. His love for photography was infectious, and his great sense of humor made the day fly by! I cannot recommend him highly enough!!!

Another fantastic photo-weekend with Peter. Last month I did my third photography weekend with Peter at The Hex river valley.The other two that I have done are the Sutherland star trails and the paternoster weekend away.All three were of a similar standard –absolutely fabulous!The photography part: Peter spends a lot of time finding good photo shoots around the area .The briefing beforehand is also very useful ,as well as the discussion of the photos afterwards. He also provides notes ,so that you remember what setting and approach was used to take those special shots .On site, he spends time with every person to show different perspectives to capture the shot as well as useful advice.The Hex river valley focused on colourful landscapes,the Sutherland one on star trails and the paternoster weekend on seascapes.accommodations and food etc.: All of the accommodations(bed and breakfasts) were very comfortable and clean. They were central so that not much travelling needed to be done before a shoot. The food was great (and I was catered very well despite being the only vegetarian).The hosts were extremely friendly and warm.I would highly recommend the photo tours with Peter as he goes the extra mile to make you get the best shot, as well as making your feel comfortable and at home.Besides getting great photos ,you also end up with a fun weekend away:-)

Star trails at Sutherland. This weekend we braved the (very) cold and sat outside the SALT telescope to take star trails. Peter as always is a hoot and keeps us entertained. But also so helpful. This being a new type of photography for me he has the patience of a saint. The weekend is jam packed but there is so much joy involved. I would recommend any of his tours. Well done!

Autumn Splendour in the Hex River Valley. Thank you Peter for a fantastic weekend in the Hex River Valley. We all learnt so much about shooting stunning landscapes and about bringing out the beautiful colours in the vineyards and the skies with different filters. You really went out of your way to get us to the best locations for stunning shots. We also had so much fun with frozen pics and capturing the magic of the "Hex van die Hex Rivier".I will definitely be attending many more of your courses.

Hex River Photograpy Magic. We spent a weekend in the Hex River Valley ( near De Doorns) with Peter learning how to photograph the Autumn colours in the Vineyards and surrounding mountains. Peter is an outstanding Photo Coach - very knowledgeable but also fun and entertaining. He knows all about the local areas as he is also a qualified Tour Guide. We learnt a lot about Photography, Light, Composition and the history of the Hex River Valley! I can't recommend this weekend highly enough.
Hex river valley workshop . Fabulous weekend workshop with Peter, best photographic coach around. Beautiful scenery, lots of fun and plenty to learn.

"Exciting Cape adventure with the best!". Sailing into Cape Town recently, totally blew my mind! Breathtaking beauty at its best. Excitement mounted as I dusted off the cabin fevered camera and equipment to embark on the most incredible photographic full days tour with renowned photographic mentor and tour guide, Peter Haarhoff who not only entertains you his great sense of humor, but his knowledge of the area, it's history and culture and photography talents are unparalleled. I was instantly at ease with trying out a new camera with his informative 'what/how to do' approach and soon felt enthused, encouraged and confident again. Together with my good yachtie friend, we started with Peter driving us on a 2hr game drive (have good shoes for walking close to animals), followed by wine tasting (buy the wine and champagne here...it's fantastic), a delicious lunch at a nearby bistro (you'll find this to be an experience too with an eclectic mix of people, cockerels running under your feet, beautiful surrounds, together with excellent food, price and friendly local service), a butterfly tour which incorporates birds, reptiles and more (can be hot inside), then ended the day at the Lion park sanctuary watching them feed, as the sun dipped behind the majestic Cape mountains - what an experience! Cant wait to do the next tour with Peter, so I guess sailing will just have to wait!

Wildlife in the Winelands Tour. This was a most amazing way to spend a day touring the Cape and learning more about using my camera and taking photos in different genres - Landscapes, Wildlife and Macro. Add to this a really enjoyable wine tasting and a delicious lunch at a local Bistro and its the perfect recipe for a great time. Peter is such a fun, easy going, informative tour guide who is willing to share his vast photographic knowledge, we came back with great photo's and memories of a wonderful day.

West Coast Photo tour. Our group of photographers have spent many hours in the company of Peter Haarhoff on various photo tours and day outings. This last one was a four day trip to Britannia Bay and the Lambert's Bay area on the Cape West Coast. Peter's organisation, his knowledge of the area and his photographic insights coupled with a great sense of humour and fun made this another memorable trip. We always learn something new with Peter!

4-days of magnificent West Coast photographic Adventure. We are a group of eight enthusiastic photographers and asked Peter Haarhof to be our leader/teacher during this time, as the West Coast is one of his familiar stomping grounds. Aside from the 'photography Gods' being extremely generous, we were in the company of a most knowledgeable, inspiring and delightful person - with a wicked sense of humour to top it all. All round a wonderful and highly recommendable experience!

Best way to start our trip to Cape Town. My husband and I spent our first day of our trip to Cape Town with Peter and I am so glad we did. Peter strikes a perfect balance between first and foremost teaching you the fundamentals of good photography while secondarily familiarizing you with the area and teaching you about the culture and history. Peter is hands down the best ambassador for his city-- we absolutely loved spending the day with him. He's friendly and funny and a complete delight. I have dabbled with photography on and off for years but never really taken a lesson on the fundamentals and my husband had never used a camera that wasn't on his iPhone. Moreover, we had two different cameras (and two different brands with totally different formats). Peter flawlessly taught to both our skill levels and transitioned seamlessly between both cameras, both of which he was very familiar with. Peter formatted a custom day-long tour for us, so we were able to combine multiple areas of the peninsula that we wanted to see. Moreover, we were finishing our trip with a safari in the Kruger and Peter set up a tour of an animal sanctuary to make sure we learned the basics of photographing animals so that we'd get first class photos on that part of our trip. More photos to come as I get them all uploaded but attached are a few that we captured with Peter during our tour. I cannot recommend Peter enough. If you are visiting Cape Town a tour with him is a great addition to your trip (and do it early! you'll regret any of your photos taken before you do it!).

'Lekker' Tour ;-). My wife and I have just visited Cape Town to celebrate her 40th birthday with family living here. I wanted to give her a special birthday present that she would not forget. As her treat to herself, she bought a new Nikon DSLR camera. She a novice to this type of camera, and did not find the instruction manual very easy to understand. Despite the purchase of several magazines and books, she could still not get to grips with her new toy and was getting really frustrated with not being able to use the full potential of her camera. I chanced upon Peter's company on TripAdvisor. He had outstanding reviews and I decided to contact him several months ahead of our trip. Peter was extremely prompt with his reply and I went on to explain the situation. He was very helpful and offered very good advice. I then went ahead and booked a day tour which started with my wife and I being picked up before sunrise. We then headed out to catch the sunrise and the 'Golden Light'. Peter got my wife to work straight away and got her snapping pictures on the way there. He then went on to get her to use several different settings on her camera. She was almost instantly taking breath taking photos. He also went on to explain the theory and guidelines to photograph. After taking many photos around the location, we all had a well earned break at a local cafe. The food and staff were fantastic, and once we were all refuelled, Peter started to explain the various settings of the camera and how to use them. He also provided simple and easy to understand notes. We then headed out again, and by the end of the morning, my wife was shooting on manual! We then headed home to pick up our kids (7 & 10). The second part of the tour was supposed to be a visit to a township were we would have a traditional lunch, followed by a further lesson on portraits in the township. It was unseasonably hot that afternoon (30+) and by the time we arrived, we were all boiling. Nevertheless we had lunch a the local place selected by Peter. He knew the staff, and had a wonderful knowledge of what to order. We were not disappointed when the food arrived. It wonderfully cooked and very tasty. Due to the heat we decided to cut our afternoon short. Peter was very understanding of this and took us straight home. Despite having to cut our afternoon short, we had the most amazing time. My wife is now far more comfortable with her camera and has carried on taking amazing photos. Peter's notes are a wonderful aide-memoir and a reminder of a fantastic experience. I would not hesitate to recommend Peter to anyone, from novice to experienced photographer. He has a wealth of knowledge that ranges from photographic techniques to a love of his region. He knows where to go, who to speak to, and is very flexible. I am only sad that we did not have more time to spend with Peter. I would have loved to experience many of his other tours. I can only finish by saying that we will definitely be booking Peter again on our next visit, hopefully in the very near future.
AMAZING PHOTO TOUR. Peter is an incredible tour guide & photographer, I would highly recommend him to anyone. This is the best way to improve your photographic skills. Top service!

Two thumbs up.... This is our first time visiting South Africa. My wife and I took a photography tour with Peter. I would highly recommend him to anyone without any hesitation.Henry and Sandra, Vancouver, Canada

Top,service.... We took a Cape Tour with Peter. The thing that made the day was Peter's enthusiasm for his local area and that he wanted us to have a good time. This is organised tourism at its best. Highly recommended for a care free way to see the area beyond the city centre.

best way to improve your photographic abilities in a wonderful atmosphere. our guide peter haarhoff took us first to Batavia cafe. an authentic boo kap experience.in a very short and unbelievable simple way he explained the main factors of good use of your camera. we tried with some courses and reading books before. but as good and effective as peter explains is incredible.after we began using our new knowledges by taking pictures of the malay quarter.from the first moment by the explanations given by peter you take better pictures.we will take another day with peter for sure. it is awesome!!the combination with a cooking course was the best time to spent the midday light break.

Perfect Introduction to Portraiture. My mom and I went on the portraiture tour of Langa as part of a weekend in Cape Town for her 60th. It was organised very last minute, but Peter was so accommodating and friendly. I was very nervous of portraiture, but Peter and his "models" made it so much fun and so easy to learn. Peter was not only teaching us about photography, but also the area and people we met. Thank you Peter! We'll definitely be in touch next time we're in Cape Town!

Amazing experience. My wife and I went on a half day sunrise photography tour with Peter. Right from the start, literally before we drove away from our hotel that he picked us up at, he was showing me tricks to do in the car to capture passing street lights with long exposures. We then watched the sunrise and Peter helped me work on technical settings with the camera and shot composition. He took some nice photos of my wife and I in front of the colorful beach huts and provided more assistance to me as well. After, we had a nice breakfast and he reviewed some more instructional material with me before heading out to Kalk Bay to shoot the harbor and work on shot composition. He offered my wife to go shopping along the beachfront stores if she wanted, and she was very excited to leave me to the camera for a while, so she could also explore the quaint but funky area. Photography course. Peter was a great tutor and I would without hesitation recommend him and the course to anyone. I enjoyed the course enormously. The setting around Kalk Bay was really inspired. You will love your time with Peter in this beautiful City. We had the absolute experience of a lifetime alongside Peter who is a hugely passionate and incredibly skilled photographic tour guide. I went with my parents, wife, son (6) and daughter (3) and we went into the township of Lyanga. At all times we felt at ease, safe and secure in our guides clear knowledge and love for his country. Even if you aren't into photography, a tour with Peter is an experience I would highly recommend - simply fantastic.

The Most Amazing Photographic Experience. Wow! I was lucky enough to enjoy yesterday a very long day with Peter which was effectively two private one on one half day tours - the Cape Town City and the Township - rolled into one . I had high expectations because of other reviews on here but even they were exceeded. This was quite simply an amazing experience, the most memorable of my 10 day holiday to Cape Town and without doubt the most remarkable photographic adventure of my life. Peter's email communication in advance of the day was prompt and comprehensive so from the outset he had a fair idea of my level of skill and experience and the equipment I would be bringing with me. He bent over backwards to be flexible and meet my specific interests and development needs.The day itself was essentially like a long private tuition class from a friend in remarkable surroundings. Not a moment was wasted. As soon as he collected me from my hotel at an unearthly hour to catch the sunrise (the early start is optional!) we were working on light trails from inside the car as we drove to the beach for our first shoot. The City photo tour in the morning was excellent. Standing on a deserted beach as the sun rose photographing across the sea to Table Mountain (the classic shot used by Trip Advisor as its Cape Town signature photo) practising slow shutter speed work was an experience in itself. Later we photographed fantastic street art in a grungy and atmospheric part of town and the picture postcard perfect colours of the Bo Kaap district. Tuition didn't stop even over breakfast in a cafe as Peter talked me through camera settings I wasn't familiar with and answered my technical queries.This was good, very good. But the afternoon visit to a Township was even better. After lunch in a township restaurant, which was an experience in itself, Peter took me into a neighbouring community where we spent several hours shooting portraits of locals both in their homes and around the streets of the township. We visited the dark and mysterious hut of a traditional spirit doctor, a local drinking place, were given access to people's desperately sad and poverty stricken shacks to photograph them in their own homes, took portraits of children playing in the streets, visited an outdoor butchery (I'm squeamish and was initially dubious about this aspect but it turned out to be another tremendous experience) and finished the day spinning around a roundabout in a childrens play area practising panning shots with dozens of local children for company!The only reason that all of this was possible in the township was because Peter has clearly put a lot of effort into cultivating good relations with the local community. He made it so easy for me, delivering a constant stream of willing subjects which allowed even somebody like me to take some utterly memorable and compelling pictures which I will be proud of for the rest of my days. All I had to do was follow him and take photos. He did the rest. Many of the locals were astonishingly willing - even keen - to pose for us and the results are stunning. At no stage was there any hint of personal risk. It was a privilege to be granted such access to places that few foreign tourists visit and incredibly humbling to see people's stoicism and friendliness in the face of such poverty. No visit to Cape Town is complete without stepping outside the tourist bubble and seeing a Township because of the broader perspective and understanding of the city it gives you.The day wasn't cheap even allowing for the currently very favourable exchange rates but I don't begrudge a penny of it (if you do the township tour you get a very appropriate, but optional, opportunity to make a donation to the local creche as a gesture of thanks to the community). Intensive tuition, good company, snippets of local history, access to amazing locations and people and memorable photographs. Perfect.

One of the Highlights of our Cape Town Experience. My husband and I recently spent a half day with Peter learning to take photos and touring unexpected places.
