Kapstadt – dank Manfred viel gesehen. Kapstadt und die umliegenden Orte der Provinz Western Cape sind sehr europäisch geprägt. Dazu haben sicherlich die niederländischen, deutschen, französischen und britischen Einwanderer beigetragen, die sich ab Mitte des 17. Jahrhunderts in Südafrika ansiedelten.Premierministerin der Provinz Westkap ist Helen Zille, eine Großnichte des Berliner Millieu-Malers Heinrich Zille. Über 30.000 Deutsche wohnen dauerhaft in Kapstadt, wird geschätzt, denn eine Meldepflicht für Einwohner gibt es in Südafrika nicht. Weitere 100.000 sollen hier ihren Zweitwohnsitz haben. So verwundert es nicht, dass man an vielen Ecken auf deutsche Geschäfte trifft. Manfred, unser Guide, zeigte uns die schönsten Ecken von Kapstadt. Dank seiner Ortskenntnis haben wir sehr schöne Eindrücke mitgenommen.Bereits in Kapstadts Victoria & Alfred Waterfront begegnen wir der Royal Bavarian Bakery, die Brot und Brezeln nach bayerischem Standard anbietet. Auf dem Weg zur Tafelberg-Seilbahn befindet sich im Stadtteil Tamboerskloof auf der Kloofnek Road die Bäckerei „Dinkel“ mit einem netten kleinen Café. Das labberige südafrikanische Weißbrot ist halt nicht jedermanns Geschmack und hier gibt es knusprige Backwaren deutscher Tradition. Passend zu den Backwaren gibt es in der deutschen Fleischerei Raith Gourmet im Garden Centre in der Mill Street bayrische Weißwurst, Fleischwurst und Schnitzel. In Somerset West, einem etwas außerhalb Kapstadts gelegenen Ort, in dem ebenfalls zahlreiche Deutsche leben, befindet sich der German Supermarket Woermann & Brock. Die Wurzeln dieses deutschen Supermarkts reichen zurück bis zu den Hamburger Reedern Adolph und Eduard Woermann (Woermann-Linie, Deutsche Ost-Afrika Linie). Wir haben etwa eineinhalb Stunden gewartet, bis sich auch für uns die Türen der hier scherzhaft „Fondue-Topf“ genannten Gondel für die Seilbahnfahrt auf den majestätischen Tafelberg öffneten. Oben angekommen, erschließt sich uns ein phantastischer Rundblick auf Kapstadt mit seiner Waterfront, den Lion’s Head, den Signal Hill und die Berge der Zwölf Apostel.Die viktorianischen Häuser in der über 300 Jahre alten Long Street holen mit ihren schmiedeeisernen Balkongeländern noch heute das Flair vergangener Tage in unsere Zeit herüber. Das an dieser berühmten Straße gelegene „Grand Daddy“-Hotel hat eine besondere Attraktion für Übernachtungen zu bieten. Wer mit dem historischen Aufzug in die oberste Etage fährt, findet sich inmitten eines silbrig glänzenden Wohnwagenparks der luftfahrtinspirierten Airstream-Caravans wieder, die noch heute aus Aluminium handvernietet werden.Der strahlende Sonnenschein präsentiert uns die bunt angestrichenen Häuser des im späten 18. Jahrhundert entstandenen Kapmalayenviertels Bo-Kaap in ihrer ganzen Pracht. Einige Minarette sehen wir als Zeichen des islamischen Glaubens der heute etwa 2.000 Einwohner. An der Rose Street lädt uns das Café Haas zu einer kleinen Rast ein. Das Café hat eine schöne künstlerische Atmosphäre und das ganze Angebot ist hausgemacht, vom Kaffee auf dem antiken Kaffeeröster bis hin zu den Backwaren. Größter Touristenmagnet ist natürlich die Victoria & Alfred Waterfront. Ein Spaziergang auf den Piers ist entspannend und es gibt zahlreiche gute Restaurants und Pubs, in denen man eine kleine Pause einlegen kann. Die zahlreichen Geschäfte im riesigen Einkaufszentrum Victoria Wharf bieten das übliche Sortiment zu „Touristenpreisen“ an.

Perfekter Urlaub. Durch den Kollegen meiner Frau sind wir auf Maria und Manfred aufmerksam geworden. Und da auch die beiden "Emsländer" sind habe ich Kontakt aufgenommen und unsere Wünsche mitgeteilt. Der Kontakt war gleich sehr angenehm weil nett und unkompliziert. Wir hatten uns bereits informiert und den beiden mitgeteilt wo wir langfahren wollen und wo wir Station auf der Reise von Port Elizabeth nach Kapstadt machen wollen. Ja, und die beiden haben uns dann eine Reise zusammengestellt die genau unsere Wünsche entsprachen. Wir sind seit einer Woche wieder in Deutschland und ich kann nur ein Wort schreiben : PERFEKT ! Es hat alles ohne auch nur ein Problem geklappt und es war traumhaft. Besser kann man auf die Wünsche nicht eingehen und diese erfüllen ! Noch mal ein dickes Dankeschön für alles, das war nicht der letzte Urlaub, den Maria und Manfred für uns organisiert haben.

Perfekt organisierte Erlebniswoche rund um Kapstadt. Bei unseren Recherchen zum geplanten Südafrikaurlaub fanden wir die Website " kapstadt - exklusivetours" von Maria und Manfred Engelmann. Ein Glücksfall, wie sich zeigte!Alle Mails und Telefonate waren sehr freundlich, konkret und vertrauensvoll.Nach Ankunft in Kapstadt erfolgte der Transfer zur Villa Mediterranean. Wir fühlten uns in diesem deutschsprachig geführten Haus von Beginn an sehr wohl.Am nächsten Tag lernten wir dann unsere Reiseleitein, Getraud Maringer, kennen.Wir erlebten mit ihr traumhafte und erlebnisreiche Tage in der Kapregion.Ganz herzlich bedanken wir uns deshalb bei Maria und Manfred Engelmann für ihre perfekte Planung und Organisation.Jedem, der eine individuelle und exklusive Reise nach Südafrika plant, können wir empfehlen, dies bei Engelmanns zu buchen.

Eindrücklich und empfehlenswert. Von unserer dreiwöchigen Südafrikareise verbrachten wir 4 aussergewöhnlich gut organisierte Tage in Kapstadt. Durch die professionelle Organisation von Familie Engelmann wurde unser Kapstadt-Aufenthalt unvergesslich. Auch unsere Kids (14&16) waren sehr begeistert.Angefangen mit dem Abholservice vom Flughafen mit Thomas. Wir fühlten uns sofort wohl. Auf eine ungezwungene und liebe Art, hat er uns viele Infos mit auf den Weg gegeben.Durch das von Maria Engelmann empfohlene Guesthouse Somerset Hill in Somerset West war der absolute Hit. Wunderschön ausgestattete Räume, kulinarische Höhenflüge wie auch eine sehr liebevolle Betreuung, was wir in vollen Zügen genossen haben und auch bestens empfehlen können.Die eindrücklichen Ausflüge nach Kap der Guten Hoffnung und Hermanus durften wir mit dem lieben Gerhard erleben. Geduldig ist er immer auf unsere Wünsche eingegangen und hat uns kompetent informiert. Da unsere englische Aussprache nicht sehr überzeugend ist, war er im Bedarfsfall immer zur Stelle.Bewegte Eindrücke konnten wir im Township in einem Kinderheim mit Maria Engelmann erleben. Imponiert hat uns auch, wie Maria Engelmann mit viel Engagement das Projekt unterstützt.Mit herzlicher Begleitung von Maria Engelmann haben wir in Stellenbosch, zum Abschluss unserer Kapstadtreise, einen köstlichen Wein genossen.Wir danken Familie Engelmann von Herzen und werden alles in schönster Erinnerung behalten.Liebe Grüsse aus der Schweiz.

Ein unvergessliches Reiseerlebnis. ...selbst bei kurzfristiger Planung und einer ungewöhnlichen Reisezeit (14 Tage Anfang März), erlebt in der Region um Kapstadt und auf einer Rundreise entlang der Gardenroute bis Port Elizabeth und zurück durch die Kleine Karoo. Wir bedanken uns bei Maria und Manfred Engelmann für die Planung unseres Aufenthaltes, die vielfältigen Vorschläge für Aktivitäten, Gästehäuser und die Betreuung vor Ort. Das Wetter war ziemlich konstant sonnig, ca. 24-25 Grad mittags, nachts kühl, also angenehm fürs Schlafen. Am Rande von Kapstadt haben wir, mit Blick auf den Tafelberg, ein sehr schönes, komfortables Gästehaus, direkt am Strand gelegen, bewohnt und konnten von dort aus mit einem Mietwagen die Stadt erkunden. Dank Maria und Manfred haben wir nicht nur touristische Highlights gesehen, sondern auch Märkte besucht, die Insider bevorzugen sowie Einsicht ins Leben und Wohnen in einem Township bekommen.Auf der 7 tägigen Rundtour entlang der Gardenroute haben wir dank der vielfältigen Hinweise und Buchungen von Engelmanns innerhalb von nur einer Woche viel gesehen und herrlich gewohnt. Die Übernachtungen in eher charakteristischen und kleinen Gästehäusern, hat uns gerade wegen der Unterschiedlichkeit der Unterkünfte super gut gefallen. Alle Häuser boten freundlichste Versorgung, mit Frühstück, lokalen Infos und Unterstützung auch bei sonstigen kleineren wie größeren touristischen Anliegen. Die Empfehlung für den Addo-Elephant-Nationalpark und die organisierte Tagestour durch den Schotia-Park vermittelten einen naturnahen Eindruck von der Tier- und Pflanzenwelt der Region, mit einem anderen Parkkonzept. Das Interesse der Ranger für die Natur und das Projekt ließ den Funken der Begeisterung auch auf uns Touristen überspringen und im Austausch wurden vielfältigste Fragen aufgeworfen und beantwortet. Der Besuch war das erhöhte Eintrittsgeld allemal Wert, der Tag, eine Empfehlung von Engelmanns, war einer der Höhepunkte der Rundreise. Die Abschlusstage mit dem Besuch in Prince Albert, einem Trip entlang der roten Berge und anschließend der Fahrt über den Swartbergpass machte die Rundtour, wortwörtlich, rund. Der Abschied fiel entsprechend eher schwer von diesem Land Südafrika, das sich uns mit vielen freundlichen und warmherzigen Begegnungen sowie mit so vielen Schönheiten offenbart hatte. Die Reise konnte aber auch nur zu diesem gelungenen Erlebnis werden, weil Maria und Manfred in der Vorbereitung wie auch in der Durchführung uns zuverlässig mit ihren Hinweisen und ihrer Erfahrung und besonders auch ihrer Fähigkeit, auf unsere Wünsche einzugehen, hilfsbereit und offen an der Seite gestanden haben. Dafür bedanken wir uns herzlichst und würden noch vielen Gästen dieses Erlebnis gönnen ..... uns vielleicht auch noch einmal !!! Monika und Lutz aus Neuss

Einmalig schöne Tage in Südafrika. Es hat an nichts gefehlt! Die Reiseleitung durch die Familie Engelmann war professionell, kompetent und äusserst freundlich. Wir erlebten einmalig schöne Tage in Kapstadt und Umgebung. Die empfohlenen Hotels und Gasthäuser waren tip-top, ein Appartement allerdings sollte aus dem Angebot gestrichen werden. Schon am zweiten Tag wurden wir pünktlich im Hotel mit Informationen und Unterlagen für unsere individuelle Reise ausgestattet. Die Reise im bequemen Mercedes Kombi in die Weingüter und die nahe Umgebung waren sehr eindrücklich, gut vorbereitet und mit viel Wissen von Manfred Engelmann begleitet. Auch gab es immer Platz für Individuelles, die Ausflüge waren optimal abgestimmt auf unsere Bedürfnisse und Wünsche.Es gibt so viel Schönes in Südafrika zu sehen, man muss aber viel Zeit mitbringen. Also haben wir uns entschlossen, bald wieder in dieses Land zu reisen.

Wein, Landschaft  und Golf. Diese erste Reise nach SA wurde nach unseren individuellen Wünschen von Engelmanns noch mit guten Tipps ergänzt. Die von ihnen ausgesuchten und gebuchten Unterkünfte waren nicht nur von hervorragender Qulität, sie bestachen zudem durch Wohlbefinden, Gemütlichkeit und liebevoller Betreuung der jeweiligen Gastgeber. Es war total unkompliziert und hat dank der Organisation der Fam. Engelmann hervorragend geklappt. Nochmals " Danke".Wir werden gerne wiederkommen und uns von Engelmans betreuen lassen.

Empfehlenswerte Wine and Dine Tour. Wir-2 Ehepaare-unternahmen am 28.01.2013 die vorerwähnte Tour mit Manfred E. Er holte uns morgens um 10 Uhr an unserem Guesthouse ab und setzte uns abends gegen 20 Uhr dort wieder ab. Die Tour führte uns von Somerset West zunächst nach Stellenbosch und Franschoek mit Besuch der "First Class" Weingüter "Delaire" (absolut sehenswert, von Lage und Architektur herausragend) und "La Motte" und einer weiteren Wein-und Sektkellerei jeweils mit Wein- bzw. Sektprobe(armer Fahrer). Das zunächst gebuchte Abendessen im "Rocca Restaurant" im Dieu Donne Vinyards in Franschoek mußten wir absagen, weil der durch Waldbrände entstandene Rauch die sonst herrliche Aussicht trübte. Manfred erwies sich aber als sehr flexibel und stellte die Tour um, indem er uns ins "Elgin Valley" mit seinen Obstplantagen führte und mit uns eine ganz besondere Lodge, nämlich das "Old Mac Daddy" besichtigte.Über den Sir Lowry`s Pass ging es dann zurück nach Somerset West, wo wir den Ausflug mit einem leckeren Abendessen in einem Seafoodrestaurant abschlossen. Manfred erwies sich als ein sympathischer Begleiter, der uns mit vielen interessanten Infos zu Land und Leuten sowie wertvollen Tipps versorgte und darüberhinaus ein sehr umsichtiger Fahrer war.

Zuverlässige und professionelle Reiseführer mit Herz & Seele. Meine Schwiegereltern waren über den 65. Geburtstag meiner Schwiegermutter in Kapstadt. Also planten wir als Überraschungsgeschenk eine Kaptour. Wir hatten bereits über einen anderen Anbieter alles organisiert, als dieser uns 4 Tage vor dem Event überraschend absagte. Wir waren so enttäuscht und hatten kaum noch Hoffnung in so kurzer Zeit von Deutschland aus etwas anderes organisieren zu können. Nach dem ersten Telefonat mit Fr. Engelmann drehte sich es jedoch wieder zum Guten. Sie sind sehr flexibel gewesen und haben sogar noch eine persönliche Note in die Tour eingebaut. Meine Schwiegermutter hat sich noch am gleichen Abend ihres Geburtstages gemeldet und herzlichst bedankt. Sie - und natürlich auch mein Schwiegervater - hatten einen phantastischen Tag erlebt und waren hellauf begeistert. Wir sind froh schlussendlich in so zuverlässigen Händen gelandet zu sein und können Kapstadt Exclusive Tours bedenkenlos weiterempfehlen.Aber vielleicht kommen wir ja sogar selbst noch mal in den Genuss einer Südafrikareise, dann werden wir bestimmt wieder von einander hören! :)K. Chebli

individuelles Programm in Kapstadt und der Weinregion. Sein profundes Wissen über Land, Leute und Hintergründe hat unseren Horizont erweitert und das Verständnis für die Probleme dieses wunderschönen Landes vertieft. Auf unsere Wünsche ist er sehr flexibel eingegangen und hat uns an die Orte gebracht, die wir uns gewünscht hatten und die er uns als besonders lohnenswert empfohlen hatte: (Passstrassen, Gepardenprojekt, tolle Restaurants und Weingüter, Strände) Dazu bekamen wir gute Tipps für lohnende Adressen in Kapstadt. Manfred ist ein sehr angenehmer "Reisebegleiter", den ich nur empfehlen kann. Wir waren als 2 Freunde (Alter über 60 Jahre) unterwegs. Siegrid und Jürgen aus Hamburg

sehr gut :). Vor Beginn meines Auslandssemester in Südafrika wollten meine Eltern und ich ein paar Tage das Land erkunden. Aufgrund von Zeitmangel hatten wir nur 4Tage dafür Zeit. Im Internet sind wir auf die Kapstadt Exclusive Tours Seite gestoßen. Total unkompliziert und mit sehr viel Freude wurde für uns eine individuelle, mit unseren Wünschen, Tour gestaltet. Durch das enorme Insiderwissen unseres Reiseführers Manfreds, konnten wir viele kleine individuelle Plätze genießen. Besonders die Restaurantauswahl war immer sehr gut. Trotz der langen Strecken die wir zurücklegten, hatten wir immer sehr viel Spaß und haben viel über Land und Leute erfahren. Für mich persönlich war es besonders wichtig nicht nur die Touristenattraktionen zu sehen, sondern auch ein Gefühl für die Menschen und deren Lebensweise zu erlangen. Dies hat Manfred geschafft, indem er uns das Leben der Einheimischen auf vielerlei Hinsicht erklärt und Näher gebracht hat. Nun lebe ich schon mehr als ein Monat hier in Südafrika und liebe diese Land. Es hat so viel zu bieten. Ich stehe mit Maria und Manfred immer noch in Kontakt. Für alle meine Fragen sind sie immer offen und helfen mir gerne weiter. Für jeden Südafrikabesucher kann ich Kapstadt Excluive Tours nur empfehlen. tolle Tour+++sehr individuell+++top Reiseführer. Da wir das erste mal in Südafrika und in Kapstadt waren, haben wir die 3tägige klassische Kapstadttour gebucht. Wir waren von Ende Januar bis Mitte Februar hier. Unsere Guide Gerhard hat sich sehr viel Mühe gegeben und uns alles Wissenswertes über das Land und Umgebung gezeigt. Er ist auf unsere Wünsche individuell eingegangen. Die Tour zum Kap der Guten Hoffnung war beendruckenswert auch die Affenfamilien auf dem Rückweg waren interessant. Das Kinderheim bei Amelia, welches von Maria und Manfred Engelmann unterstützt wird, hat uns besonders beeindruckt. Die Unterkunft in Kapstadt war erstklassig. Wir waren nicht zum letzten Mal hier. Danke für alles !!!!!

Kap-Region und Weintour. Es hat alles ganz hervorragend geklappt, die beiden ausgesuchten Unterkünfte in Kapstadt und in Sommerset West waren von bester Qualität. 10 Tage Südafrika von seiner einheimischen Seite!. Wir waren als Familie über Silvester für 10Tage in Kapstadt. Das war wirklich ein unvergessliches Erlebnis! Würde dieses Land sofort wieder bereisen!Manfred hat uns perfekt geführt! Besonders gefallen hat mir, dass er nicht versucht hat, einen starren Zeitplan einzuhalten, sondern er ist flexibel auf unsere Wünsche eingegangen. Beispielweise haben wir ein ausgeprägtes Interesse an Design, Architektur, Möbel und Einrichtungsgegenständen. Manfred hat uns dann sämtliche Shops in und um Kapstadt gezeigt, wo wir uns zahlreiche kreative Anregungen holen konnten. Außerdem hat uns Manfred nicht nur die touristischen Attraktionen gezeigt, sondern auch viele Restaurants, Geschäfte und Strände, wo Einheimische hingehen. Z.B. ein kleines Fish&Chips Restaurant in Simonstown oder das Beach Restaurant Strandkombuis in Yzerfontein. Es war nicht die klassische Touristenführung. Wir sind wirklich in die Magie Südafrikas abgetaucht! Vielen, vielen Dank Manfred!!!

Rundum perfekt! Wir kommen wieder !. Meine Freundin und ich sind im Internet auf Kapstadt exklusiv Tours aufmerksam geworden. Nach dem Telefonat mit Maria hatten wir von Anfang an ein gutes Gefühl.Die 6-tägige Garden-Route-Tour war perfekt organisiert, die Unterkünfte waren erstklassig und mit Manfred hatten wir einen Guide mit dem wir nicht nur über Süd-Afrika, sondern auch über viele weitere Themen interessante Gespräche führen konnten.Wir kommen mit Sicherheit wieder !

Kapstaden i Sydafrika besök Taffelberget ett måste när man är i Kapstaden. En mycket sevärd plats i ett land som varit plågat av apartheid i många år men som nu har fått en liberalare syn på olika folkslag som bor i Sydafrika.Landet är lika stort som Spanien och Frankrike tillsammans och bjuder på en massa sevärdheter allt ifrån spännande safaris med chans att få se dom "Big Five"(lejon,elefant,noshörning,buffel och leopard)safaris i öppna jeepar med mycket goda chanser till fotografering.Även besök på vingårdar är intressant med vinprovning bl.a. Möjligheter till bad i främst Indiska Oceanen som är varmare än Atlanten.Även möjlighet till hajsafari eller sälsafaris .Besök gärna kåkstäderna med(townships) och se hur människorna lever där på små medel.Utflykt till Godahoppsudden med chans att få se bl.a babianer som knycker besökarnas saker om man inte ser upp. Strutsfarm och möjlighet att få rida på en struts (max 75 kilo) erbjuds besökare.Platsen heter Oudsdoorn. Man bör nästan besöka Sydafrika flera gånger för att få ett begrepp om hela landets sevärdheter.Kort sagt: En underbar resa väl värt varenda krona Lycka till. Michael.

EIn GLücksfall. Wir hatten das große Glück mit Manfred Engelmann eine Tour zum Kap fo Good Hope zu machen. Die Informationen über das Land, die hier lebenden Personen, die Besonderheitenund auch die Tierwelt waren behutsam und sehr kompetent.Natürlich wurden wir pünktlich abgeholt und pünktlich zum nächsten Ausgangspunkt gebracht.Die Fahrt war bequem und sehr angenehm. Es war als würde man einen alten Freund treffen.Es war ein herrlicher, positiver Tag, der uns ewig in Erinnerung bleiben wird undnatürlich hoffen und freuen wir uns auf ein Wiedersehen.

3 Tage in Kapstadt und Umgebung mit Manfred Engelmann. Über Internet haben wir die "Kapstadt Exclusive Tours" kontaktiert und kamen schnell überein von Herrn Manfred Engelmann die Tagestouren gestalten zu lassen.Sicherlich das Traditionelle in und rund um Kapstadt. Wir waren ja auch zum 1. Mal in Südafrika. Das Wetter spielte mit und so begannen wir unsere Tour mit der Fahrt auf den Tafelberg. Toller Blick über die Stadt und die umliegenden Hügel. Danach ins Zentrum und anschließend zu einem eindrucksvollen Helikopterflug über die Stadt und die Küste.Am 2.Tag ging es nach Stellenbosch samt einem Besuch auf einem kleinen Markt mit kulinarischen und handgefertigten kulturellen Produkten.Wir konnten Herrn Engelmann als wirklichen Insider kennenlernen, der als Fremdenführer erfreulicherweise auf Nennung von Jahreszahlen und Gedenktagen verzichtet und dafür das alltägliche in der Region zeigt.Natürlich besuchten wir auch das Kap der guten Hoffnung und verkosteten die Weine und auch das bemerkenswert gute Olivenöl in Stellenbosch und Franschhoek. Herr Engelmann hat uns überzeugt dass 3 Tage zu kurz sind und wir daher sicher wiederkommen werden. Er hat uns noch soviel zu zeigen. Wir freuen uns darauf!

von Windhoek nach Kapstadt- eine tolle Tour. Vom 18. Oktober bis zum 2.11.2012 haben wir(8Personen) eine Tour durch das südliche Namibia bis Kapstadt unternommen. Manfred hat uns auf dieser tollen Tour begleitet.Am 19. Oktober hat er uns in Windhoek am Flughafen in Empfang genommen und "Hummeldumm"-like starteten wir unsere Tour in einem 12-Sitzer Toyota-Quantum(4 Sitze waren fürs Gepäck).Über Klein Barmen, Swakopmund, Sossusvlei, Fish River Canyon, Orange River näherten wir uns nach 11 Tagen Südafrika mit Stationen in Lamberts Bay und Paternoster. Manfred hatte für uns wunderbare Ünterkünfte und Lodges ausgesucht.In Kapstadt konnte wir noch 3 Tage die Sonne am Beach von Somerset West und am CampsBay genießen. Ein Besuch bei Mama Amelia im Mfuleni-township stand auch auf dem Programm bevor es nach 2 Wochen wieder in die Heimat ging. Wir hatten Dank Maria und Manfred einen wundervollen Aufenthalt in Südafrika und mit Manfred einen tollen Reisebegleiter in Namibia.

Port-Elizabeth - Garden Route - Kapstadt - einfach Klasse.. Wir hatten Dank Maria und Manfred einen wundervollen Aufenthalt in Südafrika. Los ging es im Addo- und Schotia Park wo wir jeweils faszinierende Jeep Touren unternahmen. Dann führte uns die Reise entlang der Garden Route Richtung Knysna. Die ausgesuchten Unterkünfte waren liebevoll geführte Gästehäuser in denen die Eigentümer sich um unser leibliches Wohl kümmerten. Unsere Betreuung wurde durch einen Tour-Guide - Gerald begleitet. Wann immer wir Fragen oder Wünsche hatten - er kümmerte sich. Informationen während der ganzen Tour waren für Ihn selbstverständlich. - Klasse! Über Hermanus - wo wir Wale sahen, führte uns der Weg nach Kapstadt. In Sumerset West wurden wir von Maria und Manfred in Empfang genommen. Man zeigte uns unser beeindruckendes Domizil für die nächsten Tage in denen wir persönlich geführt jeden Tag neues erleben durften. Einige Ziele die wir gemeinsam besuchten wie z.B. Tafelberg, Kirstenbosch, Waterfront, Greenmarket und natürlich die Route zum Kap mit all den beindruckenden Momenten wurden von M&M persönlich und höchst informativ gestaltet. Noch zu erwähnen ist, dass wir nach Stellenbosch wundervolle Weingüter kennen lernen durften wo man für uns noch eine Weinprobe organisierte. Abschließend möchten wir nicht unerwähnt lassen, dass wir uns mit Maria über ein soziales Projekt in den Townships informiert und dieses auf bewegende Art auch kennen lernen durften. Wir haben Maria und Manfred als erfahrene, umsichtige und ihre äußerst kompetente Betreuung als Bereicherung für unseren Urlaub gesehen und können sie als Tourguide absolut empfehlen. Wir kommen bestimmt nochmal wieder!

Individuell, familiär und einfach toll. Alles was wir vor hatten zu sehen haben wir gesehen und Dank Manfred und Maria noch viel mehr. Unsere Kinder (12 und 13 Jahre) waren begeistert: Pinguine in Simonstown am Boulders Beach, Kap Horn, Kapstadt, Tafelberg mit den murmeltierähnlichen Dassies, Stellenbosch und dann vor allem die Tour durch die Berge von Klein Karoo bis Outshoorn und weiter bis zum Addo Elephant Park. Dort gleich in der Nähe unternahmen wir auch eine Jeep-Tour in das Schotia Privat Game Reservat, in dem wir Bekanntschaft mit Löwen, Nashörnern und Giraffen machten.Die Unterkünfte waren alle sehr persönlich und individuell. Wir haben uns überall "heimelig" gefühlt.Wir kommen für eine Wein-Tour wieder!

Kapstadt und Umgebung - ein unvergessliches Erlebnis. Alle Höhepunkte Kapstadts, die Kaphalbinsel und die malerische Weinregion in fünf Tagen zu erleben, war das hochgesteckte Ziel für unsere kleine Reisegruppe (vier Personen). Diese Tour kombinierte den Besuch der ältesten Metropole Südafrikas mit Aufenthalten am Kap und im idyllischen Weinland in faszinierender Weise. Auch der Besuch der Townships wurde nicht ausgelassen. Ein ganz wesentlicher Faktor für das Gelingen der Tour war die äußerst kompetente und individuelle Betreuung durch den von der Kalahari Afrika Spezial Safaris Reisegruppe, Dresden, engagierten Manfred Engelmann. Als erfahrener Tour Guide verstand er es aufgrund seiner fundierten Kenntnisse ausgezeichnet, uns die Region und die dort lebenden Menschen näher zu bringen. Er vermittelte uns sehr detaillierte Informationen zu den wichtigsten Sehenswürdigkeiten. Sein Wissen über Land und Leute haben die Tour zu einem spannenden Erlebnis werden lassen.Für uns wird der Besuch der Kap-Region unvergessen bleiben und können Manfred Engelmann als erfahrenen und umsichtigen Tourbegleiter nur empfehlen.

Fantastisch, flexibel und entspannt. Hallo Südafrikareisende,Meine Frau und ich waren zum ersten Mal in der Region am Kap und hatten die Tour von Deutschland über das Internet entdeckt und problemlos über E-Mail mit Manfred geplant.Dabei ist er auf unsere Wünsche sehr flexibel eingegangen und hat eine eintägige Rundreise mit allen wichtigen Punkten entlang dem Kap zusammengestellt. Toll fanden wir auch, dass Manfred kein Problem damit hatte uns an unserer Unterkunft abzuholen (da es am Anfang unserer Reise war hatten wir das „Links Fahren“ noch nicht so verinnerlicht :-) ).Die Tour selbst war toll und wir haben von Manfred viele nützliche Informationen zu den einzelnen Punkten bekommen. Alles total entspannt und selbst während der Tour auch noch flexibel (hatten eine Änderung am Ende). Eine solche Tour ist ein Muss für jeden, der mal ganz entspannt etwas von der Umgebung mitbekommen will und dabei keinerlei Stress mit allen administrativen Dingen haben möchte.Wenn wir noch mal in der Gegend sind (und das ist sicher), werden wir auf jeden Fall wieder das Angebot von Manfred nutzen. Eine klare Empfehlung!

Die perfekte Tour. Leider sind wir wieder im nüchternen Alltag angekommen. Die 5-tägige Gardenroute-Tour, die Manfred hervorragend geplant und geführt hat, war für uns auf unserer ersten Südafrikareise ein unvergessliches Erlebnis. Vor allem die individuelle persönliche Begleitung, Auswahl der einzelnen Sehenswürdigkeiten und das Wissen über Land und Leute haben die Tour zu einem entspannten Erlebnis werden lassen. Alle Unterkünfte waren sehr komfortabel, individuell und mit persönlichem Engagement geführt. Besonders gefallen haben uns die Tour durch den Addo Elephant Nationalparkund die Safari im Schotia Park. Zusammenfassend gesagt war es eine super Organisation, unvergessliche Eindrücke, hunderte Fotos...noch einmal ganz herzlichen Dank.

Wir träumen immer noch ........ Mein Mann und ich haben unsere erste Fernreise nach Kapstadt unternommen und beiKapstadt-exclusivtours eine 5 Tage Garden Route, Addo etc. gebucht. Manfred Engelmannhat uns von Anfang bis zum Ende der Tour sehr gut betreut, er ist ein sehr umsichtiger, sicherer Fahrer, wir haben nicht eine einzige kritische Situation mit ihm erlebt. 2 Tage hatten wir leider schlechtes Wetter, strömenden Regen und starken Wind. Wir haben aus diesem Grund unsere Tour geändert. Das war auch nicht weiter tragisch, Manfred hatte gute Alternativen und wir haben wunderbare Landschaften, die Karoo und Ortschaften gesehen, in denen die Zeit offenbar stehen geblieben ist. Ein besonderes Erlebnis waren die Begegnungen mit Elefanten, Löwen, Büffel und vielen anderen Wildtieren im Addopark. Manfred hat uns außerdem das Land, in dem er lebt, sehr nahe gebracht, unsviel erzählt, erklärt und verständlich gemacht. Ohne ihn hätten wir das alles so nichterleben können. So hatten wir unterwegs immer sehr lehrreiche und lebhafte Gespräche.Am letzten Tag haben wir noch einige traumhafte Weingüter kennen lernen können.Für uns ist diese Reise ein unvergessliches Erlebnis, wir träumen noch immer, und wirhaben vor, im nächsten Jahr wieder zu kommen. Wir freuen uns dabei auf Manfredund seine Familie..

Wir kommen wieder. Meine Ehefrau und ich haben anfang diesen Jahres das wunderschöne Südafrika besucht. Da unser Aufenthalt sich auf nur knapp 2 Wochen beschränkte und wir in diesem Zeitraum einen möglichst umfangreichen Eindruck des Landes bekommen wollten, haben wir uns schließlich entschieden eine Tour nach Kapstadt und an der Gardenroute zu unternehmen. Im Internet sind wir dann auf die Seite der Kapstadt Exlusive Tours gestoßen. Da unser erster Eindruck ein sehr positiver war, welcher sich auch nach einem telefonischem Gespräch bestätigte buchten wir Tagestouren in Kapstadt und eine 7- tägige Gardenroute Tour aus dem Angebot der kapstadt Exclusive Tours. Diese Entscheidung haben wir keine Minute bereut. Um es kurz zu fassen: Dir Tour war top organisiert, wir hatten einfach eine wunderbare Zeit. Wir werden auf jeden Fall wiederkommen! Peter und Eva aus Münster

Der HAMMER!!!. Im Dezember 2011 besuchte ich und 2 meiner besten Freunde Kapstadt und Umgebung. Wir nutzten die Dienste von Kapstadt Exclusive Day Tours und es war so unglaublich entspannt. Wir haben 2 Tagestouren gemacht mit Manfred: einmal eine Weintour und eine "Wine- Gourmet"-Tour. Die Weingüter waren perfekt ausgewählt und die Restaurants ein Traum. Obwohl es nicht besser ging, kam dann als "richtiges" bzw weiteres Highlight eine 5tägige Gardenroute- Tour bis hoch zum Addo Elephant Park. Wir mussten uns um nix kuemmern, durften nur geniessen. Alles war perferkt organisiert. Hotel bzw "Guesthouses" waren überragend. Wir hatten nie das Gefühl, dass die Tage zu voll gepackt waren. Manfred war ein spontaner, flexibler und lustiger Mensch, der sehr gute Kenntnisse über Land und Leute besitzt. Vor allem aber hatte er sehr viele Insidertips parat, was die Reise unvergesslich machte. Wir werden auf jeden Fall wieder kommen und die Dienste in Anspruch nehmen. Erholsamer, Beeindruckender und unproblematischer gings nicht!!!

Authentic and Entertaining Township Experience in Langa. We have been on a Township Tour on Sunday Morning and also for a cycling tour through the township of Langa in Cape Town. Both Guides Gladstone and Thando gave us a lot of information about housing, everyday life, history and also the community projects such as Gugu S'Thebe in Langa which is a nice cultural experience to see the pottery project and as well the first place in Langa to have a real coffee shop experience for the local community. The unique experience with the people who live there and their authentic story as well as the entertaining guides made the tours very special! I can definitely recommend both tours because going to church in a township on a Sunday morning is more of a party - not like a boring uni lecture as in my home country Germany. :D On top of that you also get to try some nice African traditional food such as butternut pumpkin or maize meal as well as a nice time at the happy feet project for the kids' education in dancing and keeping their traditions alive!It was a pleasure :)

Walking tour through Langa . We booked the two hour walking tour which started at 9.30 am.Went to Langa by taxi and met the guide at the designated place. He first showed us a pottery project which is situated in the visitors center and this was very nice, one of the men working there explained to us how the pottery is made and we could also watch a lady actually paint a mug. Buying something or giving a donation was appreciated but there was no pressure. Then we went outside and the walking tour started. The guide told us he would show us different parts of Langa, from the very poor to the wealthier ones. I liked the first stop the most, it was in the house of an older gentleman who told us a lot about how he built the shack he was living in by himself, from material he found, he was actually very creative and had some clever solutions under the circumstances. He was a very positive and upbeat person and nice to talk to. We proceeded to another accomodation where six families were living under very cramped conditions and our guide encouraged us to look around and take pictures and just walk into people's apartments which I am not too keen on doing. We went into one and chatted briefly with a lady but the other doors were closed and that was fine for me. Later we strolled through the neighborhood and the guide told us some more stuff, we came along properly built houses and other amenities in the community. What I liked about the tour is that, especially as it was only the two of us, nobody paid attention to us and there were no crowds of kids following us. Apparently there are a lot of tourists visiting Langa so residents are used to them doing the tours which takes away from the awkwardness. The guide was nice, if I could give him a little point of improvement it would be to keep his attention to the visitors the whole time, even when they are engaged with other people. It's not that much about safety but about feeling you are not a burden as you are really getting into people's private space during this tour, being a stranger. I know for him it feels different as he grew up there but I have reservations walking into the bedrooms of strangers. In general, I do recommend taking a township tour and I also recommend Vamos. I think two hours are just the right time frame for such a visit.

An eye-opening experience. We toured the Langa Township with Gladstone as our tour guide. He picked us up on time. Very friendly and interactive with our kids. Very glad to show our children what life is like in the townships. Great lunch at Mzoli's. Met with local residents who welcomed us into their homes. A great day for us. Would highly recommend.

Truly inspiring and enlightening . We visited the Langa township tour this morning with Gladstone. I cannot recommend it enough we were thought about the language, the tribes, life in the township and were even brought into the homes of people who live there. All of the locals were so friendly and delighted to see us. Gladstone brought us to a local lady's house for traditional African lunch- delicious! A must do in Cape Town!

Disappointed. Looks like we really were unlucky judging by other reviews but we found this tour to be a real disappointment.. Booked in advance and showed up early only to find out the guide wasn't notified we were coming. His mates hanging around the meet point had to call him and get him out of bed.. we spent the first half hour or so dumped in with another group to look at how some pottery is made.. not sure if this is normally part of the tour but wasn't what we came for, and by the time it was over and we helped the guide retrieve the bikes from the storeroom and get on our way it was a good 45 mins into the 2-hour tour time. My bike was in terrible condition and was difficult to ride but I didn't want to waste more time getting a new one. Once we were on our way the tour was fairly good but the guide was clearly tired, the tour was rushed (finished 15 mins early after starting so late) and the guide laboured for too long on the tipping expectations on multiple occasions. Overall we were very disappointed in what should have been an experience.

Life-changing experience. We booked the Sunday gospel tour and were escorted by our guide Gladstone. Gladstone gave us a thorough history of the township of Langa. Langa is Cape Town oldest Village. We walked through the township with Gladstone, visited a church which was having services, and ate at a local nurse's home. In addition, we were taken through The village and homes where the locals live. Felt we got a true sense of the village, the people, and it's history. Cannot recommend this tour highly enough.

The best tour . The organisation for the tour with Siviwe was very uncomplicated. Siviwe is a really nice and funny guy. The tour itself was very interesting. We could talk to the people in Langa and visited two homes and a brewery. The people were very nice and you could ask them all kind of questions. I like this tour because of the interaction with people from Langa and the Infos you get from them.I can recommend a tour with Vamos. It is a great experience.
Fantastic. It was wonderful to go on a tour of the township and see the non-tourist aspect of Cape Town. My daughters had a great experience dancing with the local children.

what an amazing experience. wow I cannot recommend highly enough of this!! the tour really lets you see into the lives of such a different culture. a very eye opening experience with an amazing local tour guide who shares with you what the lives of the people living in the township are like. truly cannot recommend highly enough of this tour thank you so much for a great day and for sharing your lives with me!!!

Great experience. Thank you Gladstone for a great tour of the Langa township. We learnt lots about Langa and it was a truly humbling experience. A must do for a trip to Cape Town. The included lunch was delicious!

A "must do" in Cape Town with an excellent company.. We were fortunate to get Siviwe (one of the owners of the tour company) as our guide. Very knowledge, frank and insightful of the history, lifestyle and politics of the townships. It was a very comfortable and welcoming experience that opened up the South African culture and circumstance to us...something we always look for when traveling. This is truly a must do for anyone traveling to Cape Town.

Recommended. This tour was not the first township tour that I did, but it was again really an eye-opener. First we visited the museum, whereafter we visited a local at his house who was telling his life story and about his life as Langa. Afterwards we visited a few of the hostels and continued to walk a bit more through Langa.

Thank you Gladstone; hope the boys still have their football!. The tour of Langa with Gladstone was a highlight of our trip. From driving through Cape Town while Gladstone taught us the click language of his Khosa tribe, to marveling at his acapella rendition of Miriam Makeba’s Click Song no. 1, to passing the time of day with gracious Langa resident, Shoota, in his living room to playing football with a bunch of boys gathered together by Gladstone for a match. The trip opened our childrens’ eyes, and it heartened my soul. There is still much to be done, and the 3 families still living in one room were testament to that. But there is much pride and we were as much a curiosity to the people we met as they were to us. Thankyou Gladstone; you were a fantastic guide turning what could have been the wrong sort of tourism into something so positive.

A simply excellent experience - eye-opening but uplifting. Despite some initial scepticism (about "poverty tourism"), my husband Jamie and I did the Langa township tour with Siviwe during our honeymoon in Cape Town, and we cannot recommend it enough. Siviwe is such a nice guy, very personable and funny. He is also an excellent storyteller, bringing me close to tears as he talked through the history of the township in relation to apartheid. Our experience of the township itself was very positive too - it was eye-opening being shown the shacks but also inspiring seeing the art and crafts and hearing about the positive attitudes, the grasping of opportunities presented post-apartheid, the loyalty of people to their community, and the effort made to make crime uncool. We were fascinated to learn about the culture and traditions of the Xhosa people and to meet some of the locals. We were actually joined for most of the tour by a 12-year-old boy who clearly fancied himself as a tour guide in the making, and he did a great job! The tour ended with lunch at the famous Mzoli's butchery and braai restaurant in neighbouring township Gugulethu, which served up the tastiest meat I think we've ever had! All in all we had a fantastic experience, we thoroughly enjoyed meeting and getting to know Siviwe, and would suggest that a holiday to Cape Town is not complete without this tour.

Educational and fun morning!. Highly recommend!!!! We had an amazing tour with Gladstone. It was great hearing about his life and how the townships operate! He was friendly, fun and open to all of our questions! Lunch was fabulous!!!

You should see both sides of Cape Town. Definitely need to add this to your Cape Town itinerary. We had the most wonderful guide, Thando take us to four different styles of residence, while passing by shops, restaurants, bars (shebeens). Lots of hellos, smiles and friendly people along the way. All questions were answered with lots of personal details and experiences shared. Don't be one of the folks that drive through in a tour bus, only taking pictures from the windows. Come down, get on a bike and meet some residents!

Vamos Gospel Tour of Langa Township. Vamos was recommended to us by Lesley Cox of Amber Tours, and we are grateful to her advice. The guide and co-owner of Vamos Tours, Siviwe Mbinda, picked us up promptly from our BnB in BoKaap in a vehicle that was clean and airconditioned. Siviwe is an excellent guide, and inspirational. With him in Langa we felt perfectly safe. We were introduced to the home of a local resident whose abode was made mainly with recycled materials and he'd constructed a lamp from a recycled blender and a light fixture from a hair dryer part. The ingenuity of his inventions and the pride he had in his home were very evident. We spent some time at a cultural center and watched a group of school-age dancers. We saw government-built townhouses with solar panels on the roofs. It was an honour being welcomed into a local church and singing alongside these people. The pastor preached on how to deal with anger in a constructive way. We had a delicious lunch in a beautiful bungalow with double car garage. After touring Langa, we had completely different eyes driving past townships for the rest of our trip. We understood that these places are diverse, and populated with intelligent hard-working people who are overcoming challenges most of us have never had to face. Of all the things we did during our three weeks in South Africa, this was one of the best, and I would highly recommend going with Vamos tours for a safe and inspirational experience.

Go there and don t hesitate it s a must do !!! . Gladstone was our guide , showing the township it s a wonderful experience , don t leave SA without this tour , women cooking ships heads were incredible and the local beer ... Amazing to taste !!!

Unforgettable - a definite must do.. Having read the excellent reviews for this tour, I booked to take my two children (6&8 years) on the 2 hour walking tour of Langa. I wanted them to get a different perspective on life. We did the tour on Sunday which meant that there were children everywhere and a real buzz about the community. The children loved coming up to our group as we walked through the township and just wanted to hold our hands or do high 5's. Everyone was so friendly and said hello as we passed by and in no way were we made to feel like intruders. People welcomed us in to their homes and looked genuinely happy to see us. One lady offered for my youngest daughter to sit with her on her bed and told us all about living in the hostel. She shares a very small room with 9 others and they consist of 3 different families, previously unknown to each other. This was a real eye opener for us all. Thando, our tour guide was excellent. He has first hand experience of the township as he lives there and so he was able to answer questions honestly and with integrity. There are many churches within the !anga township and our tour culminated in a short visit to one of them. It was a wonderful experience and we were welcomed with open arms. In brief, I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who has a genuine interest in learning more about the townships. It was very suitable for children and the memories of this tour will be a talking point in our family for a very long time to come. Thank you so much for a fantastic morning.

Tough but inspiring Sunday morning. We did the half day tour on a Sunday morning with our guide, Gladstone. Seeing the conditions that still prevail more than 20 years after the end of apartheid was very tough for a couple of westerners like us. The tour underlined the cruelty of that era and just how far SA has to develop to ensure all can live in decent housing. But underneath the superficial, we also met strong people with uplifting and inspiring stories to tell: the father who lived in a corrugated iron, home-made shack whose daughter want to be a lawyer and who was living in a better part of the township so as not to be disturbed; and the family who had recently moved into a new house which they saw as a palace! As their daughter told us you can either be controlled by the situation you are in or take control. She definitely was taking control. Some of the stories we heard moved me to tears. Thank you Vamos and Gladstone and the people of Langa for an inspirational tour. One small comment to make the tour better: the day we went was VERY hot and we did a lot of walking, but Vamos did not provide water. By the end I was becoming a little dehydrated.

Educational Tour. We visited Langa on a biking tour with the guide Thando who showed us around. He explained the way of living in an honest way with a lot of sense of humour. Do take enough cash to donate the art craft center and pay the guide. It was an impressive and honest tour.

Half day Langa tour- brilliant. Went on the half day Langa tour guided by Sivewe. It was brilliant. He picked us up from where we were staying in Camps Bay, and then we headed to Langa. We got a great insight into township life, and particularly the many positive aspects of Langa in particular. We got to meet some great locals, and then finished off with a braai at Mzoli's which was great. I would highly recommend this tour NDMRS particular Sivewe as a guide.

Half day tour of Langa. This tour made me very hopeful for the future of South Africa! Siviwe's successful partnership with Garth is a model for bringing together the best of all worlds. Siviwe's tour guiding is intelligent, informed and articulate. A must!

Va Va Vamos!. This tour is a must. Sensitively and interestingly conducted by the tour company entrepreneur (who was brought up there during the apartheid era and still lives there) , it provides a fascinating snapshot of the social and economic changes that have happened post- apartheid in a South African city township - and of what still needs to be achieved. In spite of the still harsh and difficult conditions under which many of the township's residents live (no running water, little or no sanitation, constant risk of fire, etc), the overall feeling and message was one of hope.

Touches the good heart. We had the great privilege to enjoy this tour and highly recommend it. Siviwe knows SA's history very well and has a very entertaining way of telling it. On top of that he has a very good heart. He told us many personal stories and he responded very much to what kind of interests we had. We were a group comprised of a french family with three teenagers and us. The trip included visits in a self-beer-brewing mini-pub, a visit to a gentlemen's shack, the peaceful mix of neighborhoods and an excellent lunch at Mzoli's. Thank you Siviwe for this experience we will remember in our memorries and our hearts.

Most Excellent Tour!. This tour was the most informative and enjoyable look into the current state of townships, particularly of Langa. Our charismatic guide showed us the cultural center, porcelain workshop, middle class quarters and the original structures that are slowly being substituted by government housing, but still carry the genuine flavor of the past. The tour ends with an African barbecue at the most popular Mzoli's Place.

Both enjoyable and illuminating, the highlight of our stay in Cape Town. Before describing the township visit itself I want to emphatically stress that you should 100% do this trip. Many people feel uncomfortable with the idea of a township tour and have preconceptions of it being being 'voyeuristic' and 'poverty tourism'. This is not the case. Apartheid and forced resettlement are a part of S Africa's recent history and townships are a living legacy of those times. That is not to say that they are negative or depressive places (Langa township was brimming with entrepreneurs, artists and joyful people), but it important that anybody interested in the country's society and future meet the people who come from these places and understand their challenges, hopes and ambitions. Equally, it is crucial that people in the townships meet and learn about foreigners and whites as well. I honestly believe that initiatives like Siviwe's will help encourage further integration in S African society.Our guide Siviwe came and picked us up from our apartment and then drove us to the Township. During the car journey we spoke at length about his views on the townships and S Africa in general and he was quickly open with us and very engaging. On arriving at the township we visited their theatre, met local artists and learnt about the social classes that exist within the area and how the municipal government is helping build new houses. We were quickly joined by 2 two school kids (Siviwe's tourism assistants !) who talked to us about their families and school. They stayed with us for the rest of the trip and were great fun! We met with a local who showed us how he had built his house (impressive improvisation!), visited a church and pub (sampling the local beer), and learnt about about the local delicacy; boiled lambs head! Lucky for us we didn't have to indulge Siviwe as he then took us to what was perhaps our best meal in Cape Town; a braai at Mzoli's Place. Beef, lamb, sausages, it was all delicious. We then dropped the kids back home and Sivile took us back to our apartment. Siviwe is charismatic, warm and attentive guide. The township trip is illuminating, educational and most of all, fun. We will definitely be returning next time we're in Cape Town to have a beer with Siviwe and to see how the township has changed.10/10

Nice but confronting tour. We did the 2 hour cycling tour with Thando. Because we went by bike we got a real close encounter with the township of Langa. It felt weird to take pictures of people who have it tough. On the other hand, thanks to the tours you get a change to help those people. The money is reinvested in Langa + we also bought a little something from the culture centre were they train people in handcraft so that they would be able to provide for themselves. I wouldn't call the tour nice because of the theme but it was informative and if you visit South Africa you should also see 'the other side' of it.

Must do. I'm a South African who has visited Cape Town on numerous occasions, but this is the first time I decided to do a township tour, because I had a foreign visitor. I think it is an important part of a trip to South Africa for anyone who really wants to understand the country, to go into the townships and see how the majority of South Africans live.We had an amazing time with Siviwe, the morning flew by. It was just the two of us with Siviwe, so we had a unique experience, far better than going in a bigger group. I would recommend Vamos to everyone.

Private 1/2 Township Tour. Siviwe was an awesome tour guide. He was very insightful with his experience growing up in the township, how it's changing, what's good, what's bad, etc. I enjoyed walking through the township and seeing how the people live. The beer shop was very interesting. The braai lunch was excellent! Highly recommended.

A must do in Cape Town!. First off I'd like to say how happy I am that I decided to visit Langa, and experience a whole different culture and environment from the glam of Camps Bay where I had been staying. My guide was Gladstone, he was very knowledgeable about Langa and its history, as he still lives in the township. He took us to the home he grew up in, which was very special. The children in the township are absolutely beautiful, seeing the smiles on their faces even though they have so little, really opens you're eyes up and makes you have a different perspective on life. I loved visiting the cultural centre and seeing all the arts and crafts the community are making, and the delevopments that are happening, Langa is really growing into a great community. The highlight of course was visiting the Happy Feet Youth Project. The children performed a few song and dances for us and it was very special. If you want to take gifts for the children you can, just let your guide know beforehand. Thanks again Gladstone for being a wonderful guide. I recommend anyone who visits CT to see this side of the city.

Langa township tour with Thando - a great afternoon!. My friends and I did a walking tour with Thando (a local guy who grew up and still lives in Langa). After visiting the Visitor Centre in Langa, Thando guided us through different parts of Langa, showed many types of township houses, explained and answered a lot of our questions and made us feel welcome at any time! He is a very friendly, informative, funny and passionate guide... don't miss a tour with him! At our request he accompanied us to the "Happy feet youth project" where we talked, danced and played with all children which are part of the afternoon offer. It was an amazing and lovely experience to got in touch with them! (especially because we are teachers in Germany :) The Project and also the Vamos Township Tour offers and facilitate a lot to help people from Langa. They're buying food and other important things, especially for school education. So make a donation goes directly to the residents who need help!Good luck to all of you! When we visit Cape Town again, we will surely be contacting Thando and returning to Langa again!A great *THANKS* for sharing your life with all of us!Greeting from Germany!

Great half-day tour of Langa township!. We did the morning tour of Langa township with Siview and had a really interesting, informative morning. We weren't sure what to expect but Siview was so interesting telling us stories of how the townships operate and the inhabitant's attitudes to such tours and how they aim to work their way to a better quality of life. We were a little apprehensive beforehand but Siview put us totally at ease and we never once felt unsafe or at risk. The tour was finished with a gorgeous Braai lunch (included!) - definitely worth spending half a day while in Cape Town.

Fantastic time. Husband and I went on this tour while honeymooning in South Africa. What an amazing experience! Our tour guide, Gladstone or "Bhekisisa" as is his birth name was such a great guy! He definitely knows the township as he grew up there and everyone also know him (super popular)! I would definitely recommend him and this operator for this township visit. He picked us up from our hotel and told us we were the only ones for the day. When we got to the township he assured us we could ask him anything and to not be shy about any questions we have which was really nice of him. Overall such a great experience in the township and with Gladstone as our guide!

Must-do Cape Town experience. Our awesome guide Thando took us for a walking tour of the Langa township. It was very informative and exposed us to an aspect of South African life we knew existed but never encountered first-hand. I think a South African experience can't be complete without this tour, exposing us to the way people lead their lives.Thando showed us many places in Langa, took us into a few homes and explained everything with much grace. I highly recommend to anyone contemplating such an experience to go ahead and book immediately, don't leave Cape Town without taking this tour.

An incredible experience!. My friend and I did the cycling tour with Thando. We loved every minute of it! He was a great guide and taught us a lot about life in the township and the history of South Africa. It was amazing to have the opportunity to go into people's homes including Thando's. Truly an incredible experience and a great company!

Amazing tour of Langa Township. My kids, ages 15 and 12, and I did the bicycle tour with Thando. It was a great experience for us. Our guide Thando was funny and kind. He took us into peoples homes including his own to give us the full experience of what life in a township is about. My children enjoyed learning about the history of South Africa, although it made them sad to see that people were treated differently because of the color of their skin. They became immediate fan's of Nelson Mandela after visiting Robben Island and the township, knowing he brought about such great change in this beautiful country. It was very humbling and eye opening for all 3 of us. This was one our favorite experiences in SA and it even began pouring rain while we were riding our bikes in the townshipIf you are visiting South Africa for the first time, you need to experience a township and learn first hand about its history.

The unforgettable visit to friends. Thank you so much for this afternoon spend in Langa!!! We felt like people visiting friends and it was so interesting. We know now more about Xhosa people.... we have a lot to learn from them so the world could may be a bit better. We'll keep the people from our township in our heart and in our memory. Our girls (10 and 12 years old) enjoyed so much playing with the kids from "happy feet". A special hug to your little aid "Mr Michael Jackson" !!!!! Thank thank thank you so much for this life lessonMarc & Valérie & the girls

A great experience.. Siviwe was our wonderful guide while visiting Langa township. I was hesitant to tour a township (fearing it would feel voyeuristic or intrusive) but I am so glad we did it. Instead we found the tour informative and inspirational. I can't express enough how impressed we are with Siviwe. The tour felt like hanging out with a friend. He is so passionate and proud of Langa and we enjoyed hearing about all the great things happening in the community. He is a person that makes a difference in the world. Thanks Siviwe for a touching experience.

a definite must, most interesting!. You should support these local entrepreneurs and venture into Langa and see the reality: Langa is most probably the safest Township in Cape Town and the tour in done by bicycle which allows you to stop-and-go at your own pace. There are many town-ship tours similar in Cape Town, but the professionalism and honesty of Siviwe and his companions have deeply impressed me.

Beyond Expectations. I must 1st start by giving Siviwe ***** 4 being extremely knowledgeable and being so patient. We were fetched 4rm The Ambassador Self Catering Apartments right on time. Being a Kzn South Africa I never knew that there was so much history and Xhosa rituals. We had so much to share and we had lovely meat at Mzoli's.

Langa Township. Vamos took us into Langa Township. It was an interesting and eye-opening tour led by our excellent guide Gladstone who lives in Langa himself. We visited all areas of the township from the corrugated iron shacks to the affluent houses of 'Beverly Hills'. Langa seems to be making real progress. We saw shops made from shipping containers and sheep's heads being cooked for a specialty tribal dish. There was an opportunity to buy Langa made pottery which illustrated the creativity of the South African people. Most interesting was Langa museum which opened our eyes to the terrible regime of Apartheid. The finale was a visit to see the 'Happy Feet' children perform which was a fun end to the visit. At all times I felt safe and there was a real sense of community so lacking in the UK.
Educational and genuine. Really impressed by the township tour in Langa. Would definitely go back and recommend for any age group. Fantastic community spirit! Thank you.

Fantastic experience. Our 2 hour walking tour of Langa was a great experience. Thando, our Guide was brilliant and very informative. It was a brilliant education for my 3 children. I would highly recommend Vamos.

Gladstone Top Guide. On a Friday afternoon we visited Langa with our guide GladstoneIt was a true eye opener and a highlight in our visit to Cape TownGladstone was brought up in the Township and still lives there and we visited his former home as part of the tour.Nothing was omitted, we saw the future in new homes being built, a museum showing the iniquities of the apartheid era, a ceramics operation to encourage new business, and many other aspects of how his people live.He answered all our questions clearly and to the pointCape Town is a wonderful city but their are many aspects to consider.

Thank you for this experience!. Today I have been cycling Langa with Nathi as guide and I am very much impressed by the insights he gave me into his culture. Being German I did not know that much about townships and Nathi told me everything I needed and wanted to know. I can highly recommend this very special tour at the other side of Table Mountain. We were just the two of us and I felt absolutely safe – Nathi seemed to know everyone.

Gladstone was a fantastic guide. This trip was an amazing experience, one of the highlights of our 2 weeks in Cape Town. Gladstone was such a good guide and if you are reading this, sorry we made you late for your next tour!

Gladstone was super as guide. a tour that you must do if you visit Cape Town..they pick you up at the hotel and that is very easy..Langa is a confrontation with our way of living in Europe..we went on a friday afternoon and that is a perfect moment..school is finished and there is a weekend vibe ..a lot of animation on the streets..the guide was also very nice and we visit also his house..

Please take this visit !. At first we were apprehensive but were met with genuine kindness affection and patience from our hosts the people of Langa, and our guide Siviwe. Firstly, Siviwe, who grow up in Langa, is inspirational, informative and clearly loved by his friends in the township and even more so by the children who walk with him having heard his voice from a distance. He has a lovely way with the kids as seen in his involvement with "his Baby", the Happy Feet Youth Project.This is not a sanitised nor a staged 'hollywood' version of reality. It is reality ! This is the story of the history and evolution of the township and its progress, and its difficulties in the modern world. The highlight for us was the happy exuberance of the children and we're left with a desire to come back. I strongly urge people to arrange to go on this visit, and to try to understand and get to know about the townships and their people, and by doing so, to promote the people in their desire to help themselves in their further development.The back office communications and timings were all spot on too !Recommend; 'trainers' and an open mind. Four hour visit.Iain and Julie

Værdigt og seværdigt!. Was on A 2 hour bicycle trip around the Langa township. Our trip was guided by Thando, who was very knowing and very decided about his Way of dealing with visitors in Langa. It was with dignity and A smile that he showed us around. I Can only recommend!

Excellent tour. After serious doubts before booking whether to do a guided Township Tour or not, my family and me ended up more than happy having visited the Townships with our guide Siviwe. He was very motivated and answered all our questions patiently and a wide knowledge. We learned that the townships definitely form an important part of African culture and society and that these neighborhoods consist in far more than simply life in poverty. People were very friendly and showed us around also with a strong pride of their well established community. We did not feel uncomfortable a single moment and returned with some new experiences we had not expected in this form. Thank you for all that!

Vamos Township Tour. We took our 4 children (19, 16, 13 and 10) on this tour and would definitely recommend it. Our guide Gerry was friendly, informative and gave us a great insight in to life in Langa. Loved the education centre and bought some great sand art which will always remind us of our great trip.

A different look at life. This type of tour is a must if visiting South Africa. At first it was a culture shock. Such a busy and bustling community. Felt safe and confident in our guide who was friendly, talkative and seemed to know everybody. Recommended.

A must do. Have wanted to do this every time we've been in Cape Town but were worried about feeling like voyeurs. How wrong we were. We are so very pleased we went and especially glad we did the cycle tour as meant we could go further and see more. We were lucky to have the undivided attention of Thando who was an excellent and enthusiastic guide who lives in the township himself so can give you first hand and highly informative answers to the many questions you will want answered as you move around the various areas.We spoke to many residents and feel we now have some small idea of the life the people lead, the challenges they face and the progress being made towards a better life. We were both impressed and humbled by what we saw and heard. All we met were friendly and keen to share their stories.Thank you Thando (and sorry its taken us so long to write this review)

Interesting Cycling Tour. We went on a 2 hour cycling tour of Langa Townships, with Thando as our guide. The company asked us ahead of time about bike sizing, so that they would be ready. However, the bikes were in not very good shape, and it took a while to get all 3 of us ready to go. There were no helmets, and no offer of water for the ride. The tour was interesting, and we got to see some of each area - poor, middle class, and upper class. It could have been every more engaging to meet some of the street vendors and see more of the area. The trip was barely 2 hours, and at least a quarter of it was looking at art displays in the galleries, something which could have been done after. Lots of potential with this tour, but a bit disappointing since it cost almost $100.00

Excellent Day with Gladstone. We had a wonderful time visiting the townships near Cape Town. Our tour guide Gladstone was fantastic, walking us around his home and sharing with us what life in a township is like. We really loved having the chance to interact with the people and see first hand the challenges they face and learning from them directly. We also got to the chance to enjoy an amazing meal at a local BBQ restaurant, the perfect end to a great tour. We would absolutely highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to get a behind the scenes look at life for many South Africans in the townships.

Very good!. My friend and I did a 2 hour cycling tour of the Langa township. Our guide as excellent and we cycled through the township stopping at a various sites, visiting local businesses and houses. It was interest and our local guide was very knowledgable. The only thing I would say is it felt rushed at times particularly when getting the bikes at the start. I ended up with a very large bike which is struggled to get on and most of the tour had left before I was even on the bike which took some time. So there were times when I was left behind by a rather significant distance. More time to select the right bike and helmets would be beneficial. Other than that it was excellent. Thank you

We loved our family day with Siviwe and friends!. Siviwe cheerfully picked us up from the hotel in a great new vehicle and we had fun learning Xhosa language's clicks and noises while we drove. When we started walking in Langa, we got the desired up close and personal look at the neighborhood including an amazing sit-down with the locals in the local beer hut ritual. Although the more famous eatery for lunch was closed, we improvised with another local and a great brai. The kids enjoyed meeting Siviwe's young friends and Maleebo accompanied us throughout the day. We were also fortunate enough to witness the return from the wilderness of the boys becoming men. Overall, a great experience for all ages. You owe it to yourself to see all sides of South Africa.

Disappointing. I came to CapeTown 2 years ago and did a township tour with another company and it was a very good experience.As I didn't remember which company I booked last time, I decided to go with Vamos due to its very good reviews.For both of us it was a big disappointment.We first went to the arts & craft center, which is not my favourite thing to do but it is OK for me (this is just a question of taste).Then I was hopping to do a walking tour with the guide with insightful informations on the life here, and how it is changing.Instead we went to the Langa Museum where another guide explained us a part of the history.Now, I want to be clear: this was interesting, and the museum as well, but this is not what I expect from a township tour: basically we started the day with this stop (after the art center) and it was nearly the only historical information that was given to us, ans it was in the form of a big speech and a museum.After that, we started walking in the Langa township and we didn't feel so good about the experience: without any historical information or insights, it really felt like we were taken there to "look" at people and their lives and we were not given the chance to understand the situations.There is also a moment where Gladstone (our guide) showed us the inside of a room from a shared building and we didn't feel in our place, I felt that we were disturbing the people who lived there (which I understand) and I would prefer not to do this kind of things.Also we were walking in the township and nearly not given any informations while hanging around. We also met quite often some other township tours in the same places which felt a bit weird (it never happened when I did a tour 2 years ago).We then met Gladstone's family which was interesting and gave us the opportunity to see new homes.The final part of this trip was supposed to be a lunch in Mzolis which is a Braai in the Langa township. Now I booked this tour because I was really expecting to have this lunch in the township and get the chance to meet people.When we arrived, the restaurant was closed and all our guide said was: "sorry it is closed, I couldn't know". and then we drove in the township and came back home. This is very disappointing and unprofessional, especially as the lunch was included: we were not offered any other solutions like to eat in another place, and in the end any kind of refund. I think it is quite an expensive activity and you would have expected the guide to have a second solution in case this happens.So in the end we felt like this half day was exactly what we didn't want in a township tour: be like tourists who are just there for seeing a township and not getting the chance to understand the history or the situation, combined with the lunch cancelled because of a bad organization, we felt very disappointed, especially my girlfriend who never had the opportunity to do a township tour and was very looking forward to it and finished very disappointed.

Moving Enlightning and Insightful .... are all emotions that come to the fore after a Vamos township tour to Langa. From the moment we met Siviwe he touched emotions within all the family (ages 7 and 10) and was a great tour guide. We took a half day private tour. Half of the 3 - 4 hour trip is taken on foot as Siviwe took us through the township showing and talking us through his insight and knowledge of past and present life / classes and Govt re-housing programme in the largest CT township. He also adapted the tour for the kids and taught them the local dialect and 'clicking', which they continued to practice through the rest of the holiday! We felt safe with Siviwe who was well known and knowledgeable of a community where life is changing and in time improving for many but still there is inequality and socio-economic issues both within and outside the township but hope and respect are key elements of township life and for the residents. The highlight of the tour was 'Happy Feet' a project founded and partly funded by Vamos for under-privilege children who have a safe haven to be fed, clothed and participate in a dance programme, which they then performed a dance and drum show for us. At the end my 7 year old son (AJ) who does street-dance showed them some of his "moves" which the children tried to copy and a uniquely interesting bond was formed. When asked what my kids highlight of the 2 week holiday in SA was the top 2 is safari and "Happy Feet". Thank you Siviwe you have truly touched us and I recommend no one leaves CT without doing a Vamos township tour ...

Excellent and comprehensive!. Our guide, Jerry, led us through the township of Langa. He was born there and lives there. Our tour, which led is around many parts of the area, included the visit of a cultural center, where arts were on display and for sale, we visited people's homes, got to drink the local beer (out of a bucket) and were treated to homemade food prepared by a local good wife. The highlight for me, however, was participating in a gospel held at one of the numerous congregations. The energy was incredible! Jerry was extremely knowledgeable, polite and generally a very pleasant guide who certainly was key to making this a unique experience! Strong recommend!

Exceptional . We delayed leaving Cape Town in order to do a township tour with Vamos and we are so glad that we did. Our guide Gladstone brought us to Langa where he grew up. We had a true insight into life in the township and could see first hand how it has changed over the years.Gladstone was an excellent guide and there were plenty of photo opportunities.we never felt unsafe and everyone we met was friendly especially the children of Langa who gave us all high fives. It is incredibly humbling and a once in a life time experience to be welcomed into the homes of the people who live here. Gladstone also showed us the house that he grew up and taught us some words in Xhosa. The only disappointment was that we were supposed to have lunch on Mzolis which we were really looking forward to but it was closed as it had been open the previous day on New Years Day. I suppose well just have to come back!! :) definitely take this tour - thank you Gladstone.

Inspirational and interesting. We booked this trip many weeks in advance and had to postpone due to one of the children being ill. Garth and Siviwie were very understanding and managed to squeeze us in on a different day - thank goodness they did. Siviwie's is a true force of nature - passionate about life in the township, articulate and knowledgeable (although he "only speaks 7 languages + Spanish!). We gained a good insight into the township's lifestyle, classes and aspirations. Some of the money raised by the tours is pumped back into the community - we saw this in action at the awe inspiring "happy feet". Our kids gained a dose of perspective and appreciate that there is more to CT than the Waterfront.

So pleased we did this. When booking an trip to Cape Town, I have to admit a township tour wasn't on our list of things to do. But a friend said we had to...and now we have, we'd wholeheartedly agree. Our guide Nathi was from the township, knew everyone and everything, and it felt inclusive and interesting. We did a two hour bicycle tour, saw lots of redevelopment, met people and spoke to them about their lives. It gave us a better understanding of the city and we feel so much aware of where we are now. It didn't feel like "us and them" at all. Just do it.

A tour we will never forget. "Respect" said one of our fellow participants when he came into the house that Gladstone, our tour guide, showed us. Respect for all the people who live in the township and make their living here, go to school and maybe go to university. Respect for keeping the great spirit that we could feel exists in Langa.This tour was an impressive experience and showed us 'the other real South Africa'. With Gladstone as a guide (who also lives in Langa towhnship), we could get an impression of what life in the different areas of a township look like and what living is like here. Not beautiful, but reality, and in my eyes a must for everyone who visits South Africa. On our non-bike tour we visited several houses/huts, walked around (never felt unsafe) and in the end got lunch at M'zolis. This definitely was one of the most memorable experiences in South Africa for me.

Great and intensive Tour. Deep Impressions from a Part of (real)South African Life. It is not everytime easy to handle all the Things what you will See, but i will never forget this Tour! Thank you so much Mr.Thando for Showing us a Part of your Life. L.O.V.E

Humbling and uplifting . Siviwe was our guide, we took the half day tour which took us into Langa Township. Honestly, we were worrying slightly about what we were going to see. However, from the beginning Siviwe put us at ease with his friendly personable style and and sense of humour. Picked up from the Waterfront, we went straight to Langa, first port of call was to a shop where they were making pottery, all part of what the people are doing to bring skills and trades into their community. TIP: if your going to buy local items as presents, it's probably worth waiting till you get here.. It pretty much wiped out our 'presents list' Walking through the township was an experience in itself, people going around their normal lives, living in such Close quarters, and their conditions, which are so different to ours (European perspective) but it was clean, and they take a real pride in their communities. There are plenty of photo opportunities. We were shown where Siviwe grew up and how he lived, which was a fascinating insight to who he was, and his background. He had, with imagination and determination started the business... Just shows what can be achieved. Finally came to eat (a restaurant in which Jamie Oliver has been to) and the food was lovely, mostly meat and mash and spicy sauce at Mzoli's - really tasty meats from the Braai, giving you an opportunity to sit down and talk to your fellow travellers and tour guide. A humbling and worthwhile tour, showing the real progress and pride these people have and determination to make their lives better and a great insight into their world. Highly recommend it. Simon and Steve United Kingdom
Great tour!. Thanks for this interesting insite in Langa. And thanks Thando as a tourguide, you are the best!Cheers Daniel Amsterdam

Something you really must do. If you are visiting Cape Town you really must make time to see one of the townships. We chose to do a cycle tour through Langa and our tour guide was the lovely Thando. We started off at the visitor centre where we saw pottery being made and other crafts and then headed out on our bikes for a look round the different areas of the township. It was interesting to see that there are areas just like any other town where there is obviously good incomes and people still choose to live in the township. When we entered the poorer areas though and saw how so many people were living it was quite a shock to the system.
