Great way to start a visit to Cape Town. We loved this walking tour with Ursula and thought it was a great way of getting to grips with the city centre. I'm glad we did it early on in our visit. Especially impressive was that she conducted the tour in both English and German simultaneously. Ursula clearly loves Cape Town and knew a great deal about the past and present of all the places we visited, imparting lot of interesting information. I particularly enjoyed the foray into the Bo Kaap which I wasn't sure about visiting alone, but the whole tour was excellent.

Cape Town walk. The pleasure of Ursula Stevens' walk through central Cape Town is as much in her views of the place she's lived in for forty years or so as in what one sees. Her attitude to the city is one of deep affection and her enthusiasm for the place shines through. You'll get some history, of course, but also a sense of what this city is like to live in now, today, and she steers clear of the obvious political dilemmas with which in South Africa are so prevalent. It's the tolerance of the different cultures one for the others which is pointed out, a much more human approach than that of the conflicts which are so often the stuff of South African discussion. As for the walk, well, you get an apercu into Cape Town which gives you plenty of scope to make your own more detailed visits later, and you're left with a basic and clear view of what makes up the city and a strong desire to look at it more closely and in greater detail. We have been doing just this in the days since taking the tour, which hugely enhanced the pleasure of city wandering.

Wolfgang is awesome!. Wolfgang was our tour guide and he made this tour an absolutely amazing experience! He was charming, beautifully mannered and extremely knowledgeable about Cape Town. He made the history come alive and entertained us non stop, well beyond the 2.5hour time limit due to the fact that we had so many questions. Just can't thank Wolfgang enough for such an amazing tour. Do this - a morning well spent and very reasonable for what you get!

Excellent overview of Cape Town from an insider. A must do for everyone visiting Cape Town and need an orientation. The tour covers most sights of the city center and Bo-Kaap with just the right amount of information. Ursula - our guide is fluent in several languages and a true fan of the city. Do not miss out!

Informative intro to Cape Town. If you've ever wished you could walk around a new city with someone who's lived there for decades, hearing all about the neighborhoods and history, this tour is for you. Definitely recommended, particularly as an intro if this is your first visit to Cape Town. Ursula is a font of knowledge, and is friendly and easy to understand as well. If it's summer, you may want a hat or sunscreen -- you'll spend plenty of time in the sun.If you don't enjoy history this may not be the tour for you. But if you do, sign up!

A wonderful experience-A must in Cape Town. The 2.5 hour tour of Cape Town was exactly what we needed to get a feel of the city. Ursula was amazing and at the conclusion I felt like I would have liked the tour to go on for another 2.5 hours. The price was reasonable and although we walked a lot, the level of difficulty in terms of the walk was just right.

Exceeded Our Expectations. My husband is not normally a fan of guided tours, but we both thoroughly enjoyed the few hours spent in Ursula's company. She was a cutie !. Thanks to Ursula we had very nice Tour through Cape Town ! Different people in one tour through all the history which offers CT. Ursula is a gem - wonderful walk round the city centre with an enthusiastic historian. This trip exceeded our already high expectations. Cape Town on foot. Ursula gave us a very interesting, enjoyable and informative tour of Capetown. It was the first day of our visit and she provided valuable background for us. Ursula exceeded our expectations and we'd highly recommend her.

Cape Town on Foot. We came on Ursula Stevens by chance from a flyer found at Kirstenbosch gardens the day before.My wife was fascinated by the Bo-Kaap, however I was a little unity unsure about the security there and suggested this walking tour.It more than exceeded our expectations and showed us areas of the city we would never have seen on our own.Every question was answered and we came away feeling we had really seen the city.Ian & Debbie Roberts, Sugar Land TX USA

A Brief History of Cape Town. We chose to do this as an introduction to Cape Town as we had never visited before & had very limited time. Even after many trips to Cape Town, I learnt many new things. I was the only person on the tour, but Ursula didn't seem to mind. We walked around many parts of Cape Town that I didn't know. We walked past sights and museums that I consequently revisitedThanks Ursula for a thoroughly enjoyable and informative morning

Highly recommend this tour. This was my third visit to Cape Town, but the first time I really learned about the rich and diverse history of this city. Everyone should go!!!. This tour is definitely not one to be missed! Ursula is the most wonderful tour guide with a wealth of information. Her knowledge of the city, mixed with her own personal memories and great sense of humor, make for an experience that you'll never forget! Worth every scent!

Great walk with Wolfang- I really recommend it!. I chose this guided tour because you don't have to book in advance: you just turn up at 11 at the information point in Burg Street, which is very convenient. Wolfgang was an excellent guide, one of the best I have ever had. He has a wide knowledge of Cape Town and knows how to transmit it in a very entertaining way. What a great experience!. Graham PUrsula was our guide. Small group which was great. Memorable. Ursula had a fantastic range of information and brought every part of the walk alive with great facts and insights. Gentle pace but covered a lot of the city. A different view of Cape Town. In January my husband and I paid our second visit to South Africa and Cape Town. We decided to try a few different experiences. Perfect introduction to Cape Town. We took the tour with Ursula's colleague Wolfgang. He was a mine of information bringing the history of the city to life with so many interesting facts and details. I wish every city in the world had guide like Ursula.. We have visited Cape Town many times and this was the first time we decided to take a tour. What a plesant surprise! Ursula's made this a very memorable day. What a great introduction to Cape Town. Don't miss this tour. Tom and Inge

An excellent way to see the sights!. We went on a tour with Ursula today and it couldn't have been better. Great walking tour with lots of historical info.. Had a great time on this walking tour! Wolfgang (pretty sure that was his name?) was a fantastic guide, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Cape Town.

Fantastic way to really discover Cape Town. Cape Town step by step. Ursula Stevens' walking tour of Cape Town is not to be missed. Her knowledgeable and humorous take on the city she loves takes the better part of three hours but is worth every minute. While her mother was born in Namibia, Ursula was born in Germany - yet she regards herself not as German but as South African. And that shows. Walk with Ursula and you see Cape Town not through foreign eyes but through the eyes of a native. Architecture is among her passions, particularly anything art deco. Though Ursula is no spring chicken, she has the energy of a much younger person. Walk with her. You won't regret it.

A really fine introduction to Cape Town. On our first day in Cape Town, we decided to take the 11 AM walking tour starting at the downtown tourist office. We're so glad we did.Ursula is so very knowledgeable. What's also fascinating is that as an older (but very energetic!) person, she adds so many personal insights into the changes that she's seen in the physical and cultural make up of the city over past decades. She may also share some of her family history, going back to her grandparents arrival in the region a century ago.All along the walk, Ursula stops briefly to say hello to so many different people--she's someone who not only loves the history of the city, but who also loves the ethnic diversity of its people and cultures and who talks of them all with such a sense of respect.You're not just taking a tour with Ursula; you're getting to see the city and its people through her eyes.

Cape Town Walking Tour and so much more. Having arrived in Cape Town only the night before, I headed straight into town for Ursula's amazing walking tour. I knew very little of Cape Town, but after 2 1/2 hours under Ursula's wing, it seemed like a treasure chest had been opened. Her knowledge of history, both local and big-picture history, seems endless and I felt truly prepared to venture out on my own after Ursula's introduction to this beautiful town. Thank you, Ursula!Ilke Brueckner-Klein, Brisbane & Melbourne, Australia

Best way to see the city. Would highly recommend using Wanderlust to do a walking tour of central Cape Town. Cape Town On Foot - Highly recommended introduction to the history of Cape Town and its inhabitants. wonderful 'wanderlust'... authentic experience!. Alternative Perspective on Cape Town. Great way to get a behind the scenes look at Cape Town whether or not as a first time visitor or as a previous visitor. Best introduction to Cape Town. Having just arrived in Cape Town the day before going on this tour, I can't imagine a better foreword to my extended stay in the city. Unlocking the Mystery of Cape Town. When I came to Cape Town for a summer internship, I had a little knowledge of the city. Perfect way to learn about cape town. My friend and I turned up to the tourism centre wanting to book a walking tour for the afternoon. We had just missed the morning tours and were flying out the following day so we could only go for an afternoon tour. Ursula was extremely accommodating - she let us choose the time to meet and because there was just the 2 of us - it was a private tour for no exta cost. Ursula is extremely knowledgeable and runs the tour to suit the group. She quickly realised that we dont like walking slow :).BUT what i really liked about Ursula, is that shes passionate about what she does and talking about Cape Town. This is one of the best city walking tours i've done and its a must do in Cape Town.

Amazing and intimate tour. I did this tour with 4 other students (I am a student as well) and I have to say our tour guide, Ursula, was AMAZING!! She gave such a a great tour of the city and helped us discover all the secret and overlooked details of the city centre. Ursula was very friendly and open to discuss all the different things that make Cape Town so wonderfully diverse and complex. She also knew how to share the history of the city without making it feel like a history lesson. And she was very knowledgable about the city because she has lived through much of it too. If you are looking for a good tour, this is definitely the one to use!

A great look at Cape Town. When my original plans for a free day in Cape Town were cancelled, I stopped in at the tourist center and found the walking tour. I'm so glad I did! In spite of the fact it was a public holiday and most buildings were closed (and the city was quiet), the three of us on the tour had a lovely time. Ursula is knowledgeable and shares information in an interesting way. Worth the two hours -- bring your walking shoes!

An intimate encounter with Cape Town. The best way to get to know a city is on its streets and among its shops and houses. Ursula knows this city from long firsthand experience, and she both loves and enjoys it. You will, too. (And you might also un-learn some old fables that you thought were true, but aren't!)

Discover Cape Town with an insider. Walking tour through the city is amazing! Ursula has a wide knowledge of history, architecture, anecdotes and todays life. Great mix of walking, getting information in an entertaining way and really discover the city centre of Cape Town

An amazing tour on foot with the author Ursula Stevens. We (2 couples) enjoyed tremendously to be guided in a small group to the hotspots of Cape Town, although we had experienced it before on our own. What we heard gave us a deeper insight into this fascinating city concerning history, architecture, religions, exciting tales and adventures. Most insightful tour of the history of Cape Town. Ursula does a fantastic job of bringing the history of Cape Town to life. She must be the most knowledgeable walking tour guide in Cape Town. I would highly recommend for anyone visiting Cape Town to walk with Ursula to get an up close and personal view of the mother city.

Fantastic Cape Peninsula trip. We booked this trip as part of a short stay in Cape Town. It was excellent and we have to support all the other great reviews posted here. An excellent and informative guide that gave us a lot of information of the history of sites as well as the South African history. After being traveling here for 10 years; I learned more this day than the previous 10 years of the S-A culture and history.If you ever need (and you might think you don´t) an excellent day of Cape Town - call them!We watched the seals from the boat at Hout Bay, we visited the Cape Point, we saw the penguins at Boulders beach and we finished off with wine tasting in Constantia...

Awesome trip in SA. Thank you so much African Blue tours and congratulations to David, Valentine , Duncan and Matthew !A few day trips with this team made me addict to SA.With Matthew we spent a fabulous day exploring the West Coast National Park and the Cape Peninsula. Thanks to him we discovered the beautiful landscapes of SA.And then with Duncan who was so patient, caring, passionate , we discovered the Tsitsikamma region, had a fun day kayaking , walking on the suspension bridge at Storms River Mouth and then on the garden route where he showed us such a beautiful route.And at last but not least thanks to David and Valentine for their impecable organization of our stay in SA !

family holiday. We can't rate African Blue Tours highly enough!!! David, the owner of the company, was our extremely knowledgable, amiable and passionate tour guide. He took our family of 5 on two private day trips, Cape Peninsula and District Six/Langa Township.He managed to combine his vast knowledge of the area as a local with an easy ambience and attention to detail making our tours tailored to our wishes and seamless in management. But we had fun too!! And learnt so much. The Cape Tour was fabulous, with personal touches such as providing cold water bottles, showing us where he surfed as a teenager, taking us to the non-tourist side of boulders beach, reserving us a great view lunch table at Cape Point restaurant, giving us a choice of wine estates, even keeping us calm as a wayward baboon came to check us for food whilst watching the ostriches!! All the while giving us snippets of local info, historical references and current political news. The tour to District Six and Langa though was something else. He introduced us to a whole subject matter that we had very limited knowledge of previously, and it opened our eyes to the huge traumatic politics of apartheid in this area of SA.David took us to the museum which was fascinating, and then a car tour of the area including the now very desolate district six and showed us with very precise knowledge where the old tracks and houses were, where the remaining churches and mosques fitted in.David has a very good friend and working colleague, Odwa, a wonderful and clever 26yr old man who was brought up in Langa Township, and still lives there. Odwa took us on a walking tour of the township, he reassured us of our safety and of our being very welcome, and that the local people would be very pleased to open up their homes and show us how they live. It blew our minds away seeing all the housing/shelters and what the township means to the people who dwell there. We visited the orphanage and saw the children's beautiful and fabulous welcoming dance. It was truly humbling. Matthew was our guide, a really friendly knowledgeable guy who was clearly very experienced and knew how best to avoid the crowds on the busiest day of the year. We then followed this up with a day trip to one of the safari reserves, which David transferred us to and from himself - an unforgettable experience and a great introduction for anyone wondering if they would like a safari or not... this will definitely make your mind up for you. It was great to chat to David on the drive there and back and find out lots about the culture and history of the region and the future of tourism in the region. Finally, David arranged a shark dive experience for us which was something I will never forget. This is arranged through an external company that David deals with, but the day was perfect. All three experiences were magical and I couldn't recommend David and his team enough. Even if you are not sure what you would like to do in Cape Town (or other parts of the country) i'd recommend getting in touch. David clearly knows both the country and the tourism industry inside out and i'd trust him to plan the vacation for you.

Cape Peninsula Tour. The Cape Peninsula tour was scenic, picturesque and simply beautiful. We were a small of group of five, and set off in a comfortable passenger van with AC. Stops included Hout Bay (for seal watching), Chapman's Peak, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Boulder'S Beach (for penguin watching). We had a superb time with our guide/driver, Duncan, who is by far the friendliest guides I have met in all my travels so far. I would recommend this tour to anyone who has a day to spend taking in the breathtaking vistas of the Cape Peninsula. Right from booking to execution of our tour, we were pleased with the service offered by African Blue.

Arranged Sanbona Wildlife Reserve. I found African Blue Tours on the internet while searching for safaris out of Cape Town. David Smith recommended Sanbona Wildlife Reserve, which we enjoy very much. He took us there in person and arranged to have us picked up and take on a short tour of the area south of Table Mountain. I cannot recommend him too highly for personal service and advice.

A great partner to any South African holiday. Being limited to ten days' vacation, we had a short time to visit as much as possible in South Africa. We consulted a number of TripAdvisor's recommended guides to gather information and benchmark prices. African Blue stood out for two reasons: first, because of the affable David Smith, whose email responses to our initial queries were prompt and helpful; and second, because the company is able to offer airport pickups and tours in both Joburg and Cape Town (enabling us to cover all of our needs with one provider).Having booked African Blue, we were assigned Duncan as our guide. Duncan was extremely knowledgeable, a safe driver, and an energetic guide. He was flexible in his plans and great with our young kids. He was a great representative of the company and I am pleased to recommend him.

Perfect Tour of the Cape. We travelled with Cheryse in December whilst in Cape Town. We were collected from our Hotel on time and we collected a few more guests on the way. We headed off to the Cape Point and missed all the other tourist traffic due to our knowledgeable hostess. The tour was very comprehensive and fun and we saw lots of wildlife and got some great photos. We had a lovely lunch overlooking the bay. We were a small group and had the choice of direction/ending of the tour. The days was long enough and felt we had covered a lot of ground without being too rushed. Cheryse gave us a lot of background information on South Africa and its people, flora and fauna. She was very proud of her country and rightly so. It's beautiful.

Cape Peninsula and Constantia Wine Tour. Our time in Cape Town was limited so we booked a tour with African Blue so that we could make the most of our time. The service was very good and our guide was very informational. As we were there in the middle of summer, he planned the tour such that we would minimize the wait time. We visited the cape, stopping for pictures along the way, and then visited the penguins as well as a couple of wineries. Lunch and wine tastings were great.Since we are a family of five and wanted to have control of what we did and the pace, we booked the private tour. I highly recommend it. We were able to spend longer where we wanted to, while still being able to see our top attractions.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We used Africa Blue Day Tours in our recent trip to Cape Town. We were booked on a cruise that included a 3 day pre-cruise tour. However this pre cruise tour did not give us the opportunity to visit the beautiful Cape Peninsula. I contacted Blue Day Tours ( David) to book a day tour to the Cape. . David was extremely helpful in helping us plan our time to include the sites of Cape Town that our pre-cruise tour did not include.Duncan our guide arrived punctually at our hotel and a group of 6 of us boarded one of the best tour vans I have been in. There was enough space for all our luggage and lots of leg room for all of us. It was clean and water was provided. Duncan was very knowledgeable, pleasant and handled our itinerary well. He got us to the main sites just before many of the large buses and even pointed out to us a better viewing platform to view the penguins. At the end of the day he took us and our luggage to our ship. As our boat was docked in port for the night the following day with detailed instructions from David we walked, bought our tickets and boarded our ferry to visit Robben Island. Thank you David and Duncan, your tour and help allowed us to maximize our time in Cape Town. I would recommend and suggest to any one who may be on one of the cruise pre-cruise tours to contact Africa Blue. Our experience was first rate.

Great Tour Guide. My recent trip to Cape Town was wonderful and Mathew our tour guide was very helpful in making our experience pleasant. He took us to all the places we wanted to see and even went out his way to show us some other places that he thought we would be interested in just by talking and listening to our personal interest. Thanks African Blue!

Table Mountain w/ Highlights of Cape Town (city tour + table mountain). This is the tour to see the jaw dropping landscapes of Cape Town!! Matt was our guide, and he went above and beyond to make the tour a smashing success. When there were technical issues with the Table Mountain cable car, Matt adopted the tour and took us to other highlights, then brought us back for the stunning sunset atop Table Mountain once the cable car was fixed. If you do just one tour, do this one as it gives you a taste of what the city has to offer in one day.

Cape Peninsula Tour. Really good day tour, plenty of good view points for those crucial photos to be taken. The tour guide Matthew was brillant, adding some useful information and able to answer questions. Highlights were Cape Point and Cape of good hope.

Great Cape Point tour with sociable, knowledgeable guide Matthew. We had a wonderful day driving from Cape Town to Cape Point with our guide Matthew Bloomberg. He really added to the whole tour with his knowledge of the places we went, the history, and even gave us tips on a few of his hidden local gems you won't find in any of the guide books/sites (like going to Llandudno beach instead of some of the other tourist traps). He picked us up at 930a (we're late risers) and we headed down. He was willing to stop along the way for us to take pictures and knew when to push us along when we were spending too much time in one place. We need that some times.Warning - if traveling to Cape Town in general, but specifically Cape Point during the summer seasons, it WILL be windy. We're from the U.S. so we think Chicago is "the windy city" but Cape Town brings it to a whole new level. My wife and I agree we've never in our lives experienced anything like it. So be prepared, and don't wear lose fitting sunglasses or hats because they'll be gone before you know it. We stopped at the old and new lighthouses at Cape of Good Hope (previously "Cape of Storms" which is more accurate given the wind) and be sure to walk up the hill instead of the cable car because there are additional spots along the way to take pictures you won't get via the cable car. And exercise never hurt anybody :)We saw a fire along the way which have been happening at higher rates because of the drought so our drive went on a bit of a detour but we were fine with it. We stopped to visit the penguins (one of the windiest spots so wear long sleeves even if it's hot if you want to avoid getting pelted by the sand). The R65 per Adult admission was a bit high for a few minutes of looking at penguins, you basically pay that much to get good close up pictures. And on the way back, stopping at Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens is an absolute must! We could've spent all day there. Amazing foliage and views of the mountainside one way, and the city and beaches the other. All in all, a wonderful day. Thanks Matthew!

Fine, a few improvements perhaps required. Had an enjoyable trip with Ian around the Cape Peninsula. Highlights were the penguins at Boulders Bay, relaxed lunch at Simon's Town, and Cape Point.Although the trip was enjoyable, there were a few things that could have been improved: the vehicle's suspension was poor and air con unit's generator pumped out warm air, rendering it useless. We opened a window so no big deal, but I'd have preferred air con to wind blowing in my face. Also, instructions to other members of our group were seemingly either unclear or not adhered to, so we ended up having lunch after 3pm. Again no big deal for us but you expect things on such a packed trip to run like clockwork and have lunch earlier than 3pm.A good trip and hopefully the few negatives can be improved for others in future.

Day Cape peninsula tour. Had a fantastic day tour round the cape peninsula with Matt. He was a very knowledgeable guide,not only on the local sights, but gave us tips on all the places to visit up and down the coasts, that foreign tourists aren't aware of. It was well organised and extremely friendly, definitely book with this company.

Superb full day tour of Cape Point. I did this tour at the end of November 2015. It was quite outstanding. The tour guide Duncan was among my best guides, extremely knowledgeable and also managed the day very well. We saw everything including the seal colony, the penguin colony, ate at an outstanding restaurant, saw the magnificent scenery of the Cape Point itself, and ended the day with a full tour of the very beautiful Kirstenbosch Gardens. The vehicle we traveled in was extremely comfortable and high quality. Also very reasonable cost. I highly recommend this tour.

Peninsula Tour. We had a fantastic day out with our guide - Redaa. I think that if he is the standard of Davids guides then ABT will be the tour of choice as he was excellent - the vehicle clean and plenty of water - the choice of restaurant was fantastic and he was so flexible - no set agenda just a damn good guide....We were relaxed at the end of the day and had so many great pictures that a very inquisitive 9 year old took full advantage of the knowledge on display!Thanks also to Hazel at ToEscapeTo for arranging!

A great South African experience. Cape Peninsula Tour 1st Jan 2016. First compliment must to Matt, our tour guide. Very knowledgeable, friendly and extremely interesting. Fantastic trip to Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, penguin colony in Simons Town, stop for lunch at Bertha in Simons Town, overlooking the harbour. Thanks Matt - would definitely recommend this tour and tour guide.

Matthew was brilliant.. I booked the pensinsual tour, visiting Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope and the heart-warming penguins on Boulders Beach. For our guide, Matthew, this is more than a job. He is a tour guide with a passion, who fulfills every guest's wish. He told us the most wonderful and interesting stories about every place we visited. I can really recommend this tour, you won't be disappointed. Penguins!

Amazing Cape Peninsula Tour! . David is super efficient with the tours and is very helpful in answering questions. Our guide Duncan showed us many sights through the cape peninsula and is really accommodating to our family of 6 with two elderly folks!Thanks African Blue team for a wonderful day trip :)

fascinating experience. the whole day cape peninsula tour from African Blue Tours was very good and our guide David was friendly and knowledgeable. the entire sightseeing tour from camps bay to cape point and along the way boat ride to see cape fur seals and then visit to boulders beach to see penguins was incredible to say the least. we enjoyed every bit of the tour including having lunch at 'two ocean restaurant' in cape point. no doubt the restaurant is little expensive but given the option to choose by David, we felt it is worth paying and eating fresh seafood at this place which indeed was good.

Great tours.. Booked two tours with David. Cape Town and Table Mountain, Cape Penisular.Our tour guide was Matt. Nice chap, very knowledgeable. Good vehicle. We were given choices on where to eat and time to enjoy ourselves.Would not hesitate to recommend them.Very punctual. Full of information for our onwards journey.

Fantastic Full Day Cape Peninsula Tour. Excellent tour in every way. David was wonderful in being able to accommodate me when I emailed him to make a last minute booking. He was knowledgeable about a diverse array of subjects and there was a constant narrative throughout the day. I really like how he personalized the tour for the people in the van that day, even making an extra stop when we wanted to see the ostriches up close. It was a day that I will never forget!

Grea privat tour. We booked a privat tour to cape point for the day. I have been there so many times and for me its kind of boring. But WOW! Not with Matt, he knew so much and it was so interessting! He toldus loads of old stories and it was a great day for me. Not again a boring trip to cape point... I would go and bookthe straight away again!!!

Matthew was a star. Booked for two excersions - one to Langa Township. African Blue have a relationship with one of the local residents who took is around on foot. Fascinating and a must when visiting Cape Town. Matthew also took us to District Six and Museum to explain the history.Second day was a trip to the wineries of Frankchuch and Stellenbosch - the most amazing day. Matt was brilliant, chatty, knowledgeable - felt like he was a friend he was very easy to talk to and spend the day with! Thank you Matt for one of our holiday highlights.

Great day out. We booked a full day excursion to the Cape of Good Hope and were picked up on time from our hotel by our guide, Duncan. After skilfully negotiating his way through the Cape Town traffic he then drove us on a fascinating and most enjoyable tour all the way down to Cape Point, stopping along the way to take a boat trip out to see the seals on Seal Island, Simon's Town and the African Penguins on Boulders Beach. Lunch had been booked for us at a great restaurant and after spending some time at the bottom of the world, we were taken to stroll around the beautiful botanical gardens at Kirstenbosch. Duncan's knowledge of the history, politics, geography and nature of the Cape is extensive and we certainly learned a lot about South Africa in general and the Cape area in particular. It was a wonderful day and I would thoroughly recommend African Blue.
Visited Craddle of Mankind and Lesedi. Was picked up by David, your was great he was on time for pickup and helped us through the two sites which were stunning, well worth the money spent.

Who needs GPS when there's Matthew!. To set the scene...our GPS was down and we were lost in Camps Bay, trying to find our guest house. Wonderful Cape Peninsula Tour with Matthew!!. My husband and I reserved this tour online and their communication was on point. Matthew, our tour guide picked us up at 8.30pm just like they mentioned in the email. He made us feel comfortable right from the get go and was very knowledgeable of Cape Town and its history and we learnt a lot about the city!! Matthew also pre-booked our lunch at a very nice restaurant (Bertha's) in Simon's Town. We felt like a friend was showing us around rather than a typical tour guide. I would strongly recommend this tour company and especially Matthew to anyone looking to have a fun and relaxed day as well as learning a lot about Cape Town and Cape Peninsula region. This was truly a highlight of our vacation!!

Private Tour. We were treated to a private peninsula tour with our guide Duncan, he was an amazing guide and very accommodating. The whole day was alot of fun and Duncan provided us with many photo opportunities while also giving us intresting insight on south african history.

Aquila Day Safari and Wine Farms: A Full and Fun Day!. My husband and I spent a very full day with Matthew as our guide. He picked us up at the guest house where we were staying at 7 a.m. and drove us to Aquila. We had a nice breakfast there and then boarded our safari truck with about ten other people. Had a super time and were able to see lions, rhinos, zebras, elephants, springboks up close! Our three hour safari was perfect for us as we did not want to do an overnight or multiple night safari. After lunch at Aquila, Matthew drove us to two wine farms, Warwick and Muratie, each very nice, and very different from each other. We did tastings at both and enjoyed the drive through the Stellenbosch area. Saw several baboons sitting on the guard rail of the road, watching us pass by! Matthew is a very fun guy, a safe driver and incredibly knowledgeable. Throughout the ride he pointed out sites of interest and enlightened us with his knowledge of South Africa, its history, culture and current events. Thank you, Matthew, for a terrific day! And thank you, David, for suggesting we combine the two tours! It was great!

Cape peninsula group tour!. Contacted the company in July, expressing my interest and asking for ideas whilst I was in cape town.-David was prompt with his responses-Informative, with good advice and suggestions.The tour itself was amazing, had Duncan for the day, what a gentle soul. Every photograph has a story because the depth of knowledge he holds, is phenomenal. I was very impressed.Enjoy

Wine tasting tour in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. Took the wine tasting tour the day after the trip to Township. Balanced, knowledgeable and and with reflections we could follow and that answered many of our questions.Not to much, not to little! It felt just right and very pleasant to invite our guide to join us for lunch. Would recommend him for anyone who wants to take the same tour. Trude & Asgeir

Two days with Matt. My wife and I decided to take a couple of day tours, one to the wine area and the other to Cape of Good Hope. We were extremely fortunate to end up being the only people on tour so it was like having our own private tour and time was efficiently utilized. Matt was very informative and new a lot about the Capetown area. I was able to book online and the owner responded very quickly suggested we change the tours around because of the weather forecast. Excellent company

"Best experience of my life". Great job to tour guides! They really took a good care of us. My wife and I really had a good time in Hluhluwe Imfolozi game reserve. And Cape Town tour was a breath taking. Thank you very much Dave Smith! For getting eventhing lineup us

First class all the way. From the start African Blue were simply first class. The liaison, correspondence prior to arrival from David spot on and always prompt. Our guide Duncan was superb, knowledgable, professional , courteous, helpful, caouldnt ask for more. We spent 4 days touring . Trips were all individual and made to measure. An Amazing tour. We had an amazing time in South Africa. All was greatly planned and booked (including the weather :-)). We really enjoyed the time with Matthew he was balancing very well his guidance with providing us family time as well, and he also managed to catch quickly on the thing we enjoyed doing and adapt the plan accordingly. We enjoyed his companion and pleasant personality. It was a great trip

Cape Peninsula full day tour. Superb full day tour with Matthew as our guide. I was picked up directly from my hotel in Cape Town. This was really memorable day with a highly knowledgeable local who really brought the area to life. A beautiful drive down one side of the peninsula with lots of opportunities to take photographs. There was a stop to take a boat trip to Seal Island which was a great experience. The highlight was the trip to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope (learned these are different). A bit of a climb to the lighthouse, but well worthwhile. Lovely trip back with lunch near to the Penguin Colony at Boulders. Great guide, great company and a great day out.

100 Percent Perfect Wineland tour. We booked this tour online about a week and a half ago with no problems. That may be partly due to this not being the height of the tourist season. Our guide (Mathew) always had a smile and a nice comment. He was able to walk two novice wine tasters through the day without fail. Also, being that he provides many different tours, he was able to answer all of our wide-ranging questions. Mathew took us to many wonderful places including several vineyards of varying types, a beautiful lunch overlooking a valley of vineyards, and a couple of small towns where we could buy gifts for back home. While there was so much to see and do, Mathew never had us in a rush and we always seem to have more time. While I'm sure a group setting would be pretty fun, our private tour was catered perfectly for us (and we had no clue what we wanted to do when we set out in the morning).

Look no further. Our group of 4 engaged African Blue for two separate day tours when in Cape Town last week. The tours were pre-arranged via email with David. Payment was easily settled online via credit card. It was our first trip to Cape Town (except for one) and we were very much impressed with the general service standards in the city’s tourism industry. This is very much so in the case of African Blue and the lodge we stayed (that’s another story). We opted for the scheduled full day Cape Peninsula on Day 1 and a private Table mountain /City/ Kirstenbosch private tour on Day 2. Duncan, our guide for both days, was excellent. He was patient, professional and very knowledgeable in the areas of history, geography and nature. Places we visited offered both magnificent views & enriching experiences. Thanks again, Duncan, for the well conducted tours, the exciting ride up to Signal Hill to catch the noon gun and the beautiful sunset captured during the scenic ride back to Cape Town Central from Kirstenbosch. Kudos to David, who, having checked the weather forecasts, took the initiative and efforts (by mail & phone) to contact us to swap the date for our private tour from Wed to Tue to avoid missing the Table Mountain given the rainy forecast for Wed. Proven to be a wise decision and we were blessed with beautiful sunshine. If you are searching for a tour operator in Cape Town, look no further! On a side note, I would recommend to devote a full day to enjoy the sights and sounds of Table Mountain.

Amazing. Greatest service and gratest people. I booked the Cape duet private tour, pick up service and cape town city private tour afternoon with Duncan. Cape Point and the tast in stellenbosch there was fantastic, the african blue tour staff was avaible anytime for any ours request.The last day we known David Smith, the boss .We are very happy for the choice and if we will comeback to sudafrica we will comeback to african blue tours.Thank you
Cape Peninusular Tour. Had a great day touring the cape peninsular, Matthew our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Full day tour was great value.

Private Cape Winelands Tour. My wife and I signed up for a private tour of the Winelands. Cape Peninsula Drive. Our tour guide Duncan was on point arriving shortly before the scheduled start time. Visit to seal island was splendid and I particularly enjoyed the cozy lunch in Simons Town during our stopover to see the penguins. Awesome trip and surely will return to Cape Town.

Amazing tour!. We had a very short time in Cape Town and African Blue Tours made sure to accommodate everything we wanted to do for a morning tour. Matt our guide was extremely knowledgeable about South African History and was such a friendly guy. I would request him as a guide any day of the week.
Cape peninsula tour. We had a perfect tour thanks to Duncan. We surely would mind another tour with him. Thanks again Duncan

Great people.. These people rescued us from the side of the road when we had terrible taxi problems. Great people who went out if their way to help us for no reason. Would always use them when in Cape Town.

Wonderful Man. My friends and I had an unhappy experience last week in Cape Town in an illegal taxi. We were so lucky to be helped by David and his wife. Thoroughly worthwhile and enjoyable tour of the Cape Peninsula. Cape Peninsula Tour - unbelievable. We did this tour, and right from pick up I knew we were in for a good tour. Cape peninsula tour - Excellent experience. We did the full day cape peninsula tour. Our guide Matthew picked us up from our hotel. In total we were 3 people on the tour. Cape tour and township tour. Both tours were excellent. I had an enthusiastic and welcoming guide for the township tour. Tours in/around Cape Town. We are so pleased with our tours with African Blue, and we had EXCELLENT experiences over three different days. We were able to see many sights and attractions with Duncan as our guide. He was professional, knowledgable, and very flexible to assist us in our tours! Thanks David and Duncan for making our stay in Cape Town so memorable!

Cape peninsula tour. It was an overcast day and the wind was blowing a gale but our tour guide Matt made this a great day! His enthusiastic conversations on flora, fauna, geography, history, politics and surfing kept us informed throughout the 8 hour trip around the cape peninsula. Highlights included the penguin colony, a very windy cape national park, and Chapman's peak. We didn't waste time on lunch and had plenty of time to explore the wonderful Kirstenbosch botanical gardens where Mandela's strelitzias were in full glory. Scones and jam at the park were a nice way to finish off a terrific day.

Hluhluwe-Imfolozi game reserve. We had a full-day (12 hour) tour. It was very convenient in that we were picked up from our Umhlanga hotel. Barry was extremely informative, not only about the wildlife, but about many various aspects of South African culture and history. The safari itself was exciting and fun. The day was the highlight of our trip.

District Six and Langa Township Tour. David was always very prompt and concise when responding to my dad’s pre booking emails. He helped arrange how it would be best for us to spend that particular day in Cape Town. About 2 weeks before our arrival in Cape Town, another tour guide of ours had a schedule conflict. David was more than happy to move our originally scheduled Wednesday tour to Monday to help us and the other tour guide out.We were picked up on time by Matthew, bright and early. He gave us great directions where to board the ferry, and after he parked, he met us there to make certain we made it there okay. Matthew was not as engaging as some of our other tour guides, but he did a very good job and we saw everything we were promised. Odwa made our day very memorable too. All in all, a great morning of enlightenment!

Nice Big 5 Safari and Cape Town City Tour. We booked a Aquilla Big 5 Safari Tour which was a great experience, we saw all of the Big Five. Nevertheless, Matthew told us a lot about Cape Town and gave us a good view of the life over there. Unfortunately, the Cableway up to the Table Mountain was closed, but we drove up to the hill which still gave us a nice view over the city,

Cape Peninsula and Winelands tours. I had two great tours with African Blue. Duncan took us to the Winelands and Matthew to the Peninsula. Township Tour. Our group of seven had a fantastic day visiting the Langa township and Robben island. From the moment I first inquired about the excursion, David was great to work with. He was quick to respond to any of my questions which made me very comfortable about booking with him. The tour itself was eye-opening and inspiring. David and Matthew picked us up at our accommodation (they ran a few minutes late due to a traffic stop). David was a great guide and very informative as we drove to the township. He was able to give us insight into what it was like to grow up 'privileged' during the Apartheid era before we got to the township. David then left us in the very good and capable hands of Odwa, a resident of Langa. Odwa was a fantastic guide and gave us a great tour of the township. It's difficult to put into words all that was seen and experienced, so suffice it to say, i would highly recommend this tour.After the township tour ended, David picked us up and brought us to the waterfront to catch the ferry to Robben Island. There was a bit of a hassle getting onto the ferry, but there is nothing David could have done about it. We had tickets for the 1pm crossing, but due to overselling and the lateness of the returning ferry, the 1pm ferry was full so we didn't board the next ferry until almost 2. Something to keep in mind if you have time constraints.The Robben Island tour itself was remarkable. The bus ride around the island for an orientation was pleasant. The bus guide did a good job of explaining what life was like around the island. However, it wasn't until we got to the prison and met Derek that the visit came to life. Derek was a political prisoner on the island in the late 80s until his release when all political prisoners were let go. His first-hand account of the treatment and conditions really brought the tour alive.David did an outstanding job putting together this tour for us so i can highly recommend his company as one to book with.

Brilliant and amazing. Our Luxury Lion Safari trip to South Africa far exceeded our expectations. South Africa. Our trip was FANTASTIC! The people of South Africa were so gracious and the accommodations, the tours, the service and the food were top notch. Migration time in East Africa. I recently returned from a fantastic trip of 22 days in South and East Africa. A Big THANKS to John A at Lion World. This was an awesome trip!!!. We found our trip thru Travel Zoo and worked with Laurandie du Preez at Lion World Travel. Lion World Travel exceeded all our expectations!. We recently returned from the Platinum South Africa trip with the Victoria Falls add-on, and we could not be any happier with the whole experience. Everything the trip was supposed to be!. Prior to the actual trip with Lion Travel, we were full of trepidation. Best of Capetown & Botswana with Vic Fall add-on. We came to Lion World via Travelzoo, so I checked reviews and decided to give them a try. Lion World Travel. If you are considering a trip to Africa I would not hesitate to use Lion World Travel. Cheryl Gould is the best agent. She arranged everything for us, was always available to answer our many questions and made helpful suggestions. Lion World Travel only arranges trips to Africa and has been in business for many years. Also, as we compared prices LWT has the best. Our trip included all air/ground transportation, a 5 star hotel (12 Apostles Hotel and Resort) in Cape Town for 4 days, a full day tour and a dinner at the Azure restaurant. Also included was 3 days at the Ivory Tree Lodge in Pilansesberg National Park which has full board and 2 game drives/day.

Platinum South Africa tour was Incredible!!!. We found this tour through Costco Travel. The tour description was intriguing. Spoke with Mary Ellen Chown who gave us the details and arranged our tour. All I can say is all my expectations were wildly exceeded. This was a 2-part tour, 4 nights in Cape Town and 3 nights in Lion Sands Reserve, Kruger Nat'l Park.Cape Town is a beautiful city and the Twelve Apostles Hotel is incredible. Outstanding view, delicious cuisine and impeccable service. Mary Ellen was awesome. She helped us select some great activities and tours. Our first day there included a helicopter ride around the bay. That was fantastic, but a little short. We also did a tour to the Cape Point traveling along a highway rivaling the Pacific Coast Hwy in Cal. We passed wild ostriches and baboons, visited a beach with hundreds of penguins and enjoyed a nice lunch with an ocean view. We did a bike tour of the beautiful wine country. The second part of our tour, Kruger, was the most incredible experience of my life! We stayed in a nice bungalow with a deck overlooking a river. Right after check-in, I was on the deck and heard rustling in the trees. At first I couldn't notice anything but then a head and neck stuck out from behind some trees a little way out. A giraffe was looking my way. Wow! The stay at Kruger is all inclusive, including food,wine and beer. The meals were excellent and it seems as if they are always presenting you with food or drink. The highlight of the trip was the safaris int the bush. A guide and tracker take you in an open Range Rover in pursuit of wild animals. You go on two 3hr. safaris a day, morning and evening. On our first safari, we were within 20 ft. of a wild and very beautiful leopard. We saw lions, Cape buffalo, giraffe, birds hippos, crocodile, hyenas, antelope, a rhino and LOTS of elephants These are wild, free roaming animals. Our guide and driver, Ben was very knowledgeable of the area and the wildlife. He made the safaris exciting. We also had a visit to the Henna Preschool in nearby Huntington, That was both heartwarming and fun to see these wonderful children playing and learning.. I could go on and on about this trip. It was an experience I will never forget.

Best of South Africa and Victoria Falls. I have just completed a trip to South Africa and Victoria Falls planned for me and a friend by Elizabeth Panchyshyn at Lion World. It was amazing! Over the top!. We can't stop talking about this trip. Our travel agent Laurandie from Lion World Travel was very patient and helpful as we planned this trip. Lion World Tours, East Africa Safari. We had an amazing East African Safari vacation in September with The Lion World Travel, but there were things that could have been better. The quality of guides is something that left me wanting more. I thought there were more of drivers than the actual naturalist or guide who can educate me on the habitat, animal behavior and ecology of African plains. I felt I knew as much if not more, about the most of animals excluding birds, than the each driver, and didn't gain any additional insight from them. However, drivers made all out efforts to ensure that we had maximum viewing experience of all the animals including "actual hunt" as it took place in front of our eyes. They were courteous and safe drivers. Leopard Tours made changes that at least four of us found cumbersome and unnecessary. The driver changed the itinerary in Ngorongoro and Serengeti to an early start, and/or the whole day game drive from the morning to evening. He wanted to start at 7:00 AM in the morning, and we had to negotiate to start at 7:30 as the breakfast started at 6:30. I had to explain him that some of us are used to "habitual natural" morning routine after the morning coffee and breakfast, and will need more time to accommodate our routine, and we can not leave at 7:00, but would prefer 7:30 instead. Finally, he insisted on 7:15, and I told him we will try to be there at 7:15, and we did. I also told him that we would have preferred to stick to the morning and afternoon game drive as being out there whole day on the bumpy road was bit cumbersome, but we did comply with his request of a whole day game drive for two days in Serengeti with great reluctance. There was also on the issue on mishandling of our departure time despite making it sure on the day of arrival in Arusha. Leopard tour had our departure flight listed at 7:00 PM instead of 2:15 PM, and so we made sure that the time was corrected and the arrangement for transfer was agreed on. Despite this discussion on the day of our arrival, the driver announced day before our departure from Lake Manyara to Arusha that our flight information he had indicated that our flight departed at 7:00 PM, and our transfer will be arranged accordingly. I told him about our discussion on the very first day on the subject and indicated that we were assured of arrangements accordingly. He told me he would call the next day before we depart from the lodge. I insisted that he should call right away to sort our the issue and confirm the transfer arrangement to the airport. He did call and took care of it, but next day when I mentioned the situation to the very same person with whom I had a discussion the time discrepancy, and the transfer agreement on a very first day, he simply ignored me without saying a word! We did pay $50 for the taxi to the airport as had agreed upon and made it to the airport on time, but they could have handled the whole incident professionally and efficiently. Leopard tour to be more responsive to the clients. There is always a temptation to book directly with a local tour operator to save some money, but I am glad I do not succumb to the urge as I am not sure if they would care to respond to my misgivings, or go to extra mile in a critical situation to ensure my satisfaction, if The Lion World Travel was not the agency we had used, and booked directly with Leopard Tours.

Botswana amazing!!! Zambia Loved it!! At trip of a lifetime my husband and are in awe!. Mary Ellen our agent did such an amazing job with our trip to Africa!! Lion World travel for safaris in South Africa--Great!!. Laurandie at Lion World planned our safari to two game camps near Krueger National Park in South Africa. Luxury & Service Delivered. We started looking at packages to Africa at the beginning of the year. All we knew was that we wanted to see the Great Migration in the Mara. We became aware of Lion World on the Costco travel site, but those trips were for SA and Botswana. On the Lion World site we found a reasonable package that seemed to cover what we wanted to see in Kenya. The Serena properties we stayed in were all true luxury experiences. Our knowledgeable guides (through Pollman Tours) were able to get us up close with the wildlife and not only did we see the Big 5, but were lucky enough ( and luck is a factor in wildlife sightings) to see multiple zebra/wildebeest river crossings. Our package called for driving back from the Mara to Nairobi and we chose paying to fly back instead. It was a good decision-in fact if you're considering staying at multiple camps, I'd recommend flying between them-there's really not much to see on the roads-some of which are paved, but much is bumpy, dusty, rutted dirt. I'd also recommend upgrading to first class if you fly Ethiopian Airlines from the U.S-economy was not the best. Overall, we had a fantastic, memorable trip and appreciate all the support and assistance from Lion World and Pollman-both companies strive to insure you have a great experience.

Cape Town and South Africa and Zimbabwe Bush trip. This was a wonderful trip. Awesome Safari Trip and more! Thanks Lion World and Laurandie!. We had hoped one day to go on a safari. Invaluable assistance. Cheryl arranged our trip to South Africa, including a memorable trip to the Kapama Karula game reserve. Her arrangements were thorough and her advice spot on - I highly recommend Cheryl and Lion World Travel when planning your African adventure.

WHAT I DID NOT KNOW ABOUT AFRICA!!. Just got back from my trip. What an incredible experience. The people are wonderful- some of the friendliest I have been around. The food was amazing. Capetown/Safari adventure. From the airports, transfers, hotels, shuttles, guides and all the staff at Lion's World a get big shout out! Excellent safari and Cape Town experience. Many thanks to Lion World for making possible our South Africa adventure. Cape Town and our private Cape Peninsula tour were more interesting and informative than we’d anticipated. Table Mountain was awesome, city tours by the off-on Red and Yellow Line buses were interesting, and the meal/dancing/singing at Gold was good. (However, re the latter, all nine in our Lion World group regretted that while the performers danced and sang well, they never said what cultures they were representing each time. A major flaw.) Staff at Table Bay Hotel was excellent. The morning buffet was monumental, and the Brasserie offered good value (and our first taste of kudu as an entree). Discovery Tours provided an outstanding private tour of the Cape Peninsula, visiting all the sights we wanted to see as well as others our guide knew we'd like, and giving me plenty of time to take photographs.Jackalberry Lodge in the Thornybush Game Reserve was an excellent experience. Our chalet was spacious and first-rate. Food was good and plentiful. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, going all out to ensure everyone was satisfied. Game drives were interesting and at times exciting. Our ranger and tracker were very knowledgeable, and eager to show us a wide variety of wildlife in addition to the Big Five. Several times we were within 5-10 meters of lions, and once watched a pair mating right next to our vehicle. (No shame!)  On the last drive, a baby elephant we’d seen before came right up to our vehicle and nosed around its side with his trunk, just below my wife’s arm! The ranger was worried and unwrapped his rifle, but the watchful mother elephant fortunately didn’t react negatively and the baby soon wandered away.  I’m glad my wife found the Lion World offer on TravelZoo, and we feel it was an outstanding value as well as memorable experience.

amazing!. An Exceptional Trip with Exceptional Service. While searching for a completely different trip, Susan came across an offer for the Planes, Trains and Safarimobiles Excursion from Lion World Travel of Toronto, Canada. Lion World has specialized in Africa tours for over 50 years. It was a too-good-to-pass-up package. The trip included 4 nights at the 12 Apostles Hotel & Spa in Cape Town, South Africa, 3 nights at the Kapama Private Game Reserve Southern Camp (including all meals and a total of 6 game drives), an overnight trip (with private cabin) on the Blue Train from Hoedspruit to Pretoria, and all transfers. Plus, it included airfare from the US to Johannesburg and return. In addition, there was an optional excursion to Victoria Falls, with lodging at the Victoria Falls River Lodge, game drives, tour of Vic Falls, and all meals. She quickly called Lion World before the package could disappear. We worked with Mary Ellen Chown who saw to all of our needs and desires – mainly including the Vic Falls excursion with a third night at the Victoria Falls River Lodge. We’ve posted separate reviews of Kapama Private Game Reserve Southern Camp and Victoria Falls River Lodge on TripAdvisor.com, so we won’t repeat all those details here.Our flights to and from East Tennessee were included and went without a hitch. We flew South African Airways to and from the US, within South Africa, and from Johannesburg to Vic Falls and return. We were very satisfied with all flights and all transfers. (Lion World partners with Thompson’s Africa for some services there. While checking in at Vic Falls for our return to J’burg, a Thompson’s Africa guide who was with another tour asked us about our experience to make sure that everything had been done to our satisfaction.)In Cape Town, we first met others on the PT&S tour. The package provides for much individual choice so we only had a little interaction with the others there. Lion World offered to arrange tours in the area, but we chose to arrange private tours of our own. The 12 Apostles is a wonderful hotel located a few miles south of the city of Cape Town. They offer regular shuttles into Camps Bay and Cape Town. Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula are a wonderful area with great history. We chose to do a city highlights tour, a winelands tour, and a Cape Peninsula tour. It was a great way to start the trip.From Cape Town, we flew to Hoedspruit, where Rangers from Kapama met us. We drove directly out of the airport and into the Kapama Game Reserve. Southern Camp is a 5 star facility near the center of the 15,000-hectare reserve. Southern Camp is fenced, so dangerous animals are outside the fence (most of the time). Our lodging was a large deluxe thatch-roofed cottage with indoor and outdoor showers and a plunge pool. We had a total of 6 game drives and one game walk. While the reserve has all of the big 5, (elephant, lion, rhinoceros, buffalo, and leopard), leopards are rarely seen. We did see the other four. We also saw at least 6 antelope species, warthogs, giraffes, zebras, hyenas and many others. Meals were excellent, and they were able to handle special dietary needs, like gluten free for Susan. We would gladly return to Kapama.Next was the Train part of the PT&S Excursion. The Blue Train is often cited as one of the world’s leading luxury trains. Upon boarding, we were greeted with champagne while we waited for our suite to be ready. The train is elegant, the service impeccable, and the food truly special. However, travelers should be aware that the suites are quite small. Also, the trip from Hoedspruit to Pretoria involves numerous changes of speed and several extended stops. (Otherwise, the trip would be hours shorter. The extended stop during dinner service was welcome, as it made the experience more relaxing.) It seems that the track on this route is not in good shape. The train was bumping and banging throughout the night, making sleep almost impossible. If we were to elect this package again, we would ask Lion World to substitute a flight from Hoedspruit to J’burg and a night in a J’burg hotel for the Blue Train, since the enjoyment of the train trip was lost because of the bumping and banging.Because we had taken the Vic Falls excursion, we had an overnight stay at the DaVinci Hotel in J’burg. The hotel was quite nice and well located. We chose to take a private tour of Soweto (reviewed separately on TripAdvisor). That tour was a truly moving experience. The next morning, we were taken to the airport for the next leg of our trip, Vic Falls.We were met at the airport and taken to the Shearwater Adventures boat dock. From there, we were taken up the Zambezi River to the Victoria Falls River Lodge (VFRL) in the Zambezi National Park. VFRL has a different ambience from Kapama. Because it is in a national park, it is not fenced. It is possible at any time to encounter any of the animals native to the area on the grounds of the lodge. We were instructed to always be accompanied by a staff person when walking between our tent and the lodge between sunset and sunrise. On our last night, as we reached our tent, our guide pointed out a hippopotamus only 30 or 40 feet away. Hippos are responsible for more deaths than any other species in Africa. We were glad we had a guide.As for those tents – they were large (perhaps 20 feet by 30 feet) with a permanent raised, wood floor and a deck with a Jacuzzi. They also had an indoor and an outdoor shower. Based on reviews online, Susan requested the tent furthest from the lodge since that increased the chances of seeing animals. We were in tent 14 – the end of the trail. It was the perfect choice, not just because the hippos were near, but the view of the Zambezi River just off of our deck at sunrise and sunset was the best of any of the tents at VRFL.VFRL doesn’t have the full range of animals seen at Kapama – no rhinos for example. It does have a different character, with the Zambezi River right there, baobab trees, and a good variety of game. As with Kapama, the guides and staff were excellent and highly focused on customer service. The package included two game drives a day and one trip to Victoria Falls. The Falls are every bit as impressive as their billing. Because we had added an extra night at VFRL, we elected to take a full-day excursion with Shearwater Adventures to Chobe National Park in Botswana. (When you enter Zimbabwe, you have a choice of purchasing a one-time visa, a dual-entry visa, or a multiple entry visa. We had purchased a dual-entry visa, expecting to walk across the bridge below Vic Falls to Zambia and back. Since we did not do that, we were able to visit Chobe without the cost of a second visa.)The excursion to Chobe National Park is a wonderful way to experience one more dimension of Africa. The trip began with a boat cruise up the Chobe River. Besides the expected crocodiles, we saw elephants swimming the river to reach an island for grazing. After a buffet lunch at a local resort, we were off on a game drive. Here Chobe differs greatly from Kapama and Zambezi National Park. In both of the latter areas, the only game drives were those associated with the resorts where we were staying. While they exchanged information, there never was a sense that the areas were crowded. In Chobe, there seemed to be many companies offering game drives. We were usually within sight of at least one other vehicle, and several times, we were within sight of several. When one driver radioed that he had spotted a single female lion, about a dozen vehicles converged on the same spot. Even so, Chobe is a remarkable place to view wildlife – with the best elephant sightings of any of our game drives. We also saw larger numbers of hippos than at VFRL, and a few animals that we had not seen elsewhere. We would highly recommend planning time to take Shearwater’s Chobe excursion.We owe our thanks to Mary Ellen and to Lion World Travel for all of our wonderful experiences. They even had small gifts, such as Kapama ball caps, and lovely cards at each of our stops along the way. Even when we arrived back home exhausted there was a “welcome back home” card awaiting us! Thanks for a job well done!

It was gruesome, but interesting, to watch the five lionesses feed on their kill. I also took a bush walk and saw quite a lot of animals during it too.All in all, we would not hesitate to recommend a Lion World Travel tour. It was fabulous!

A great trip!. We'd been to So. Africa 3 times previously,as well as Botswana.This was a very well organized trip,the places we stayed ,the luxury tented camps,were excellent.Wouldn't hesitate to recommend Lion's World Travel.Definitely enjoyed the Victoria Falls River Lodge,friendly,helpful people,great food!

Trip of a lifetime!. Lion World travel is the best. The specialist we worked with put an extraordinary amount of effort into the small details of the trip. The entire trip went off without a hitch. I can't recommend them enough. And South Africa is an amazing area filled with wonderful people!

"Most enjoyable group trip of a life-time in all respects!". John, you are the best! The trip was well packaged and executed from start to finish. Accommodation was superb! Bliss. The gentle people, the majestic animals, the beauty.. The only problem with our trip is that it's over. We are home thrilled, blessed and humbled. The people of South Africa are simply lovely. Caring, attentive, funny and so proud of their country. The animals left us humbled to see them in their natural habitat.and Victoria Falls is breathtaking. To thank for this adventure is Cheryl Gould of Lion World Travel, a marvel from the beginning. While in Cape Town, stay at or visit the Table Bay Hotel. Restaurant Camissa, High Tea, and their mascot Oscar, memorialized in a glorious monument (a beloved seal). We loved the Two Seas Aquarium, and right next door the Watershed, a beautiful building with individual stores selling everything African. Adjacent is a food hall that is out of this world! Our game drives were spectacular. Our camp was in the private Thorneybush Game Preserve where we stayed at the Jackalberry Lodge. This is where the word bliss comes in. Perfect in every way, and the meals were some of the best we experienced, thanks to their chef Martha. Lastly, the Victoria Falls River Lodge is where we wound down in beauty and luxury on the Great Zambizi. From here we visited Victoria Falls - a breathtaking sight. Our trip was a dream come true from the beginning to the end, and we hope yours will be the same.

Journey of a Lifetime. Cheryl Gould, Lion World Travel, arranged a 10 day, platinum tour for four to South Africa. It was a perfect 10 from beginning to end. A great experience!. Cheryl Gould was terrific in guiding us from the start. Her suggestions seemed to fit us perfectly, as she had asked many questions to try to match us up with activities. Our experience was that 4 days/3 nights in Capetown and environs was fine. Our highlights were Robben Island (humbling) and the winelands. The Graff winery was out of this world. The safari guides and spotters were exceptional and we can't think of anything on this venture that could have been better. Trust Cheryl. She has a good 6th sense about what you do and where you stay.

Best trip by far!. When we decided on a South Africa honeymoon, we contacted Lion World Travel and thank goodness we did. Cheryl had been AMAZING from the start. She was extremely helpful and always so quick to answer any questions we may have had. The itinerary given to us was exactly what we had hoped for. Everything was taken care of in regards to planning and booking activities, which put our mind at ease and all we had to do was enjoy our trip. Enjoy is definitely an understatement. We had chosen the Best of South Africa tour and both accommodations (Cape Town and Hoedspruit) were top notch. Thank you to Lion World and Cheryl for helping us have this unforgettable adventure.

Best of Cape Town and Botswana. This trip was fabulous. We had 3 days in Cape Town on our own. We rode the city tour buses two days where you can stop off along the way. Cape Town is a great city. The third day we went shark cage diving. That was an adventure but not scary.  From there we went to the remote Kadizora Camp in Botswana. The staff and hosts, Greg and Sue, took an personal interest in all the guests and made them feel welcome. Our guide, Tuboy, was a real character and loved by everyone in our group. He was also very knowledgeable. We saw a lion and three cubs who had recently made a kill in addition to all the other animals. After that we went to Elephant Valley Lodge near Chobe National Park. The Lodge had a watering hole nearby where you could watch the animals come for a drink at night. We saw lots of animals including a leopard in the national park. They had to come down to the river to drink since it was very dry.  This was a trip of a lifetime.

Experts on Africa. I heard about Lion World Travel through a travel website I subscribe too and after talking with Cheryl about what they offer decided to book our trip through them. It was the right decision. Along the way Cheryl was amazing to work with - prompt in answering questions and providing her expert opinion - she made sure we knew everything we needed to have a wonderful time. She even worked with local tour companies and made arrangements so that we could swim at the top of Victoria Falls - a feat which even required a car change at the Zambia/Zimbabwe border. In addition to the service beforehand, they have extra touches as well. Lion arranged for personalized cards in each hotel room along our trip which reinforced for us that they would be there should we need anything at all. And once we got home there was a card and email to make sure we had a wonderful time. This is a boutique agency and I highly recommend them for their outstanding expertise, service, and personalization!

A year later we're still wowed by our South African adventure. In Oct. 2014 our family of four was 'wowed' by our package trip to South Africa through Lion World Travel. Mary Ellen Chown was an outstanding agent. Below are some comments regarding impressions of various aspects of the trip.12 Apostles Hotel in Capetown - A fantastic choice with an excellent staff, comfortable beds and pillows (a pillow menu, sigh!) and delicious and beautifully presented meals. The concierge was outstanding. The views were stunning, and the housekeeping staff's uniforms added to the charm. It was very convenient to use their shuttle to the V&A Waterfront.Full day tour with Mark - He was knowledgeable and interesting. Seeing so many whales was amazing! Mark shared fascinating background info on politics in SA and in the townships. We even got to see the "Smileys", the sheeps' head delicacy which were cooking over bar-b-ques in the township. We were running late for our dinner to Gold Restaurant, so Mark graciously and seamlessly coordinated with our pre-arranged transportation, and drove us there directly from the day tour.Gold Restaurant - Learning to play the bongos was fun, and the entertainment during the authentic African feast was such fun.Gold's bathroom is lovely! The food was good, too.Helicopter 'flip' - Great fun, but it would have been nice if they could provide a bit longer ride than just from their site to the heli-pad at the hotel. Our sons wanted to be dropped off at the hotel, but they wouldn't allow my husband and me to ride back to their site with the pilot, even though that's where he was heading.We scheduled our own full-day tour with Cape Convoy, and loved seeing Cape Point and the botanical gardens. Our family would have preferred that those sites, rather than the winery, be included on your tour. Kapama River Lodge - We loved ending our tour with the safari, and what a gorgeous lodge! We were greeted with yummy green cocktails. The beds weren't as quite as comfortable as 12 Apostles', but they were fine.The morning and evening safaris were simply outstanding. Jakes and Michael were our ranger and tracker, and they made our experience memorable in all the best of ways. We saw things we never imagined ... a group of young male giraffes play-fighting, a lion roaring to its mate at night, leopards resting in the tree, groups of rhinocerous, hippos, water buffalo, and elephants, an injured hyena, and a warthog killed by a lion. The Range Rover seats were very comfortable, and we encountered no mosquitoes, so we stopped taking our awful anti-malaria meds! We lucked out with our fellow tour members. Ten was the perfect size group.It was pure pleasure to soak in the free-standing tub in our bathroom, with binoculars and a camera nearby to capture the wildlife right outside our room! We encountered wild deer each day on our walk from our rooms to the lodge.The food was beautifully presented. Our only concern was one night when we ate outdoors, and the buffet included chicken kebabs cooked in front of us. The cook used the same tongs handle the chicken before and after it was cooked. That made our group of salmonella-conscious Americans cringe.The only downside to the trip was the 22+ hours it took to get there from Portland, OR, and the discomfort of their economy seating. In addition, SA's entertainment system was down during the entire 14.5 hours it took to get there; the stewards said that it's often down. I'm sure there are restrictions on what airlines you can use, but a more direct flight schedule would have made the trip a 10/10.The bottom line, though, is trip was even better than we expected! Kudos to all of you at Lion World Travel. We had the time of our lives.

One of the most memorable trips you can take. In October 2015 my wife and I took Lion World Travel’s “Best of South Africa “ tour with an option to Victoria Falls. Candidly, we have pretty much traveled all over the world and will have to place this trip very close to the top as our best overall experience. With Lion World’s African Specialist Laurandie du Preez professional, efficient, thorough, and extremely patient assistance we planned and embarked on our tour which included Cape Town, a safari in Kapama Game Reserve and Victoria Falls. Beginning with our stay in Cape Town at the Twelve Apostles Hotel and Spa we were treated to a premier facility with exceptional accommodations, restaurants and lounges and a staff that couldn’t do enough for you. The city is beautiful with many attractions to absorb your interest including Table Mountain’s aerial cableway and the awesome sights from the top of the mountain, Seal Island, The Cape of Good Hope the most south-western point of the African Continent, Boulders Beach with its hundreds of penguins, and too many others to list. Of course there are the obligatory shopping areas where you can get all the authentic African souvenirs. The next leg of the trip was the safari. We stayed at the Kapama Southern Camp, and the lodgings were really very nice. The game drives, morning and afternoon, were wonderful in comfortable Land Rovers seating 3 tiers of guests. The guides are rigorous in trying to find the various wild animals and we saw everything with the exception of a leopard….our bad luck. Each game drive was interrupted for tea, coffee and snacks (morning) and cocktails and snacks (afternoon). Very civilized . Our last stop was Victoria Falls. Simply awesome; do not make the trek all the way to South Africa without seeing the falls. Included in this leg were a couple of more game drives and it is here we got to see our fill of elephants. Lots of them; one of which took exception to our being there but it all worked out. We were led to believe that this would be a five star tour and we were not disappointed in ANY aspect.

Amazing South African Adventure. Our trip to Cape Town and Jackalberry Lodge far exceeded our expectations! Our travel specialist, Laurandie, worked closely with us at every step of the planning to ensure that we were able to maximize our time to enjoy the sights of Cape Town and an unforgettable stay at Thornybush Reserve. She was always available to answer questions and to provide recommendations. Lion World provided ourstanding drivers for our wine tour and our Cape Point tour. Their knowledge, experience and information they shared with us enhanced our understanding of South African history and culture. Jackalberry Lodge is a special place with everyone on the staff making an extra effort to ensure that we had a memorable experience. A special thank you to our ranger Ocean and our tracker Lucas. We highly recommend Lion World Travel!
Awesome South African Vacation. Beyond our expectations. Thornybush Lodge experience was the highlight of the entire vacation. I would go again in a heartbeat.

The mother of all vacations!. Words and photos can't possibly describe the extraordinary scenery, wildlife, and people we encountered in South Africa and Zimbabwe. Trip of a Lifetime!. We were originally booked with another company, who cancelled 1 month before our departure date. Our bad luck turned out to be our Good Luck.
