Tanzania, Africa - Serengeti - Ngorongoro Caldera - Olduvai Gorge. Our driver/guide with Leopard Tours/Arusha was TeDeus. He seems to be an expert on the country, the National Parks, animal behavior, the climate, and the history of the area. We were very, very impressed with him. If you are heading to Tanzania, you would be doing yourself a favor if you book TeDeus for your driver/guide. As domestic cat breeders and owners, we were most interested in seeing the big cats -- and boy, did we ever!! Our first one was a leopard with his kill up in a tree in Tarangire National Park Subsequently, we saw many lions, including a lion family with babies, a cheetah mother with three big kittens, and a Serval cat. The elephant families were also fantastic. What they say about the "humanity" of elephants is quite evident when you sit for a while and watch them. TeDeus was SO patient. He would sit and wait for the animals to exhibit their characteristic behaviors without seeming to want to move on as some guides like to do. Of course, we were snapping pictures every minute. The Ndutu Tented Lodge. It is a marvelous place where we had the best --- the best accommodations, the best interior decor, the best food, the best WiFi, and the nicest personnel !!! (The soups were amazing -- we met the chef and complimented him!!) The solar-paneled hot water tank outside each "tent" was most impressive! DO go there. Although some might think it too remote, it was super !!! I came home exhausted. Twelve days on the hop is not my usual routine, but it was the trip of a lifetime. This was my third safari trip, and while each one is VERY special in its own way, this one will stand out as extraordinary.

Fabulous trip to Tanzania and Kenya - everything worked out perfectly!!. Lion World organized our entire journey from US departure to our return. International and local flights were all excellent. All worth visiting and highly recommended!Thank you so much Pat for helping us put this trip together!!! It was a trip of a lifetime and all 4 of us had a blast!!! Sherri, David, Brady and Ellen

Trip of a Lifetime made better by Lion World. Had the most amazing safari trip to Kenya!!!! From the very beginning of our trip planning to our return flight home, Lion World was amazing!! Lion World Travel exceeded expectations. My husband and idea booked a trip with Lion World Travel for 5 days in Cape Town and 4 on safari to Kruger National Park and Sabi Sands and have only praise for the trip and the service provided. This is the first time we have ever used a travel agency because we prefer following our own itinerary. However, never having been to South Africa, we were not as comfortable with the idea of winging it as we have been through Europe and the British Isles However, this trip had all of the benefits of an experienced travel agent helping with the irritating details, but none of the downsides associated with a canned tour. Our agent Mary Ellen helped us book the day trips we wanted and even helped us secure tickets for a concert at the botanical gardens that we researched on our own. The separate day trips to the vineyards and to the Cape of Good Hope (African penguins!) were well worth the time. The accommodations at Table Bay Hotel in Capetown and then at the River and Tinga Lodges while on safari were outstanding. The wildlife spotted on game drives while on safari were unlike anything we have ever experienced. Did I mention the night spent in Kingston Treehouse in Kruger Park? Do not hesitate to go!

Lion World has luxury Africa travel down - best vacation ever!. We normally book vacations on our own, and have very high standards for organized trips/travel agents when we use them. Lion World exceeded our expectations. We took the Best of South Africa trip with Victoria Falls in Luxury added on at the end. I highly recommend this combination (and in the same order - Cape Town, Kruger, Vic Falls).Somehow, Lion World is able to provide 5 & 4 star accommodations (I use that order because they were mainly 5 star) with great activities and extras at an excellent price. Every part of the trip was flawless - every transfer was handled by professionals who knew exactly what to do and were always early, waiting for us.The package included a full day Western Cape tour out of Capetown. There were only 6 of us on the tour and guide was incredible. He had a broad knowledge of the history of South Africa as well as nature and animals. A helicopter ride over the bay was also included - really nice helicopter with leather seats that picked us up at the hotel. Their choice of hotels (such as the 12 Apostles and Michelangelo) are flawless. Kapama Southern Camp in the Kruger area provided high end accommodations, with amazing safari animal drives and fabulous food. Victoria Falls is huge and beautiful. You get your own cabin on the river, surrounded by animals at the River Lodge. We were picked up in a van at the airport and brought to a small private boat that took us to the lodge. Throughout the process, Laurandie, our Lion World agent was helpful and advised us well. She took care of restaurant reservations and made great suggestions, based on the time she spent getting to know us and our expectations. I can't speak highly enough about the services provided and quality of the vacation that Lion World delivered. Through and because of them, we truly had the trip of a lifetime.

If you can only afford one trip to Africa make it Tanzania through Lion World. I had gone to Kenya in October 2014 with Lion World and thought that was an incredible trip - but my trip to Tanzania in May 2015 was even better!!! Truly if you can only afford one safari make it Tanzania through Lion World and Leopard Tours - and ask that Ibrahim A. Gege be your guide. The Lion World trip was five star at 3 star prices. Since my friends and I (there were two couples) are older we required aisle seats going and coming, plus rooms close to the main lodges plus 24 hour access to electricity. Laurandie at Lion World made all the arrangements as we requested. I had been in Kenya so I had something with which to compare Tanzania - the people, the landscape and the number/type of animals. I found the people of Tanzania to be warm and outgoing with a wonderful sense of humor. The landscape of Tanzania is extremely diverse. In hours you can go from mountains and woodlands to savannahs, to lakes and marshes. I was in Kenya during the dry season so visually the landscape was pretty bare and somewhat boring. Tanzania at the end of the rainy season was so incredibly lush and green - fields of flowers everywhere. And I did not see a single mosquito or tsetse fly and there was only one day when it really rained late in the afternoon and through the night - so my fears about going during the "rainy season" proved totally unfounded. But the really big difference between Kenya and Tanzania is the sheer number of animals- thousands - I do mean thousands - of wildebeest, zebras, buffaloes and impalas in Tanzania. Giraffes and elephants were easily found in large groups everywhere. PLUS WE SAW LIONS IN TREES, LIONS ON ROCKS, LIONS ON THE ROAD, LIONS IN THE GRASS. We also saw a leopard and a very rare caracal. All of the cats were extremely active, not just hiding or laying around sleeping. I have incredible video of hyenas chasing a herd of elephants through the marsh, a zebra rolling in the dirt, wildebeest mating, monkeys - well monkeys being monkeys. Yes, we saw several black rhino and lots of hippos really up close and personal outside the water. And there are the most amazing birds in Tanzania. The Serena hotels in Kenya are very nice, but the Serena hotels in Tanzania are really special. First stop was the converted coffee plantation at Lake Duluti where you sense what Africa was like during colonial times. At the Serena in the Serengeti you truly felt like you are in the bush with frequent bushbaby, dikdik, and mongoose sightings. You actually believed the story that a leopard had been found in a room when someone failed to close and lock their balcony door. From our balcony we watched buffalo, elephants and wildebeest converge on the waterhole below. Finally the Serena at the Crater - we had just started to unpack when we heard this grunting sound. A buffalo was right below our balcony! As an older traveler you always wonder what will happen if there is a medical emergency - this was when Lion World and Leopard Tours displayed their true value. One of my travel companions got a severe case of motion sickness. Our guide, Ibrahim, was extremely compassionate. He gently cared for her and immediately arranged for a wonderful doctor to see her at the lodge; the hotel prepared special meals that were served in her room; she even got a call in the bush the next day from the operation's manager at Lion World making sure she was OK. And the food. In Kenya most of the meals were buffet style with lots of prepared Indian dishes. Nothing really special except at the Serena Camp at Lake Elmenteita. In Tanzania we had a choice of exotic soup (the banana soup was to die for) and entre (a meat, exotic fish or paste dish) at both Lake Duluti and at the Crater - in addition to salads and deserts from the buffet. Plus although buffet style at the Serengeti Serena there were always freshly grilled meats, exotic fish and vegetables. We had lunch by the swimming pool in Tarangire and lunch served on real plates picnic style in the bush by a hippo pool. The only real down side - if you go once you are going to want to go again and again and again.

Luxurious Trip. The four days in Cape Town were an amazing time.Our guide,the accommodations,food didn't want to leave. 12 Apostles small with excellent service. Madikwe was totally unexpected. Truly Great Service. We just returned from a 12 night Safari to Botswana that is now the best trip we have ever taken. Safari in Absolute Style - Best vacation of our lives. African zebras and wild ostriches at Table Mountain National Park, and we stopped for photos. Thank you Lion World for planning this fun (and affordable) dream vacation adventure!

Great solo trip to South Africa. Like many others I hadn't heard of LW until I saw their amazing deal on Travel Zoo. I had assumed that a safari would cost me 8 to 10 k, and had no immediate plans to go on one. But when I saw that this 7 night trip was 4k including air, with luxury accommodations, and then saw all the great reviews of LW, I decided to bite the bullet.I loved the accommodations - both More Quarters and Lion Sands river lodge were top notch. Excellent food at the lodge, saw big five and then some. And I must stress how nervous I was about going alone on my first ever Africa trip. But it all came out okay, with just one minor glitch everything was well organized by LW.My only real complaint is that somehow, despite their offer saying transfers were included, I was told I'd have to pay $50 for an arrival transfer because I was the only person arriving on my flight (which I argued shouldn't matter. Transfers should be provided regardless, per the website, but they wouldn't budge). When I found out I could get a transfer for about $33 from More Quarters, I cancelled the LW transfer. Then I find out the others in my group were in fact on my same flight and they got the free arrival transfer. I called this out and the company agreed to refund me the cost of my transfer, so that was good, but still it seemed like a strange error given there were only 5 of us in this group and we were all on the same flight). I did a tour in Peru a couple years ago and the tour guide picked me up personally at the airport, alone, as part of the package price, and that was a far less expensive trip.It also seemed interesting to me that if I had booked a shark cage dive through LW it would have cost more than booking directly with the same company they were using (I emailed the company and got a quote that was lower than LWs). So I booked that on my own; however I should point out the one tour in cape town that I booked through Lion World (they use Thompsons tours) was awesome. I really liked the guide, he was on time and very nice, and I was sorry I didn't use Thompsons for all my excursions in cape town. (I used Ilios travel for a tour on the hotel's recommendation - mistake! The guide was 40 minutes late and a bit of a jerk). My suggestion to LW for solo travelers is to either let the traveler know which dates they have other solos booked, so we have the option of choosing one of those dates, or have trips that are reserved for only solo travelers. I was told there were 2 couples in my group but they turned out to be all in one family. I felt a bit odd at Lion Sands during meal time because I didn't want to eat alone but felt guilty infringing on their time together as a family. (they were lovely and welcoming but I still felt kind of bad). It also might be nice to have more of an organized tour experience with a few planned activities for the group balanced by a couple days at leisure, instead of having us be totally on our own and not meeting each other until safari time. But none of this would stop me from re-booking with LW if the deal was good or recommending them. I shopped around and was shocked at how much more expensive other companies' trips are, not to mention the single supplements! I paid just $500; some companies were charging upwards of $2000 for single supplement. I'm already thinking about where to safari next.

Kenya must be added to everyones bucket list. My wife ,myself and five friends took Lion World of Toronto trip to Kenya.The trip was flawless.From our initial contact with Laurandie til we returned everything was like clockwork. The accomodations were absolutely wonderful as were the meals . Our guide Chris was personable.knowlegable. and professional. The information he gave us was terrific.The sights were magnificent and the animals beyond belief. You have to be camera illiterate not to get great pictures.The staff are so wonderful at each place you feel as if you are at home.I would strongly suggest that if a safari is something you would like to do(and it should be) call these people.

My first trip to Africa hopefully will not be my last!. I have been to China and Turkey, but never Africa. Frankly, I did not think I would ever be able to afford such a trip. But I saw the offer in the Washington Post (half what similar safaris are advertised as costing) and after checking reviews on Trip Advisor I immediately booked my trip to Kenya with Lion World Travel. I left on Oct. 23 and returned on Oct. 30, 2014. My contract at Lion World was Laurandie du Preez. She was incredible - professional, knowledgable, but most importantly responsive. I have dealt with travel agents before who never returned an email or a phone call. Not Laurandie. No question was too silly to not be answered promptly. She calmed my fears when my friends questioned the wisdom of going to Africa during an ebola outbreak - Just in case you do not know this - they started tracking cases of ebola in 1976 and Kenya has never had a single confirmed case. Kenya is 3000+ miles away from the West African countries experiencing the outbreak. My chances of getting hit by a car in the US were greater than contracting ebola in Kenya. So please do not let unfounded fear prevent you from visiting this truly beautiful country.I spent the first night in Nirobi at the 5 star Serena Hotel. Then two nights at the five star Serena Lake Elementita - permanent tents with marble floors and all the amenities. Finally three nights at the five star Serena Lodge Masai Mara with rooms high on a cliff overlooking a savannah. The food, and there was lots of it, at all of the Serena properties was top notch, as was the service. Hussain with Liberty Travel was the lead guide on this trip. He has been doing this for 16 years. He knows everything about Kenya - its history, its politics, its culture, but most importantly, its animals. He also understands herding a bunch of strangers is like herding cats - some want to sleep late, some what to shop more than see animals, some I have no idea why they ever wanted to come to Kenya? But Hussain handled all our differences with ease. At the end of our time together we all shed tears over it ending way too soon.Transworld Safaris gave us a hot air balloon ride that was to die for - a typical 45 minute trip turned into a 75 minute experience of a life time. Daniel, our captain, landed the balloon 75 feet away from a herd of elephants - now that is mind blowing. You could hear the hooves of the zebra running, watch hippos fighting, be eye to eye with giraffs. During breakfast after the flight, Daniel's wife Joanna and Christopher took us looking for our first lion- AND WE FOUND HIM. He just sauntered right in front of our stopped vehicle while the zebras and gazelles stood frozen behind us.In addition to the hot air balloon we actually took a small skiff out on a lake filled with hippos. Now that is an experience you don't have everyday. During the morning and afternoon game drives we saw tons of babies - lions, giraffes, zebras, whorthogs, gazelles, monkeys, etc., etc. We saw over 30 varieties of animals, plus birds and reptiles.Kenya is a magical place. I wanted to see it before the advances of civilization change it forever. Lion World Travel gave me an affordable, but five star way to accomplish my dream.

Great Company!. I came across this company through Travelzoo and what a find. They offered so many options and at a far more reasonable price. In addition we worked with Cheryl Gould who was a true "find." Due to personal circumstances, we had to make changes and also had lots of questions. At every step of the way, Cheryl was gracious and available to us. We couldn't ask for more. The trip we ended up taking was to Tanzania and was fabulous. We had recommended this tour group to friends who went to South Africa with them and were also pleased. I have ho hesitation in referring them.

South Africa in Ultimate Style. This was THE MOST AMAZING VACATION we have ever taken and our Travel Agent, Laurandie Du Preez did an outstanding job of guiding us through the entire process. From start to finish, she answered all of our questions and made great recommendations to get the most out of this once in a lifetime experience. We spent time in Cape Town, went on safari in Thornybush Game Reserve, and on to Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe. It surpassed our wildest dreams. This was our 38th anniversary and several hotels provided anniversary desserts, champagne, and beautiful gifts! We were able to see the Big Five and every other kind of animal along the way. We thoroughly enjoyed the helicopter ride in Cape Town, the wine tasting was fabulous, and were amazed with the views on top of Table Mountain. We saw penguins on the beach. The safari was the highlight of our trip as it was the most unique of all of our experiences to date. Our guide and tracker and all staff at the Jackalberry Lodge were wonderful. All accommodations were gorgeous and 5 star quality.

Amazing, Perfect, Wonderful Vacation. If you are considering a trip to South Africa, do not hesitate in calling Lion World Travel in Toronto, Canada. Mary Ellen Chown, our Agent, did a wonderful job of explaining everything, in sending us any materials that we needed, and answering all our questions through the process of booking and getting ready for our vacation. We booked the "Best of South Africa" tour, and added Victoria Falls to our trip. They have contacts through Africa that other tour companies do not have, and everything about our vacation was handled perfectly. We never flew into a city that there was not someone waiting in the airport for us ready to take us off to our destination. All accomodations were top-notch luxury. We felt totally pampered and safely taken care of. We will definitely use Lion World Travel again if we get another opportunity to visit South Africa.

Awesome Trip - A&B. We just returned from a South Africa-Victoria Falls trip arranged by Lion World. We've a wonderful time and the weather was perfect, not hot at all. Cape Town was an ideal stop before visiting the safari. It was pure serendipity that we were able to visit the hospital ship, Africa Mercy, parked in front of our hotel. We saw the big 5 including a pair of lions mating in the middle of the road, a baby elephant less than 3 days old and a male lion eating a buffalo. Love all the hotels and lodges the Lion World arranged. -Even though the total flight time from San Francisco was in excess of 24 hours, it was well worth it. The South African biltong (beef jerky) is a must try.

Most wonderful adventure!. If you are thinking about a safari you MUST speak with Cheryl Gould at Lion World! After speaking with another agent, we were not going to book but after reading reviews about Cheryl we decided to call again and ask for her. She was phenomenal! She answered every question regardless of how inane it was, had a great sense of humor, was extremely informative, and in general just the perfect agent! The safari was exactly as she described...words cannot express the beauty of Kenya and a safari. Animals were indescribable, people were incredibly friendly. One of the best experiences possible!

Top Notch travel experience. A big thank you to your company for a perfect vacation, no snags, no disappointments, just pure bliss! We loved More Quarters because of the location and the rooms were beautiful. The service was perfect and welcoming. A breakfast to die for!!! The helicopter ride surprise was a huge hit as they admitted that it was something they had always hoped to do. What a great 30th birthday present for our son in law. BIG BIG smiles on their faces. And now, the Lion Sands. WOW! It was really amazing. I did not think our safari experience from our last trip could be topped but it was. The rooms were beautiful and pretty much bug free, comfortable and perfectly furnished. The food was really top notch. They have a really good chef and staff. It was a vacation of a lifetime as many would call it but my husband and I are already saving our money and time off to do it again.

Lion World Travel to Kenya was a lifetime experience!. Our safari trip to Kenya was so amazing! Thanks to Laurandie form Lion World for all the help in planning this wonderful trip. I had so many questions about clothes and what to do at the airports and she was right there with the answers. The trip went very smooth and no worry or stress. The accommodations were definitely a 5 star and the staff at all locations were so friendly and helpful. The safaris were incredible and we saw every animal possible including the male lion,(which was my favorite). We had a wonderful guide that was very knowledgeable about every animal, including all the birds and trees. We also met some great people that we will keep in touch with. I have recommended Lion World Travel and Laurandie to several friends and we may return for another safari!Judy and Dennis

Spectacular Lion World Vacation. Our Lion World experience was outstanding. Cheryl was most helpful in providing an itinerary that suited our needs. The luxurious safari lodges were first class with polite staff, excellent cuisine and comfortable rooms. The experience was thrilling. Expert drivers and trackers resulted in safari sightings of The Big Five and many more animals in untamed wilderness. We always felt safe in open land cruisers which seated a maximum of 8 people. This holiday was unlike any we have ever had. We know now, why people say, “It was a trip of a lifetime!”

I highly recommend Lion World Travel!. I just returned from an amazing trip organized by Mary Ellen and Lion World and I can't say enough great things about the planning and the trip. I went with 3 of my girlfriends and between us we had so many questions and Mary Ellen was always prompt and patient with her responses. She always had very good insight and worked hard to make sure that we booked what we wanted. Before we left she continually checked in with us to make sure all our questions were answered.Upon arrival in Kenya, everything was so smooth. It was an incredibly stress-free vacation. I don't think I ever even touched my suitcase, it was in the safari van and then in my room and then back to the safari van. Every detail was thought of and taken care of. We all felt very pampered :)The actual safari was unlike anything I've ever done, it was so incredible! Our guide was beyond amazing, he was so fun and funny and had answers to every single question we asked about Africa, Kenya, animals, culture etc. He also told us great information and kept it really interesting. Even more importantly, he was incredibly respectful of the animals. We saw some safari vans drive off-road (which is illegal) and they would get up into animals faces which felt very invasive to me. I felt like we still saw the animals up-close, but we were respectful of their environment and territory. This was very important to me and I still think we saw almost every single animal very closely (within 10-15 feet).The resorts were all top-notch, beautiful and relaxing. I really dislike staying at any sort of chain hotel because there are so many interesting hotels in this world. I was therefore very impressed with the accommodations, not only were they unique, but they were also luxurious. We got massages at one place, we swam at a couple of the hotels, enjoyed live music and dancing and more. There were so many options and the rooms were wonderful. The staff at each hotel went above and beyond and they were all SO friendly! Overall, I was extremely happy with Lion World and have already recommended them to several friends who I hope will go on safari! It is such an incredible experience and to have it all so organized was such a blessing! I will certainly use this company again in the future....perhaps for a South Africa vacation!

Amazing South Africa Vacation. I just returned from an amazing South Africa Vacation that I had booked with Cheryl Gould at Lion World Travel. Everything was perfect! Loved our accommodations, both in Cape Town at the Twelve Apostles Resort and the Kapama River Lodge by Kruger National Park. The day tours were fantastic! Cheryl is great, always readily available to answer all of my questions and make recommendations. She is extremely professional and knowledgeable. I would book another trip with her in a heartbeat! Thank you for everything Cheryl!

Thank you Cheryl for a Fantastic South Africa Trip via Lion World. Last November I opened an email from Travel Zoo that featured a trip to South Africa through Lion World. We were leaving the next day to go to the Christmas Markets along the Danube. Intrigued, I called and Cheryl Gould answered :-) Thus began a great friendship and an amazing trip. Cheryl had me put down a small deposit for my husband and me since we were going out of the country,. We then firmed things up after I returned as the place for us was being held. The trip did sell out quickly Thanks to Cheryl, I extended our trip to include a couple of other lodges. I also emailed a friend of mine and let her know about the trip and she was also on board. Our trip highlights included:Four nights, three days in Cape Town, four nights at the Ivory Tree Lodge, two nights at the Kapama Buffalo Camp and two nights at the Kapama River Lodge. During our stay we: shopped Cape Town; did the Cape Peninsula and Cape Point Circular Route; did a day trip to Cape Agulhas, the Southern most tip of Africa; stayed at the Ivory Tree Lodge and had six game drives; stayed at both the Kapama Buffalo Camp and the River Lodge and had a fabulous time. (Buffalo Camp was our favorite though all were wonderful)Thank you, Cheryl, for walking me through all of the choices and helping me make the correct decisions that were meant for us. Yes, I could have booked South Africa on my own as that is what I usually do, but I would have missed out on so much and it was a seamless, flawless vacation. We moved from place to place and we were well attended to. All of the transfers happened as they should, nothing went right and everything went right:-) I could not have done it without the expert advisor and knowledge of Cheryl and Lion World. If you are thinking about using Lion World and have the opportunity to go to South Africa, don't hesitate. Our trip was such a value and I have the photos to prove it. Thanks again, Cheryl, all of your advise was perfect.

Cape Town and safari. We just came back from our South Africa trip and we have high praises for Lion World Travel and Maryellen, the travel professional, that helped us arrange our trip. Everything went off without any hitches. They used the best hotel and Safari lodge and we found it to be a great value, side trips and follow up were excellent.

Fantastic South Africa trip through Lion World Travel. I went on a trip to Cape Town and Pilanesberg National Park through Lion World Travel at the end of August-beginning of September. Lion World did an absolutely fantastic job in organizing the overall vacation including side trips. The level of communication with the company through their representative Cheryl was outstanding. When there was a very small omission on the itinerary I was sent and needed clarification in the middle of the trip, they answered my questions almost immediatly.The trip itself was really great. Cape Town was a lot of fun and we particularly enjoyed the Walk to Freedom Tour. Honestly that was the tour I was on the fence most about, but it turned out to be my favorite thing we did while in town (extremly reflective and moving) . Each of the guides for the city tours were very good. The Commodore Hotel (the group stayed in Cape Town) was nice and we have no complaints with that. For those looking for a place to eat at the Waterfront, I recommend Belthazar's. I went there and had what may be my favorite meal of all-time at Belthazar’s. They had a wild game kabob that was just out of this world.The Ivory Tree Lodge (where the group stayed while visiting Pilanesberg) was also a nice facility. The ranger that we had for the week (Leon) was exceptional…and I’m very picky about such things since I’m in a similar field. We saw so much (but not everything off our list) and had an absolutely fantastic time. The lodge was great and they even went the extra mile by gave me a birthday cake since I was celebrating my birthday while we were there.All in all everything went pretty smoothly. After talking with other couples on the tour (we got to be friends with a few of them) it seemed like they had really great experiences as well and over all we were all very satisfied with the services provided.

Fabulous job!!. We were recommended this travel company by a colleague who had used them for his honeymoon. We were a group of 13 travelers, with 8 children aged 6-13. It came off without a hitch!! We had a 10day tour which included Cape Town, and two different game lodges. All transportation was included, all drivers were on time if not early, all flights were coordinated. We did have one family who had joined the reservation after the initial group, which did require some explanation and clarification. But overall would look forward to using them again!

Capetown and Madikwe Safari Lodge. We had a wonderful trip and used Lion Word Tours. Not only did they have the best prices - by far - but the accommodations were excellent and every transfer was on time and very professional. Mary Ellen was an excellent agent at Lion World. She helped (re)arrange our trip after I broke my foot and couldn't go on our original dates. (do get insurance!) Madikwe Park was stunning and our tour guide, JP, was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable. For lack of better words - it was a trip of a lifetime. Lion World Tours did not let us down.

Lion world travel and our memorable SA trip. This was one our family's most memorable trip.From our first contact with Lion World and organizing our trip with help of Smruti Smith who was exceptional,to our hectic but very professionally coordinated trip which went flawlessly I can only say Wow and Thank you to Smruti.Every step was well coordinated.All the hotels were top notch and in grat locations.The attractions were great.Cape Town- beautiful with lots to see and remember-Table Top Mountain,Rubeen Island,Helicpter ride over Cape Town.Visit to wine tasting in Franschhoek.Simply unforgettable.Then on to Johannesburg and onto Hoedspruit for memorable stay at The Jackalberry Lodge ,where Tom and Kailen(Colleen) and the whole staff at the lodge were very accomodating and took care of every minute details.The daily early morning safari,the close proximity with nature and Big 5 was unbelievable and memorable.Then onto Victoria Falls and what a memory it was from the lodge to helicopter rise to walk way across the Fall Breathtaking,the Canopy Zip Line was Thrilling and it was topped off with great Cruise on the river.Next flight back home with life long memories.Pictures do not justify what you see and feel.Thank you Lion World and Smruti to make this happen.

Capetown/Safari Tour. We took the ten day Cape Town, Ivory Tree Lodge Safari trip and found that it exceeded our expectations on all counts. Lion World Tours arranged hotels, transfers, international flights, and optional day tours. Hotels were four and five star, living up to their rating. Transfers and tours were very professional and timely. The safari at Ivory Tree Lodge was outstanding - animals galore, a very knowledgeable guide. Less traveled than Kruger which made it even more attractive to us. A trip of a life time. One added benefit, which I hope others do not have to utilize, was that we had to cut our trip short due to a family emergency. Laurandie, our agent at Lion World Tours, handled our new arrangements with efficiency, thoroughness, and compassion that blew me away. She thought of everything including extending our checkout time to allow us to wait for the flight.

Amazing Safari trip, thanks to Lion World Travel. Just back from 2 weeks in Africa, with stops in Botswana & Zimbabwe, all planned by Cheryl Gould at Lion World Travel. Best trip ever!!! Cheryl had us staying in 5 star places and everything went as planned and more than we expected! Hotels, restaurants, guides & side trips were perfect & no glitches on anything! We emailed her during the trip to ask questions and add on. She was always ready & willing to set up anything we wanted. Never an attitude or too busy to accommodate us. I highly recommend Cheryl for your South Africa trip.

Best tour company we have ever used. Cheryl Gould from Lion World Travel is a rock star. We had an AMAZING time. Easily the best vacation we've ever had. Everything that she arranged - from the hotel transfers, to the guides, hotels, extra trips, etc. - were five stars, and always executed professionally and with the best service possible. We were thrilled by the service provided by Cheryl, Lion World Tours, and their affiliates in Africa. We won't hesitate to use them again for any future trips to Africa and refer all our friends your way.  Of course, the vacation itself was breathtaking - we loved Cape Town and the safari! Africa is such a special place, we cannot wait to return.

A Vacation of a Lifetime!. Special "Thank you" to Mary Ellen Chowan for her detailed pan for our 2-plus weeks in South Africa, Zimbabwe, and Botswana. Every detail was covered and scheduled with her staff, so they were early for every reservation. The Hotels and Lodges were First Class as were the meals, the staff at each, and the Guides as well as Trackers. We combined "Cape Town Highlights" with "The Best of Victoria Falls and Chobe" for a very exciting vacation. Thank you, Mary Ellen, your team, and the staff's at each and every stop.JTR & RAR

Perfect Vacation. Just returned from Safari in Absolute Style booked through Lion World Travel. Everything was exactly as promised and was a truly amazing experience. Our consultant was Mary Ellen and she was terrific with her knowledge of Africa to her very pleasant personality to her patience with our never ending questions. Everything great you read about this company is true. They are first rate and provide wonderful, friendly service.

The Only Company I Will Book My Africa Travel With!. We came across Lion World Tours through a deal listed on Travelzoo. We booked the "Pride of South Africa" package. From start to finish, Lion World took care of us. This was the first time my husband and I would be visiting Africa, and after having such a wonderful experience, I will only book future trips to Africa with Lion World. I would even book the same package, we loved it so much!Doreen Steenbok took care of us and was kind enough to answer any and all questions we had before and after we booked the package. She answered our emails in a timely fashion and was always patient with us when we bombarded her with questions. Even when Doreen was on vacation, Leeann Phayre-Mallo, answered questions so that we didn't have to wait several days for an answer. Our itinerary, tickets and additional information were mailed to us along with nice luggage tags and a beautiful case to hold passports and documents for the trip. It was a really nice touch.The "Pride of South Africa" package we booked made us feel like we were living a life of luxury. We never had to worry about where we were going to go and how we were going to get there - everything was taken care of and laid out for us in the itinerary. The accommodations included in our package were outstanding, and we always felt safe wherever we went. Lion World definitely has great connections with wonderful hotels, tours and such in South Africa. Even the nice little touches - greeting cards and treats upon arrival in Cape Town and safari from Lion World, were so appreciated. Even after our trip, receiving a card in the mail from Lion World, was a really nice gesture to show their appreciation for our business.When we have an opportunity to return to Africa, we will no doubt book with Lion World Tour again. It was an amazing trip, and thanks to this wonderful company, we (to quote them) did come home "with a lifetime of memories."

March 2014. We experienced Lion World Travel's tour "South Africa in Absolute Style". We are US 1st time travelers to SA, and want to thank Lion and the travel staff for a perfect experience. 1st class in every way.

Lion World Tours Luxury Kenya. We're a few days back from our Lion World Luxury Kenya trip via Libery Africa - I can't say enough good things. Everything was so well organized with lovely staff and excellent lodging. Leeann with Lion World was responsive to our pre trip questions and even rearranged our Ethiopian Air seating for best comfort. Our Liberty Africa guides were highly professional and knowledgeable - Abdi drove us around and made extra effort to accommodate our special interests. We saw all the big 5 (even leopard!) and Abdi seemed to know everything about even the most obscure birds etc. I am already shopping for our next Lion World trip.

Amazing beyond our wildest dreams !!. I cannot tell you just how absolutely amazing our "Safari in Absolute Style" with Lion World Tours was...truly perfect! I saw the offer on Travel Zoo in Jan 2013 & told my girlfriend about it...we booked it when it popped up again in March. We worked with Cheryl Gould, who was wonderfully patient as we quizzed her on best dates, weather & such, & we went Feb 24, 2014-March 6, 2014, and couldn't have been happier! From the very get go, our flights on South African Airways were perfect! The weather was divine, 90 degrees average in Cape Town...absolutely gorgeous! The properties were just wonderful (Twelve Apostles in Cape Town & Madikwe Safari Lodge for safari - see my separate reviews for these) We so appreciated the five star quality of both accommodations and the way every single detail was perfectly coordinated! Although we are both very experienced international travelers, as two (shall we say, middle aged ;) women traveling together, we felt so incredibly safe & well taken care of - the service everywhere we went was just terrific! All I can say, is you simply must go!! We are planning another trip back next year for my 20th wedding anniversary, and we're even going to bring my husband along this time :))) It really is the very best way to experience the best of both worlds...Cape Town and a Safari, simply A-M-A-Z-I-N-G and the value can't be beat!

Amazing adventure. This was truly the trip of a life time. After a dismal start with a delay at JFK due to mechanical issues, this trip turned out to be one of the best ever. Doreen from Lion World handled all of the rearranging of our schedule so that all of the details were resolved prior to arriving in Cape Town. The accommodations were first class, the tours were magnificent and the Madikwe Safari Lodge was an incredible experience. We definitely will go back to Africa, and we will definitely use Lion World again.

Awesome safari to Kenya...somewhat good service domestically. Found a great safari to Kenya on Travel Zoo, and pursued it since the price was extremely reasonable. It was a 7 day trip to Nairobi, upon which you were picked up and taken to Lake Elmenteita and Masai Mara to see the big five...and more. Worked with Lion Travel to secure arrangements and lock in dates. Took the trip, which as it turns out was outsourced to Liberty African Safaris in Kenya. Accommodations were at three Serena hotels, which are extremely nice, upscale, well maintained and provide all the amenities - pool, fitness facility, wi-fi, laundry and more. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were included in the package. With just eleven people in our group, we were given two very good touring vans (that could accommodate 8 each if necessary) with pop-up tops that made viewing extremely safe, easy and fun. Having not gone on such a trip, we were very reluctant at first to sign up, but went to see how it would work out. To our pleasure, the trip turned out to be extremely fun, exciting and memorable. We saw stuff in a week that we could never see elsewhere. To be honest, we had a blast. For a trip like this, you need four things: good weather, accommodations, guide and luck to find the animals. Fortunately, Liberty hit home runs in all three. The Serena hotels we stayed were all top notch. Our driver was extremely aggressive, safety conscious, knowledgeable and likable. He knew everything about the local culture, animals and over 400 birds since he was studying to take people on birding expeditions. The weather cooperated too. During our stay, it was extremely nice, not to cold in the mornings/evenings (low 60s), not too hot in the afternoons (around 80). We saw every animal you could imagine - lions, elephant, rhino, cape buffalo, cheetah, giraffe, crocodile and more close up (some within 10 feet) in their natural habitat. Everyone in our group were completely engaged, fun to be around and easy going. This was without a doubt, the trip of a lifetime. It couldn't have been any better. Every day was like watching Animal Kingdom on TV, with the guide (Peter) answering every question thrown his way. With books close at hand, he would open to the page of our question to provide additional pictures of the bird or animal of discussion. He was a real expert!Our only issue with the trip dealt with Lion World Travel. The trip was scheduled to depart from Washington Dulles. We purchased an add-on flight through Lion World Travel to get from our home to Dulles on the date of departure for the sole purpose of making it a single itinerary. This was communicated very clearly up front to the agent. However, just days before departing, we learned upon checking with the airlines that the domestic itinerary was "not" connected to the international leg of the trip, and that baggage fees would be charged. We also found multiple other mistakes. Upon notifying Lion World Travel, the agent did not take responsibility, blaming the airline for problems. Similar problems were noted with seating arrangements, that were fortunately corrected beforehand. We were not at all impressed with Lion World Travel, but were extremely delighted with Liberty Africa Safaris. They went above and beyond to ensure our group stayed at the very best accommodations, saw the big five and more in their natural surroundings, and were driven around with extremely knowledgeable guides, all at a very reasonable price. If you go to Kenya for a safari, ensure Liberty African Safaris is at the other end because they deliver!One final note. Given the recent terrorist incident at the local mall last fall, we were very concerned about our safety in Kenya before departing on the trip, especially around Nairobi. However upon arriving, our fears were set aside given the fact we stayed at hotels that took significant effort to protect us. From going through two security checks at that Nairobi hotel (checked the car upon entering the compound, then everyone passed through a security checkpoint equipped with metal detectors to get into the hotel), along with gates surrounding the two hotels in the wild and constantly revolving security guards, at no time did we feel threatened.

Trip of a Lifetime!!. Best. Trip.Ever! Everyday was an adventure, lodging was top notch, and everything was extremely well coordinated. Mary Ellen with Lion World tours answered every question we had, coordinated side trips and made the entire experience super easy so that we could spend less time worrying about travel arrangements and more time enjoying ourselves. Victoria falls was amazing and highly recommend the add-on while there to Livingstone island. Tasted great wine in Cape town. Everything was INCREDIBLE! I would give this trip 10 stars if possible. Thank you Mary Ellen and Lion World Tours!

Best Trip Ever. After plunking down a bunch of bucks to a company I never heard of for a first time trip to Africa, my wife and I were just a little bit concerned. Mary Ellen (from here on out known as the "fabulous" Mary Ellen or the "sainted" Mary Ellen) had promised the moon. "Really, the hotels are very nice. You won't be disappointed". Sure. What she failed to note was that we also got the sun and stars thrown in. We did Capetown, to Kruger, to Johannesburg, to Victoria Falls. Everything was as billed and much more than we really expected, very fine hotels with great meals. The buffet breakfasts at the Table Bay Hotel in Cape Town and at the Michelangelo in Johannesburg were better than the best fancy Sunday brunches I've ever had. The game drives were amazing, being in a private enclave within the park with its own road system. We saw everything. Guides were top notch. Staff was gracious. Ok, I'm getting long winded. Sorry. But Lion World Tours deserves its five stars.

Thank you to Smruti and Lion World!. This was the first trip to Africa for us and hopefully not the last. Smruti Smith was so helpful in planning our trip and always there for us. The luxurious accommodations, excellent food, all our flights, transfers, and tours and lets not forget the memorable safari outings. What more can I say?. Every review of this fabulous company is excellent...AND from start to finish, this trip was flawless. I did South Africa in absolute style, with Victoria Falls add on, and every single piece of the puzzle fit together. The flights, the pick ups, the hotels, the food, the safari.....AMAZING. My expectations were exceeded 100 fold, and I consider this trip to be the best I have ever taken. She is patient and will answer every question you have. WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? GO MAKE THAT CALL!

All You Have To Do Is...Show Up. Lion World Tours and its friendly, efficient and go-beyond- the-norm staff is amazing! We did the Affordable South Africa Tour earlier this month. Mary Ellen did EVERYTHING for us from answering questions to offering alternatives to finalizing all of our side excursions! The entire package was MARVELOUS. I never wanted to be "stuck" with a group of strangers in large tour groups that were locked in to a strict schedule (like cattle at a round-up).Lion World and their sister company, Thompson's, made every aspect of this adventure a personalized itinerary. The tour guides were always prompt. They were knowledgeable on everything from the flora and fauna to the political and economic history of S. Africa. They even took us to places that were not specifically part of the tours. Great surprises. Our tour vehicles were 9-seaters and were rarely full - everyone had a good view. We were given options of seeing additional sights and were able to stop for photos almost anywhere.The meals included in the trip were FABULOUS: A huge breakfast buffet every morning at The Commodore Hotel in Cape Town; breakfast AND dinner buffets at the Bakubang Lodge with a cook-out after the safari in Pilanesberg, and an authentic S. African "family style" dinner at Gold Restaurant In Cape Town with continuous entertainment and wonderful food!The Bakubang Lodge is set within the game preserve and we could see elephants, warthogs, and monkeys cavorting in and around the pond from our seats on the dining patio.All the comforts of home and then some were included in this amazing trip, including the beds being turned down and a chocolate on the pillow. Everywhere we went the people were friendly and helpful. You are free to explore on your own or make last-minute reservations for the multitude of tours available.I lost contact info for the people I met on this trip and Mary Ellen - and Lion World Tours - has gone above and beyond to help me get in touch with them.I'm looking forward to exploring more of Africa and I won't do it with anyone except LION WORLD TOURS!!!

"Fabulous Vacation Package - Thanks Cheryl and Lion World. If you are trying to decide on a tour company to visit Africa, look no further and call Lion World Tours right away!!! My husband and I booked the "South Africa In Absolute Style" for our anniversary. Cheryl arranged everything-- flights, transfers, tours, meals, luxury accommodations (Table Bay Hotel in Cape Town and Jackalberry Safari Lodge in Hoedspruitt). Cheryl and Lion World Tours made our vacation absolutely INCREDIBLE!!! Everything was top notch!! As an anniversary gift, Cheryl even arranged for champagne and wine to be delivered to our room!Jackalberry Lodge had the greatest staff and the most amazing food! We saw the big five and more. We can't wait to go back and we will definitely book through Lion World! When you receive your travel documents, check your flights and make sure your name matches exactly as on your passport.

Best vacation - truly trip of a lifetime.... Lion World Tours' brochure is like a box of chocolates - and I want to try them all! This was our first trip with Lion World Tours and it won't be our last. Incredible value for dollars paid. The entire "Safari in Absolute Style" trip was first rate - accommodation, meals, transfers and inclusions. Everything worked like clockwork - just one unfortunate glitch at the end when our departure flight from Madikwe Game Reserve was changed and none of us were told, including our field ranger who took us on a fabulous last-morning game drive with coffee break in the bush. On our return we were greeted with the news that we had to leave in under an hour instead of 3 hours - eat breakfast/freshen up/change/pack/arrange our tips/etc. The lodge staff was able to negotiate an extra half hour for us but it was still a mad scramble and a very unfortunate way to end the trip. I advised Lion World of this on our return to make sure they were aware of it so it doesn't happen to anyone else. They responded promptly and assured me they would be looking into this since it is not in keeping with the way they do things. They are a first class operation and I have no doubt this is the first time this has happened to anyone. We are recommending Lion World to all our friends and can't wait to take another trip through them!

Awesome trip - Thanks Smurti & Lion World!. We booked our trip with Lion World Tours and Smurti was an awesome agent. She took care of every detail, organized the travel, transfers, hotels an safari so it ran smoothly - not to mention how wonderful it was to see the big 5 and so much more! "South Africa in Absolute Style" was the best! We're ready to go back again.

Not Your Average Tour!!!!!. I have never experienced a tour like this one to South Africa and Victoria Falls. We took 7 flights in all, had 3 hotels ,many many airport transfers and safaris, most of our meals and a wide variety of tours and experiences. Every flight transfer safari, hotel, and meal was on time and exceptional. I wasn't expecting everything to be such a high quality, but it was. Seriously, the hotels were highly rated and the Kapama Resort where we had our safaris couldn't have been better. I expected to spend three times as much for such a high quality trip. If you are lucky enough to book with Lion Tours you will be guaranteed the trip of a lifetime

Fabulous South Africa tour. A safari was on our bucket list plus our daughter and husband were traveling for 18 months and Africa was on their itinerary. So we wanted to meet them there. I started to research a trip and it was mind boggling. My husband found this tour to South Africa with Victoria Falls add on from Lion World Tours. I was skeptical because I Hate tours with a lot of people. But this was a max of 16 and we didn't have to be with them all the time. This trip ended up being amazing. We had great fun with the few other people who booked the same tour. All the accommodations were 5 star except for the Victoria Falls Safari Lodge., but we loved it. ( no bugs as one person reported). The bathrooms could use some more elbow grease, but i understand they are renovating the rooms. The honeymoon couple upgrade their room and said it was very nice. The reason I like the VFSL was that it was very low key, there was a watering hole, and you felt you were more in the bush than if you would be at the VF Hotel.... For the adventurers if you go in the dry season do the white water rafting... 17 miles of rapids with 3 level 5 rapids and a level 6 which you have to get out and walk your raft around.... Plus hiking down to the rapids and then hiking back up... Not for the faint of heart...In Cape Town we stayed at the Table Bay Hotel on the water. Fabulous hotel, wonderful food, service and great location. We rented a car and drove to the Cape of good hope and the point. Saw wild ostriches and baboons plus the penguins... Great day trip. The people in South Africa couldn't have been nicer. All the tour guides were very informative and helpful. For Safari we stayed at the Jackalberry Lodge in the Thorny Bush Reserve. It was fabulous!!!!!!! The staff was so attentive, food fabulous, safari guide and ranger competent.. What ever animal we wanted to see they found... I am ready to go back...Pat from Lion World Tours was great to work with helping us arrange flts for the 6 family members scattered across the Us, Mexico and Asia. I highly recommend Lion World Tours . They are efficient, helpful and a great value...I would use them again. Thanks Lion World Tours for a memorable South Africa and family trip.

Top Drawer. My husband and I did the "South Africa in Absolute Style" trip with the Victoria Falls add-on last September. It was fantastic. We are not much for "tours" or organised holidays but given the vastness of the Continent thought it was appropriate to look to something organised for this trip. Everything was top drawer - the accommodation, the food, the service, and the sights. I cannot say enough about the service throughout in South Africa - a little less than expected in Zimbabwe after The Twelve Apostles in Cape Town and the Madikwe Safari Lodge..Doreen at Lion World was great. If you go to Victoria Falls - check out Lion Encounter - definitely bucket list material!!!

" Safari in Style" was REALLY in Style!!. My wife and I just arrived back from South Africa and Zimbabwe with Lion World Tour's "Safari in Style" including the Victoria Falls add-on trip. The trip was outstanding! From start to finish, Lion World Tours and their Agents handled everything seamlessly. We were supposed to go on this trip last year, but because of Family illness, we had to cancel our November 2012 dates. Knowing I had no recourse, Leeann and Mary Ellen still assisted and were terrific in trying to help us rebook at a reasonable cost. GREAT customer service!A few observations on the trip: The 12 Apostles Hotel in Capetown was beautiful. The setting on the ocean with the Table Mountains in the back was stunning. The Hotel is a wedding Mecca for the Capetonians. In the four nights we were there, four separate weddings. Unfortunately, our room (206) was just a few rooms away from the Reception Party venue. After the second night, we thought we were starring in "The Wedding Crashers", and let the front desk know. To their credit, they immediately changed us to another room, away from "wedding central". The food in the grill, bar (fabulous drinks and view!!), and Azure fine dining restaurant was excellent. Don't miss the breakfast buffet with oysters and to-die-for Cape Seed Bread. We moved from there to the Madikwe Safari Lodge. Spectacular!! Absolutely beautiful individual lodges with a pool in each. Outdoor showers, as well as inside. The personnel were wonderful, helpful and cheery. Our guide was Nicky. She was knowledgeable and great fun. She did a great job in each of the 6 safaris we were on with her in finding photo opportunities of the awesome animals. Next, an overnight in Jo'Burg at the Michelangelo Hotel in Sandton. Gorgeous Hotel! Short Stay. We finished the trip by taking the optional Victoria Falls add-on segment. We opted to pay a little more and stay at The Victoria Falls Hotel, an old British Colonial gem built in 1904, overlooking the Falls. The standard hotel on this segment is the Safari Lodge. Our friends stayed there and were not very impressed. They were visited by small insects that we in the South euphemistically call "Palmetto Bugs". All the other properties are terrific. It makes sense to finish in a "terrific" property.This trip was and excellent value, offered by very customer centric people: Lion World Tours !!!

Excellent adventure with Lion World Tours. It was an amazing almost 2 weeks put together by Lion World. We stayed at the breathtaking 5* Twelve Apostles in Cape Town which has to be seen to be appreciated. Lion World arranged some local tours around which ran like clockwork. Our next stop was the Madikwe Game Reserve where we spent 3 days and went on 6 exciting game drives and stayed at the most comfortable bush cabins with spectacular views. Our stay here was the highlight of our trip. The last adventure took us to the famous Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe where we stayed at another 5 star resort, the Victoria Falls Safari Resort. From start to finish we had no problems with air travel,accomodations and all the extras professionaly handled by Lion World Tours.

Best, most effortless, vacation ever!. What a beyond fantastic trip to South Africa! Lion World Tours literally took care of every detail flawlessly - and it left us comfortable and at ease. Travel to Africa with Lion World Tours. Just returned from a wonderful trip to South Africa and Zimbobwe booked with the help of Lion World Tours out of Toronto ans specifically, Cheryl Gould. 110% satisfied! Great service and a great value!. I booked my dream vacation with Lion World Tours- and it lived up to everything I imagined and more! Great job by Lion World Tours. Had never used them, but totally satisfied. While the Safari part of the trip had some disappointments, Lion World Tours more than did their part. I give them an A+

Attention to Detail. We booked our trip of a lifetime Through Liberty Travel and Lion World Tours. Deb and Andreas really did make it a trip of a lifetime. There was attention to every detail. 100% Delivered the Goods. Travelled to South Africa in October 2012. Stayed in Capetown, then went into the bush outside of Johannesburg. Doreen was our contact-first class from day one. Well done!!

A Fantastic 40th thanks to Lion World (and Smruti Smith)!!. October 2011 (yes, this review is late ;): I was turning 40 and wanted to do something fabulous! Lion World really rolls out the red carpet for it's customers. Thanks Smruti for coordinating the trip of a lifetime for me! I plan to visit SA again soon and will only be traveling one way -- through Lion World! Thanks again Smruti! (jm - Maryland)

Lion World Tours-Kenya. What an experience! What we saw was like living National Geographic. Lion World provided all 5 star lodges, Serena properties, food, and service through Liberty Travel in Kenya. Our driver, Paul, was knowledgeable, patient, and always was on time to give us the best experience. We literally saw thousands of animals, many were up close and personal. Paul knew how to find them. We traveled many rough roads so if you have bad backs, it might be a little difficult. The countryside is interesting and we really enjoyed seeing the native people in their habitats. You would miss this if you were flying from one lodge to another. We felt safe as there is security and fences around all the lodge areas. Our days were spent in the vans so don't think you are going to hang out at a resort. This was not the purpose of this trip. The purpose was to see as much of Kenya and the animals as you could in 6 days. We did and we feel our money was well spent. Thank you, Lion World and Liberty Travel.

top level, high class travel package for low cost! What a deal!. We are very thankful for all André Steynberg's help and coordination of this great package thru Lion World Tours.In January 2012 my mom, aunt and I took a trip of a lifetime to South Africa.We all agree that it was a top level, high class travel package. We feel so thankful for the great value which Lion World Tours offered and executed so well from Travel Zoo. The two Legacy Hotels (The Commodore Hotel in Cape Town and the Bakubung Bush Lodge in Pilanesburg) were stellar!The carefree days in Cape Town were sunny and warm around 28 degrees Celsius and were most full and rewarding. The down time, (when we were not doing a Lion World Tour itinerary item), we filled with our own little trips to Kirstenbosh Gardens, Robben Island, The Two Oceans Aquarium and shopping and dining the V&A Waterfront. The travel desk at the Commodore Hotel had an outstanding employee, Pia. She helped us arrange this day trips.Some Highlights for us where:• Commodore Hotel Location, walking distance to the waterfront so we could be creative with the down town and evenings• My fair Cape tour to see the Penguins at Boulders Beach, Southern Light House and Cape of Good Hope Beaches (with the option which added on a boat ride to Seal Island, and Lunch near Simonstown) were fantastic!• We love the Cheese and Wine Tasting & Tour at Fairview Vineyards in Stellanbosh / Paarl at http://www.fairview.co.za/• We enjoyed the morning Table Mountain Cable Car Ride• The Game Drives from Bakubung Bush Lodge into Pilanesburg Park were great. The guides they had were very knowledgeable and safe. We had one Guide from Bakubung: Peter, which even changed a flat time while on the game drive with efficiency and ease. We saw Rhino, Elephant, Giraffe, Zebra, Gnu, blue wildebeest, snake, chameleon, impala and monkeys. We heard lions roaring, but never made a visual contact.• We loved the Bakubung Bush Lodge and were so glad we did not stay at Sun City (after we spent a few hours there looking around. It’s too man made for our taste and a little bit like Las Vegas)• South African Airways – Wow what an airline! Smooth flights, always arriving early into the airports, lots of food, water and movies/TV shows. Free beer & wine, socks, toothbrush, eyeshade, pillows, and blankets! We think it is the best airline we’ve flown!And finally, to end our trip, we have enclosed a picture of us when we were fortunate enough to do the hot air balloon ride over Pilanesburg National Park thru Air trackers / Game trackers.All the Thompson Tour representatives were prompt, professional, kind and fantastic. Again, thank you for all your and their help. We are extremely satisfied and can’t wait to use Lion World Tours / Thompson’s Tours in the future!Best Regards,The "P" family from Connnecticut

Fantastic trip to Capetown & Lion Sands Resort (Kruger National Park). The Lion Tours package to Capetown and Lion Sands Resort outside of Kruger was incredible. First class accomodations, service and safaris. The highlight was all of the animals - we saw the Big 5 and more. Quality time was spent observing the animals, with a lifetime of memories and pictures. The Capetown hotel and Lion Sands lodges were fantastic, and service at each was 5-Star!

This tour company offers first class service all the way!. As a lone traveller and first time visitor to South Africa, I could not wish for a better company to use. Their Canadian consultant Doreen is an ex-pat Zimbabwean. She was wonderful and patient with all my questions. And although I took their South Africa in Style tour, I added Victoria Falls and the accommodations were 5Star all the way. The guides who are mostly with their local agency Thompson Touring, so knowledgeable, pleasant and accommodating in every way. Highly recommend them and would book any African travel with them again!

Once in a lifetime experience!. My husband and I decided to plan a trip to South Africa. I spent weeks piecing it together on my own and quickly realized that it was not going to be cheap. Between the flights to South Africa, flights within the country, airport transfers, and hotels, I started to worry that we might not be able to afford it. I stumbled across Lion World Tours online one day and sent a request for more information. I was contacted within a day by André Steynberg with Lion World Tours and instantly liked him. The package they offered was close to what we wanted, but we wanted some extra time in Cape Town and didn't want some of the tours included in the package. André was fantastic and made all of the changes we wanted while still staying at the budget we requested. The total price of the package, which included flights from a location outside of where the package specified, airport transfers, most meals, 5 star hotels, game drives, etc... was significantly lower than what I had been able to find on my own and the lodging was way nicer! I constantly e-mailed André with questions all the way up until our departure date and he always responded promptly and never got annoyed.The actual trip was incredible and all of the pieces arranged by Lion World Tours went flawlessly. Every airport transfer was on time, every flight was confirmed, every reservation was outstanding. Our package include the Twelve Apostles Hotel in Cape Town and Jackalberry Lodge in the Thornybush Private Game Reserve. Both are 5 star resorts that lived up to their ratings and when we checked in there was always a hand-written card from Lion World Tours welcoming us. It was so nice not to worry about confirming every last detail of our trip and knowing that André and Lion World Tours had it covered. I would highly recommend booking a package through them! My husband and I have already been back on their website trying to decide where our next adventure with Lion World Tours will take us!

First Class Says It All!. We used Lion World to book our September 24 to October 2 trip to Capetown for four days and Tinga Private Game Lodge in Kruger NP. They will also arrange day tours for you as well as packages.I fly a lot in the US, and I thought that South African Airways was superb. The meals, even if they are airline, were very good, and the pacing of snacks throughout the flights was very good. Better than what we are used to. All of our connections had ample time, and all of the flights beat their ETA. Lion World's agent in Cape Town, Thompson's, was very well organized. We normally handle all of our own bookings and plans, so it's been awhile since we've relied on a tour organizer; but the way our tour was organized was obviously well planned. We stayed at More Quarters, on Nicol Street just off Kloof Street, and it was even better than we had seen on the web, or expected. They run a fine operation. The breakfasts were very good. The rooms were excellent. We had a double bedroom, which gave us more room to spread out our luggage, but also enabled us to appreciate the care that went into the room designs. The staff was very helpful for local advice. We had one included tour to Stellenbosch and did the rest of Cape Town ourselves. We booked a private guide for a day to tour the Peninsula and down to the Cape of Good Hope.Transfers and timing to the airport for the flight to Mpumalanga were excellent. The same organization was apparent at the Kruger end. Obviously they do this a lot, but it was still nice to see. The ride to Kruger and Tinga, about 80 Km, an hour and a half, was very scenic and interesting. As for Tinga. in a word, excellent. We have already decided to go back to Kruger, as well as other parks in Africa. However, Tinga was just a fine way to get introduced to Kruger and high-end game lodges. It may have spoiled us. We spent three days there.The rooms were picture perfect, the staff were excellent, the food was superb, and the game drives outstanding. Of course the main contributor to the drives, besides being able to see the animals (and just FYI, on our very 1st drive we were presented with three male lions and their obviously just killed Cape Buffalo, who they were in the process of having for dinner, and all meals for the next three days), was the driver/ranger and spotter. Everyone had nothing but high praise for the guys driving the Rovers and spotting the game. We find it interesting to discuss culture and life with foreigners that we meet overseas and our Ranger was excellent and open to talking about his life and his villages. And beyond that, his knowledge of the park, its animals and birds, plants and ecological system made for very intelligent and educational conversation. Everything about Tinga was first class.We work with Ethne at Lion World who was very helpful, and, as I noted before, on our next trip back to Africa Lion World will be our first stop.

Best. Vacation. Ever.. I've always wanted to go to South Africa. When I saw the deal on Travelzoo, I thought, ok this is a sign. My brother had some time off so we bit the bullet and bought the package to go. We bought the South Africa In Style. Smruti Smith was our agent. She booked all the flights to accommodate our needs and got us into the Table Bay Hotel on the dates we wanted. What a beautiful hotel. We've never been treated so well. It was right on the waterfront, a very safe and lively area & connected directly into the large shopping complex. Concierge helped to book all our activities. Before the trip, Smruti sent over a detailed itinerary in a travel pouch. I couldn't have been more pleased with the whole experience with them. When we were connecting in DC, we had some trouble finding our flight because the airline had listed our flight under the city where we were going to have the technical stop instead of the final destination of Johannesburg. We called Smruti and she did everything she could to help us out. She was always available and easy to contact by phone or email. The airport transfers were smooth - they had our names on a card and picked us up from each airport. The accommodations were lovely as well. The Table Bay Hotel has a classy breakfast, a patio with a view of Table Mountain, and excellent service. It's also walking distance(minutes) from restaurants , shops, bars, and the ferry to Robben Island. For the safari, we stayed at the Jackalberry Lodge. The rangers there were knowledgable and we got to see the big five. The outdoor shower and private game viewing deck was also a plus, especially after the busy days in Capetown. It was the best trip ever ....wine tasting, Robben Island, shopping, Cape Point, safari and shark cage diving. I hope to go back again very soon. I would recommend Lion World to anyone thinking about visiting Africa. Book with Smruti - she was awesome. She even sent a letter to my apartment to say welcome back!

Lion World Tours. Our family went to South Africa last Christmas holiday. We booked all of our accommodations and flights with Lion World Tours based in Toronto, Canada. We worked with Lucille and Cheryl. Their knowledge was excellent. They were always available for us to ask questions. They were very helpful.  We went to Capetown and stayed at the Commodore Hotel. It was a great location and had an excellent breakfast. We also went on safari and stayed at the Jackalberry Lodge in Thornybush. The staff and accommodations were excellent. We were only in Johannesburg for one night and stayed at the Michaelango. It was the perfect location and we had 2 beautiful rooms. We also travelled to Vicoria Falls and stayed at the Victoria Falls Safari Lodge. The views were spectacular.Our trip was excellent and a large part of that was because of the excellent service, knowledge and expertise of the people that we worked with at Lion World Tours.Their knowledge was outstanding. They also worked within the budget that we had outlined from the beginning of the planning process.We travelled with teens and a younger child and we had lots of questions re;food, transfers, sleeping arrangements. The people at Lion World Tours went to the extreme in making our trip organized and accommodating all of our requests.I would highly recommend Lion World Tours. We have extreme confidence that they can make your trip as memorable as ours.
